Title: Red Kite Tree Tent - Ynys Affalon
Description: Escape to one of these two fabulous Tree Tents. Suspended high above the canopy it‚Äôs time to appreciate life from a new perspective. Featured on George Clarke‚Äôs Amazing Spaces these Tree Tents are a feat of aviation technology. Tree Tent comes complete with fire pit outdoor kitchen and shower with hot water. You‚Äôll discover a comfortable bed and cosy wood burning stove. Part of the Red Kite Estate along with our barn and its sister tree tent the first ever built in the UK Dragons Egg. The space The space\nThe true joy of this place is how wonderfully simple it is (aviation technology aside). Days are filled with fireside discussions wildlife watching and stunningly beautiful walks. With the nearest mobile signal a ten minute walk away it‚Äôs a great place to ditch the digital and truly escape. Head over the bridge to your own private deck that happily houses a clever outdoor-kitchen and shower (complete with hot water). It‚Äôs the perfect spot to fry up breakfast whilst basking in peace and tranquility. There is also a flushing toilet situated just up the hill.And don‚Äôt worry you‚Äôre not totally left to your own devices on arrival you can expect bed linen towels and a load of dry wood and kindling. If you feel the need to leave your new found homestead in the trees then the local area has lots of suitably chilled things to do. Head out on a moorland walk to take in some magical views - and perhaps even grab a pint at the local pub en route. Further afield the stunning Elan Valley a landscape bursting with impressive dams and reservoirs is well worthy of an explore. And for those needing supplies - and perhaps a flat white - then the friendly market town of Builth Wells is just down the road.Other things to note\nYou are entering a remote woodland hideaway for a digital detox: there is very patchy mobile signal and limited internet connectivity.

Title: Az Alom Cabin - Treehouse Tree to Nature Cabin
Description:
Come and spend a romantic stay with a couple or family on the Domaine de l Arbre in Cabane

A very pretty forest of 5 hectares shelters 8 beautiful huts they all have the dream names unique and unprecedented.

They are housed in centuries-old trees out of sight in osmosis with nature.

The site is preserved your peace is assured. Nature is everywhere

A treehouse to indulge relax and go where no one will be looking for you! The space The space
Cabin perched in trees 8 meters high.
This cabin is beautiful. Its access via a board walkway and its platform adjoining 3 individual beds seduce them to the highest degree. It has a capacity of 3 people. Guest access Guest access
You will have access to the entire cabin forest and park.
Sanitary facilities (showers and toilets) are at the reception a 3-minute walk. Other things to note Other things to note
Are you ready for an unusual stay?

Title:
Cabane Entre Les Pins
üå≤üèïÔ∏èüå≤
Description:
Rustic cabin between the pines 3 meters high and 28 square meters on the banks of the Austreberth River üå≤üèïÔ∏èüå≤ The space The space
Our cabin between the pines is a great alternative for those looking for contact with nature and want to rest enjoy together or have fun with family or friends. With 3 meters high and 28 square meters it accommodates 4 people. Located on a 1.2 hectare property by the river Austreberthe our rustic treehouse shares the space with our garden rabbits and dumplings as well as wild dumplings and our beloved khenty mare who loves apples and carrots. A tranquil retreat with efficient thermal insulation and heaters for the colder days. Equipped with a double bed sofa bed kitchenduvet and toilet.


We provide:
Towels
Bed linens and pillows
Kitchen detergent and bathroom soap
Paper towels & toilet paper
Cooking utensils
Coffee tea salt and pepper herbs of provence
What to do in the areas guide

Ill follow us on Instagram @entreespins Guest access Guest access
Guests can use the space around the cabin. Other things to note Other things to note
*When its windy the cabin squeaks but theres nothing to worry about.

*Do not use candles or objects containing a fire inside and outside the cabin as the polyester is flammable.

*Smoking outside only please.

*Our dear pets are allowed but with the commitment of their guardian not to leave them on the bed and furnishing fabrics as well as being responsible for their waste.

*Pine needles often fall on the balcony which doesnt mean the space hasnt been cleaned.

*As this is literally a house between the trees it is common that there are insects and cobwebs outside but with the door closed it will prevent them from entering the cabin.

*With the arrival of the cold season we see that the internal temperature is between 15 and 18 degrees.

*Check-out time must be respected so as not to change the arrival time of the next guest.

Title: Tree Top Cabin with log burner & private hot tub
Description:
The Tree top cabin is situated in our peaceful woodland in the heart of Snowdonia. It has a shower (hot water included)and w.c and washbasin (no hot water in the washbasin).
Lighting is provided from a 12v solar panel system.
A log burner is provided with free wood.
There is a double bed.
The private wood fired hot tub is situated on a balcony overlooking the woodland area.
Pet friendly.
Outside seating is provided. The space The space
This unique glamping experience has everything you need for a restful and idyllic break from everyday life. Wake up to bird song and the sound of the stream. Enjoy your own exclusive hot tub whilst sipping a glass of bubbly. Our Cabin is fully insulated and has everything you need for that perfect rustic getaway without compromising on quality and convenience.

ALL bedding and towels are included in your stay. You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.

A small log burner inside to keep you nice and cosy.

There is limited telephone signal.

Title: Treehouse near Paris Disney
Description:
Above all this is a breathtaking setting that we invite you to discover during your stay at Les H√©bergements de Qu√©necan. We invite you to escape to this natural and unique horizon in the heart of nature.

In the heart of the immense forest of Qu√©n√©can near the water points or overlooking the former iron and steel village of Les Forges enjoy the peace and quiet to take a moment to recharge your batteries away from everyday life. The space The space
Located at a height of 10 meters in an oak of nearly 200 years the Cabane des Girolles takes its name from the good girolles harvests that are made regularly for the happiness of all.

It is equipped with:

A bed in 90
A bed in 140 above
A toilet corner with water reserve dry toilet wipes.
A spacious sunny terrace overlooking the listed village of Les Forges des Salles. Ideal terrace for breakfast or summer evenings.
Extra heating when the need arises.
You can have sanitary showers toilets arranged for you at the reception to enjoy several days of our site.
It is ideal for a couple and a child.

It is accessed by a long fully secured footbridge that will delight young and old alike.

- We remind you that each of our accommodations has a small toilet area as well as a dry toilet - and a sun terrace. Breakfast is included - the evening meal can be delivered by reservation -

Title: Lake huts - treehouses
Description:
The Les Faines cabin perched in a 150-year-old beech tree will make you live an unusual nature experience in Normandy year-round.
We are located 12 km from Dieppe (Seine-Maritime) 2 h from Paris and 3 h from Brussels. The space The space
Nestled in a 150-year-old beech tree 8 m high this hut is oriented northwest : sunset ensured on the terrace (10 m¬≤) between the branches overlooking the horse meadow and you can watch for the passage of animals among others deer who like to sleep nearby.
This hut (10 m¬≤) built with total respect for the tree and its environment accommodates 2 people (adult or 12 years minimum accompanied by an adult).

Access is via a beautiful spiral staircase then via a 15 m long walkway.

It is undoubtedly the easiest access deckhouse combining height and ease.

This hut also gives you exclusive access to another large terrace common to the 3 bridge huts perched 20 m from a 190-year-old beech tree: it is the tallest terrace in France accessible by a magnificent crinoline ladder fully secured ! Change of scenery and relaxation guaranteed !

Without running water or electricity but rustic comfort for a unique adventure in the wild. Water supply (4 l) dry toilet and heating. Bathroom at the reception.Other things to note

Description:
Above all this is a breathtaking setting that we invite you to discover during your stay at Les H√©bergements de Qu√©necan. We invite you to escape to this natural and unique horizon in the heart of nature.

In the heart of the immense forest of Qu√©n√©can near the water points or overlooking the former iron and steel village of Les Forges enjoy the peace and quiet to take a moment to recharge your batteries away from everyday life. The space The space
In a 145-year-old sessile oak tree the Cabane de la Clairi√®re sits 10 meters high.
Close to the Pond du Fourneau on the banks of Morbihan this hut stands out for its very original access: a colimasson staircase that our artists built around an oak barrel a first circular landing and a long footbridge that leads you through the foliage.
The hut with a capacity of 4 people or even 5 (possibility to add a driver) is large and exposed west to make the most of the lighting of the pond that reverberates.
The arrival at the hut is quite spectacular for the attention of subjects to the vertigo we will propose instead another hut !

It includes :

a sitting area with two 90 beds possibility of extra bed
a toilet area with water reserve toilet bowl dry toilet wipes.
a lovely mezzanine with a double bed in 160.
a large terrace where are installed a table and 4 chairs where it will be nice dinner with family or friends...
You can have toilets : showers toilets arranged for you at the reception to enjoy several days of our site.

Title: CABANE DES GIROLLES - IN THE TREES
Description:
Discover the ultimate romance in trees 30 feet off the ground! This luxurious treehouse offers the perfect treehouse lodging in Ohio for a romantic escape. Private setting in the woods on a 38-acre property in the heart of Ohio‚Äôs Amish Country. Enjoy a king bed and a living room with a sofa and sitting chair. A covered porch will help you enjoy the breathtaking treetop views. Come see why these incredible one-of-a-kind Treehouses were featured on HGTV! Were sure youll have an incredible stay! The space The space
Living Room:
Roughhewn beams and split pine planking surround you as you relax in the comfy sofa and matching chair in front of a live edge coffee table. Flip the switch to ignite the fireplace encased in hand-cut stone and curl up with a good book or take a much-deserved nap. You can also catch up on your favorite shows on the large screen TV with cable channels that are mounted above the mantle. Windows on each wall allow plenty of natural light and outdoor beauty to enter your hideaway.

But make sure you spend lots of time outside on the wrap-around balcony. Allow the peacefulness of your wooded retreat to soothe your mind and soul as you rock gently in the rockers and absorb the serenity that surrounds you.

King Bed:
Before snuggling into the King size bed featuring an Amish-made pillow-top mattress resting on an elevated pinewood base make sure you unwind in your private two-person jetted tub. The ceiling-high waterfall fill supplies the hot water that will be jetted over tired muscles creating just the right mood for the perfect night.

Kitchen:
Your kitchen is home to a collegiate-sized refrigerator with a freezer and a 2-burner stovetop. There are ample pots and pans if you feel like making your favorite vacation meal or a microwave oven for heating up the leftovers from one of our amazing restaurants in town. A toaster and drip coffee maker round out the appliances which are at your disposal. The Amish-made wood table and chairs are the perfect spots for breakfast for two.

Bathroom:
A sliding barn door opens to reveal your tiled floor bathroom. An artisanal counter rests on legs made from logs and supports an above counter stone basin. The expertly tiled shower is large enough for two and can start your day or end your night on just the right note.

Description:
A Truly Unique High Elevation Experience Bolted to a Cliffline in the Gorge The space The space
It doesn`t get more extreme or unique than this folks!
Bolted high above the canopy in the Red River Gorge KY Cliff Dweller is now our most extreme and athletic place to spend the night!

After a journey up several hundred suspended stairs welcome to your cliff kitchen bathroom and bedroom for four.

The rocks the views the adventure the solitude. This has it all!

Title: CLEARING HUT - IN THE TREES
Description:
At this time we are fully booked until March 2022 Check out our other listings!
COVID-19 safety measures: 150+ point cleaning & disinfecting checklist performed for every guest health-screening for all guests. We recommend bringing food with you so you can stay put and enjoy nature and quality time in the safety of the woods and our farm.

LIVE LIKE KINGS & PLAY LIKE KIDS in this extraordinary award-winning treehouse.

We are 25x Superhosts! Named the Most Popular Airbnb in SC! The space The space
Why do people travel thousands of miles from around the world to stay in our treehouse? Come and see for yourself!! Transport your spirit and feel a thrill that can only be discovered in the treetops! Experience the one-of-a-kind blend of youthful bliss and grown-up luxury for yourself. The faster you get here the sooner you change your pace and unwind in our wooden paradise.

This luxury treehouse was designed by Seth Bolt (from the band NEEDTOBREATHE) who grew up on Bolt Farm. Larry Bolt (Seths dad) proprietor Eagle Scout and licensed custom home builder has been building & remodeling homes for over 40 years in upstate SC.

Larry and Seth both love creating masterpieces (they built our home from timber they harvested from our land) and this romantic luxury treehouse is one of their finest works of art.

Seth & Tori Bolt were married at Bolt Farm and honeymooned in the treehouse suite. Tori manages branding press and runs the social media pages.

Regina Bolt (Seths mom) the queen & caretaker is one of the top producing real-estate agents in South Carolina because of how much she genuinely cares for others and helping their dreams become reality. She will make sure your stay is comfortable and unforgettable!

WE HAVE HEATING & AIR CONDITIONING! This is a year-round destination. We do have a bathroom with a toilet and washbasin in the treehouse and an amazing outdoor shower with a hot water supply for you to use just a short walk away! Other things to note Other things to note
*Due to high demand (and to make booking fair to everyone) we release more treehouse dates at 12 noon EST on the 15th of every month. For more information go to our boltfarmtreehouse website. Dates are first come first reserved and sell out fast! Set your reminders for next month\s Treehouse Release Day & follow us on social media to stay updated on last-minute openings!

NEW OFFERING: THE VIP TREEHOUSE EXPERIENCE! Our goal as Airbnb Superhosts is to ensure every guests\ treehouse experience is truly unforgettable! Going VIP adds a wonderful variety of fun activities sweet treats keepsakes - enjoy our luxury s\mores around your own private campfire and even get a coupon for $100 off your next stay! Be sure to ask us about how you can access our VIP Treehouse Experience.

Please let us know what you will be celebrating during your stay. Also at this time please make us aware of any special needs you may have.

In order to ensure all of our treehouse guests have an unforgettable and safe stay at Bolt Farm we require our guests to sign a simple liability waiver prior to check-in. Professional photoshoots are welcomed with advanced notice and approval. For media inquiries please contact us on our boltfarmtreehouse website. Thank you for celebrating our treehouse and the joy it brings!

Title: Tree house with pool and jaccuzi
Description:
Fulfill your childhood dream of camping in a treehouse! From this central spot by the river easily explore the trails and river. Then relax on the deck and enjoy the magic of the trees.

‚Ä¢Airbnb ‚ÄúTop 20 Places to Stay in VA‚Äù
‚Ä¢Best of Richmond by Style Magazine
‚Ä¢Featured in Airbnb article on hospitality
‚Ä¢One of 8 Great Airbnbs in the U.S. by Inside Hook

‚Ä¢Complementary bikes
‚Ä¢Comes with bathroom kitchenette & lounge apartment in host house
‚Ä¢Dog-friendly

Social media: @trailside_treehouse The space The space
When you stay in the treehouse you‚Äôre not just embarking on an incredible adventure for your family‚Äîyou‚Äôre also helping the Richmond-area community by supporting non-profits that are aligned with our mission of supporting children and the outdoors. We donate a large portion of your payment to local non-profits and thank you for being a positive part of our community.

~~

Heres your chance to fulfill that childhood dream of running away and camping out in a treehouse. This is not a tiny house wrapped around a tree or a glamorous treehouse complete with running water and a kitchen. Instead this is an authentic treehouse that we built for our nephew in 2014 complete with reclaimed redwood walls and windows from our old house. Its an authentic kid-like treehouse experience; a space devoted to the stuff of childhood dreams.

LOCATION: The Trailside Treehouse is centrally located in Richmond Virginia just minutes from I-95 and I-64. It is directly across the river from one of Richmonds popular parks called Maymont. The James River Park System and Buttermilk Trail also come through the property thanks to an easement we have given the city. The treehouse property itself includes five wooded acres with nationally-celebrated single-track trail and is adjacent to the river--just hike down the trail and cross a single train track and youll find some of Richmonds best fishing and swimming!

THE SPACE: As we designed the treehouse space we asked ourselves one question: what would we have wanted in a treehouse as kids? The Trailside Treehouse is our answer to that question--its a magnum opus to childhood.

Please note: There is a zipline on the property. Per our insurance company guests are not allowed to use it. Please prepare your children ahead of time so theyre not bummed when they arrive!

WHAT TO EXPECT: The treehouse isn‚Äôt an inexpensive place to stay. It‚Äôs not simply a comfortable room to call home as you pass through town as are many Airbnb‚Äôs. Instead it‚Äôs an unparalleled experience that we hope transforms our guests by bringing them back to their childlike centers. It‚Äôs a place to practice juggling or learn new yo-yo tricks. It‚Äôs a place to flip through a book about bowling rules and get curious about things you haven‚Äôt wondered about since you were a kid. There are notes to discover in the nooks and crannies. There are games you may not have played with since you were a child. Theres a bin of junk food and a fridge with sodas. Weve stocked the treehouse with activities that we hope reminds you of the curiosity you had as a child. We want you to feel that your time here is invaluable‚Äîthat it is a priceless trip that sets you up for a transformative week or month or year. Reinvigorates. Rejuvenates. Renews your very sense of self.

VALUABLE MEMORIES TO LAST A LIFETIME
We know the treehouse experience is an investment that many families save for. Our goal is to provide you with value beyond your expectations so that you truly feel that your time exploring here with your friends and family was worth every cent. Our guests who get the most value from the experience are those guests who are willing to leave their phones in their bags and truly live in the simplicity and wonder of the moment. We want you to imagine that you are your 10-year old self and have packed a backpack with all of your favorite things and run away to your neighbors treehouse in the woods. Even those guests bringing kids should feel ready to loosen the reigns of responsibility for awhile to just enjoy the space and get optimum value from their time here.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

DESIGN AND TOUR HISTORY
This two-story treehouse was designed by renowned Richmond architect Henry Tenser and modeled after a western firetower. It was featured (alongside the modern home where the hosts live) on the 2017 Virginia Home and Garden Tour as well as three Westover Hills Neighborhood Association tours and the Modern Richmond Tour.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

TRAILSIDE LOCATION IN THE CITY
The treehouse sits in our back yard at the top of a wooded gully that leads to the James River Park System and is mere yards from the popular Buttermilk Trail--one of the most celebrated urban single-track trail systems in the entire country. For trail-lovers and adventure-lovers you simply cant find a better spot to stay the night in Richmond Virginia.

**please note that we are located within the city so you can expect to hear city sounds which may include trains sirens traffic and other things.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

BRIDGE TO CHILDHOOD
To access the treehouse youll cross a wooden bridge and enter onto the main deck. If youre ready to play jump into the twisty tube slide and play on the playground equipment beneath the main floor. If youre ready to relax take a seat on the deck and enjoy your wooded surroundings.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

PORCH LEVEL
Enter the main floor screened porch through the screened doors. The main floor is screened in on all four sides and features two hammock swings--the perfect place to read a book or recount your day on the trail as you rock amongst the trees--mosquito-free (a rare summer treat for Richmond).

When more than 4 people wish to stay in the treehouse this first floor can be transformed into an additional sleeping area with a fold-up memory foam mattress or single cots. Just let us know if you need those!
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

SLEEPING LEVEL
The sleeping area on the second story is located up a knee-hole ladder and through a trap door. The second story is surrounded by windows on all four sides including two fish-eye windows so you can poke your head into the concave plexiglass and get a look at the ground three stories below. The second story also features a balcony which is accessible through a screen door. Youll sleep soundly under the corrugated corten steel roof. The sleeping quarters features a queen bed with a memory foam mattress and a bunkbed cot.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
LOUNGE BATHROOM AND KITCHENETTE
Inside the host house youll have full private use of our basement which includes a temperature-controlled lounge area with a TV sleeper sofa bean bag chair kitchenette with sink microwave and Keurig and full bathroom. The entrance to the lower level is private and accessible from the exterior of the home.

The bike room is also in this basement space. You are welcome to take out a bike as long as you sign a waiver and wear a helmet! There are 4 bikes to use for free.
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

GUEST COUNT AND SLEEPING COMFORTABLY
Please let us know in advance how many guests are in your party so we can set up beds set out the appropriate number of towels pillows blankets and make sure there are enough snacks and drinks.

Our standard guest limit is 6. If you want to bring a larger party we have some options. Let us know and we will help you figure out whether the options suit your travel style including the sleeper sofa inside and putting two children per level of the cot and sleeping in any of the hammocks. ~

Standard sleeping arrangements are as follows (let us know if youd like something different):
-1-2 guests: queen bed on 2nd floor
-3-4 guests: queen bed + bunkbed cot on 2nd floor
-5-6 guests: queen bed + bunkbed cot on 2nd floor + fold-up memory foam mattress on 1st floor NOTE: when there are families with more than two kids we recommend fitting two kids per level of the bunkbed cot so everyone can sleep on the same level
~~
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

DOGS ARE WELCOME!
If you‚Äôre bringing your dog(s) please let us know. Our dog is very friendly.

Single night options are available upon request and availability. Contact us for more info.

We can‚Äôt wait to host your adventure!!! Guest access Guest access
Youll have full exclusive access to the treehouse firepit and basement of the host house which includes a full bathroom lounge area with a sofa bed massive bean bag and television.

This is also where the bike room is complete with adult-sized bikes for you to use.

The entrance to the basement is private so you can come and go as you please without feeling self-conscious!

Our insurance company does not allow guests to use the zipline.

Drink water from the kitchen and sink faucets but not the garden spigots. Garden spigot water comes from rainwater collected from the roof. Other things to note Other things to note
summer guests‚Äî yes it can be hot. Again think of the treehouse of your childhood dreams. It doesn‚Äôt have ac! Overnight temps are typically in the 70s and we have fans. If you need temperature controlled environments plan to spend time and sleep in the basement lounge of the host house. If summer glamping isn‚Äôt appealing book your stay in the spring or fall when temps are milder. :)

Winter guests: see above only opposite.

Single night options are sometimes available. Contact us if you\d like to book just one night.

Please‚Äîno candles or open flames in the treehouse including grills or propane cooktops.

RIVER ACCESS‚ÄîThe treehouse property includes five wooded acres with trails for you to explore. A train track borders our property to the north and just on the other side of the track is a popular river swimming and fishing spot. You can hike to the river easily and spend a day enjoying swimming floating fishing water sports and exploring. Rock hopping is very popular in Richmond.

FOOD ODORS‚ÄîPlease no fish or fragrant food/items in the treehouse or lounge. This includes cologne perfume fish fish incense fish and any other odors that may take a few days to air out especially but not limited to fish.

ZIPLINE‚ÄîThere is a zipline on the property. Per our insurance company guests are not allowed to use it. Please prepare your children ahead of time so theye not bummed when they arrive!

TRAIL ACCESS‚ÄîThe trail off of the treehouse property is a single track trail that leads to 40 miles of a nationally recognized trail system. It‚Äôs very technical for riders and should only be attempted by advanced riders. It‚Äôs great for hikers and runners at all levels. If you are borrowing treehouse bikes and want to ride the trail avoid the single track Buttermilk trail...you‚Äôll want to ride the bikes a mile downriver on the road to Reedy Creek to pick up the fire road which is flat and awesome for riders at all levels. From the fire road ride down river two miles to Belle Isle then circle the island or ride all over the city including the canal walk and Capital Trail. Togwatee‚Äîfrom here you can go anywhere!!

BONFIRE‚ÄîWe have firewood lighters and fire starters. Plan to have a bonfire. You may want to bring your own starter log if you‚Äôre unfamiliar with starting a fire. The kind you‚Äôd use in a fireplace works!

EGRESS AND LADDER‚ÄîThe sleeping quarters are up a ladder and through a 24x24 opening. Please be comfortable climbing the ladder and moving through the opening. If youe pregnant you may want to measure your belly.

WEATHER‚ÄîWe do not refund cancellations for weather reasons. Please be aware when booking that you could get inclement weather including storms snow wind etc. For that reason you need to be comfortable assuming some weather-related risk before you book.

RESCHEDULING‚ÄîWe do allow guests to reschedule in some cases as long as they request the rescheduling 10 days prior to the day of stay or more.

URBAN NOISES‚ÄîThe treehouse is located on five wooded acres in the center of Richmond City. Our property is only one of about a dozen riverside properties in the entire city so you will have easy access to the river while enjoying life in the trees. Along with lots of wildlife you will hear city sounds which we refer to in our family as ‚Äúurban waves‚Äù like the sounds of beach waves. These noises may include sirens trains and traffic along with all the sounds of nature and your loved one‚Äôs laughter and cheer.

HOST FAMILY INTERACTION AND SPACE USE‚ÄîOur family lives in the property and our home is very close to the treehouse. Our family plays in the front yard when guests are in residence and we leave the back yard for guests to enjoy on their own. Guests should be comfortable and open to seeing our kids in the driveway and front yard. :)

ELECTRICITY LIMITATIONS‚ÄîThe treehouse is on a 20 AMP power circuit. If too many devices are plugged in and running the breaker may trip causing power loss. Please let us know right away if you lose power.

HEATERS‚ÄîWe provide heaters that are approved by our insurance company. Please do not bring your own.

HOT PLATES‚ÄîDue to safety concerns please do not use hot plates or other heating or cooking devices within the treehouse.

GUEST COUNT‚ÄîPlease let us know in advance how many guests are in your party so we can set up the beds set out the appropriate number of towels and make sure there are enough snacks and drinks. We want everyone in your group to have an awesome experience. If we don‚Äôt know a guest is coming we won‚Äôt have set up a comfortable space for him/her and he/she will not have towels blankets pillows snacks drinks and all the fun stuff that makes glamping in the treehouse such a memorable experience. Thank you!


WATER‚ÄîDrink water from the kitchen and sink faucets but not the garden spigots. Garden spigot water comes from rainwater collected from the roof.

Title: Heavenly Treehouse w/ Wrap Around Deck & Farm Views
Description:
BREEZE Treehouse is located at The Appleton Retreat on 120 acres of private land bordered by 1300 acres of a protected nature conservancy. To the south is the Pettengill Stream a resource protected area and to the north a large secluded pond. BREEZE guests may reserve the wood fired cedar hot tub and the sauna at an additional charge which are close by and private. The Appleton Retreat is less than a 30 minute drive to Belfast Rockport Camden and Rockland charming downeast seaside towns. The space The space
Total privacy alone in a tree the ultimate getaway.
The 1st floor of BREEZE is over 20 high and the sleeping loft is approximately 40 off the ground. To gain access to BREEZE requires climbing three flights of stairs. Two are very easy and code compliant the 3rd is a ships ladder - most dogs will need a lot of coaching or need to be carried up. The sleeping loft is also accessed by a steep set of stairs.
BREEZE is NOT a great place for young children.
You will experience the uniqueness of being in a tree! Windowed walls overlook the treetops and a glimpse of the ridge to the south. There is a large deck for hanging out....
(CAUTION: In winds over 25 mph you may experience some movement and noise - not to worry!)
Although BREEZE appears to be a rustic structure it has many amenities including: Air Conditioning a full galley kitchen; a shower and traditional toilet as well as good old electricity........ so you will not be roughing it.
Although there is not wi-fi at BREEZE you may tap into the wi-fi at Braeburn by getting in that proximity.
There is private parking at the treehouse.

Title: Lovely Treehouse in the Woods next to Stream
Description:
When you step into our little forest sanctuary it is easy to forget that you are only 10 min from downtown Atlanta. Nestled in the forest across a bridge over a little creek is a beautiful little modern treehouse that sleeps 4 people. There is a composting toilet and a small kitchenette with running water. Across the bridge are a private outdoor shower with hot/cold water and a heater for amazing winter showers next to it is a heated bath house all for your use only. The space The space
A true urban oasis beautiful nature all around without having to leave the comfort or proximity of the city. Visit eat and enjoy everything Atlanta has to offer then sit on the treehouse balcony swing in the hammock take in the bird song and the forest... enjoy the rays of sunshine through the trees and the mesmerizing rain as it comes down...

An authentic treehouse held up by two oaks heated in the winter and cooled in the summer with a cosy loft bed a composting toilet and everything you need for a comfortable stay.

A walk down the magnificent suspended bridge leads you to secluded charming outdoor shower with hot running water.

The treehouse is small but comfortably sleeps up to four (two in the queen bed in the loft and two on the the pull out sofa (queen). Guest access Guest access
Plenty of parking is available on our quiet street

Title: Tullihas in the Trees
Description: Porumbacu treehouse is the perfect place for a vacation immersed in a small forest right in the heart of Porumbacu a mountain village in Transylvania. Two rivers cross the property and you will wake up very day in a deep green landscape. Escape from the busy weekdays life and find the relaxing and quiet way of living. In addition in the front yard there is our Transylvanian guesthouse where you will find other facilities for a pleasant stay: fully equipped kitchen wifi barbecue kiosk etc. The space The space\nThe treehouse has one bedroom (2 adults + 2 children/adults) with a queen bed and an extendible sofa a kitchenette and one bathroom. The terrace offers beautiful view over the entire are. Title: Cherry Treesort "Big Nick"
Description:
Enter this colorful treehouse in the mountains for your next getaway! Perfect for trips with friends family and couples. Completely dog friendly! Walk across a suspension bridge into this magical treehouse that offers a main floor and a loft as well as a spacious porch and the perfect view of the mountains.

There are four treehouses total on this property. Let me know if you have questions about renting more than one together for larger groups! The space The space
Treehouse La Paz is one of four treehouses located on this 29 acre property backed up against a wooded mountain-side.

Treehouse Mountain Retreat is a relaxing getaway for every type of traveler. Guests are welcome to inquire about booking more than one treehouse during their stay in case their party is larger than four. We can accommodate up to 11 guests with all three treehouses.

All treehouses are dog friendly and we do not charge an extra fee to bring your pets. All you have to do is let us know if youre bringing any dogs and if theyre friendly with other dogs as well!

There is a kitchenette which features a half-size refrigerator a COLD sink (no hot water in treehouse) a microwave a coffee maker a water boiler for tea and hot chocolate a mini rice cooker and a toaster. On the connecting platform there is a flat top griddle that is great for cooking breakfast lunch and dinner!
**We will provide tea coffee creamer sugar and coffee mugs as well as basic cooking items such as rice salt pepper spices oil utensils plates a pot a pan and a cast iron skillet. **

This treehouse has access to a half bathroom located on the platform connected to the main treehouse as well as use of the 2 shower 2 bathroom climate controlled bathhouse.

There is a pond on our property and multiple firepits for guests to use. Each treehouse has their own private firepit with firewood and firestarter included.


Here at Treehouse Mountain our goal is to provide everything that we would want if we were to travel to other Airbnbs. During your stay you can find that we are readily available if theres anything we can help out with or want help planning your trip to the area as well.

If you have questions about any of our treehouse rentals (we have four total) send me a message! We also offer discounts* for military weekly stay return guests or renting more than one treehouse during a stay.

*Guests can use up to two discounts for a reservation*Our property is 29 acres of mostly forest with some open fields as well. Guests have full access to our property except for the other treehouses that may be rented out by other guests.

Quiet hours:
To respect all guests vacationing at our property we have a quiet time of 9 PM. Youre still welcome to enjoy camp fires or sitting out on the porch etc. We just ask that theres no loud music or anything that may cause a disturbance to other guests.

Areas of interest guests may enjoy:
9 hole disc golf course (map can be found on the UDisc App) *we have discs available for guest use
Walking trails throughout the property
A slack line (balancing line)

Games/Activities available upon request:
Corn Hole
Giant Jenga
Bocce Ball

Other things to note:
I have a pottery studio on the property. If this interests you youre welcome to come check it out just let me know!
We do our best to maintain the grounds without disturbing guests (leaf blowing cutting grass cutting firewood etc. We aim to do this when all guests are out and about during the day. If you arrive back and were still working just send me a message as we may not have noticed your arrival back. Our goal is to provide a relaxing environment .

We are constantly looking for new things to add to this list so this may change over time. Other things to note Other things to note
The other two treehouses may be booked during your stay and other guests may have dogs off leash on the property because we are fully dog friendly. If this is a concern to you (due to fear of dogs or your dog is not friendly towards other dogs) let me know and I would be glad to request any guests staying to keep their dogs on leash.

Title: Romantic Treehouse Getaway with Breathtaking Views
Description:
Sleep up in the trees in our cozy Magical Treehouse. This place is the perfect base camp for your next adventure or a unique spot to curl up with a good book. The perfect place to be in the woods but not isolated. Cook your meals in the nearby cookhouse (40‚Äô away unheated) on a camp stove or over an open campfire. A heated bathroom/shower is 20‚Äô away. We provide you with linens cookware plus help you plan your trip. Property includes miles of hiking trails and beautiful places to explore! The space The space
Rural but centrally located The Magical Treehouse is seven miles north of Paul Smiths College on Rt. 30. You‚Äôll be in one of the most varied wilderness areas of the park.

The Paul Smith‚Äôs College Visitors Interpretive Center is five miles away with wonderful hiking trails and educational programs for the whole family.

You‚Äôll be 25 minutes to Saranac Lake or Malone; 35 minutes to Lake Placid and its Olympic venues; 50 minutes to Whiteface Mountain. The Natural History Museum of the Adirondacks (the Wild Center) is 40 minutes away in Tupper Lake.

The Magical Treehouse has a single room with a beautiful comfortable handcrafted queen-size bed a table and cozy chairs. Your bathroom/shower is in a separate building 20 away and your cookhouse is in a screened in area and is 40 away. (Wintertime- mini fridge microwave and snowshoes provided).

There is a nice campfire spot for summer marshmallow roasts or quiet fire gazing. A complimentary bundle of campfire wood is provided for your use more for purchase.

You can cook meals in the screened in cookhouse (not heated in winter) and a spigot nearby provides water. The cookhouse has all the pots dishes utensils and tools youll need to make a great meal.

There are over 5 miles of hiking/xc ski/snowshoe trails on the property to explore and nearby trails are excellent for mountain biking with both back country roads and single-track. The property is home to a bog an old quarry and a river runs nearby. Designated horseback riding trail heads are less than a mile away. A ‚ÄúWild and Scenic Study River‚Äù the Osgood flows nearby with put-in and take-outs within a couple of miles of our driveway. Drop-off and pick-up arrangements can be made. This is a ‚Äúmust paddle‚Äù for those interested in wildlife and scenery. Many have spotted the bald eagle who has a nest at the river‚Äôs edge. We are surrounded by many great fishing spots.

Your hosts Bob and Sheila are a former professional wilderness guide and a life-long resident of the Paul Smith‚Äôs area. Between the two of them good advice‚Äîconnecting you to great experiences and unique destinations is as close to a ‚Äúsure thing‚Äù as you can get. The temporary use of their brains is complimentary!Youll have 27 acres to explore including purpose-built mountain biking trails! Other things to note Other things to note
Everything that youll need is here. All you have to do is bring your food and your adventurous spirit.

Title: Lov 'nid SPA Cabin Com√®te for 2 people
Description: The Treehouse is a perfect place for a vacation in the middle of the old pine trees forest. It offers a retreat from an intensive city life and a short getaway to the wild less than one hour away from Vilnius. The space The space\nThe place itself is a romantic room suited for an unforgettable moments with a loved one. It contains a lovely terrace with the fantastic view to the landscape hammocks fire-place and many other things that will make your time amazing. Moreover the place offers a perfect working place with a free wi-fi and working desk for those who are looking to change their usual office day into peaceful and untraditional work place. Other things to note Other things to note\nFor those who enjoy more active leisure time we offer a bike tour to the nearest village Pamerkiai located on the cost of a river Merkys. There you are going to find not only a beautiful village established in the beginning of XX century but also ‚ÄôGrikucis‚Äô farmstead famous for its traditional kitchen and educational programs.

Title: Baumhaushotel Krautsand Haus JOJO
Description:
If youre looking to spend your vacation in unspoiled nature in a luxuriously equipped house among the trees listen to the birds to ride a bicycle to walk along the forest trails to explore Velebits peaks and other particular characteristics of this region of exceptional beauty then youve come to the right place. The sea is only 20 minutes away by car. Plitvice Lakes National Park is within 1 hour drive. 4 more national parks are also within an hour drive. The space The space
The house is situated in Velebit Nature Park. It is unique because you stay between the trees at the height of 4 meters. You experience the nature in a totally different and special way. The location is perfect because in summer time you are close to the sea (20 minutes) but you sleep in the freshness. Guest access Guest access
The whole house is available for stay with its surrounding area where is the barbecue and big covered terrace with garden furniture. Other things to note Other things to note
The house is new and fully equipped for maximum comfort.

Title: Moose Meadow Lodge - Treehouse
Description:
Enjoy breathtaking and one-of-a-kind lodging in our Whispering Pines Treehouse. This unique treehouse rental in Ohio towers 22 feet in the air and offers luxury adventure and comfort. Featuring a stone two-person jetted tub with a ceiling tub filler king-size rustic Amish Crafted pillow-top mattress cherry hardwood floors and rustic furnishings. Privately tucked away in a grove of White Pines relax and refresh yourself while sitting on your deck. The space The space
Living Room:
Step into luxury with your first step over the threshold and onto the beautiful cherry hardwood floor. Roughhewn beams and split pine planking surround you as you relax in the comfy sofa and matching chair in front of a live edge coffee table. Flip the switch to ignite the fireplace encased in hand-cut stone and curl up with a good book or take a much-deserved nap. You can also catch up on your favorite shows on the large screen TV with cable channels that are mounted above the mantle.

Windows on each wall allow plenty of natural light and outdoor beauty to enter your hideaway. But make sure you spend lots of time outside on the wrap-around balcony. Allow the peacefulness of your wooded retreat to soothe your mind and soul as you rock gently in the rockers and absorb the serenity that surrounds you.

Before snuggling into the King size bed featuring an Amish-made pillow-top mattress resting on an elevated pinewood base make sure you unwind in your private two-person jetted tub. The ceiling-high waterfall fill supplies the hot water that will be jetted over tired muscles creating just the right mood for the perfect night.

Kitchen:
Your kitchen is home to a collegiate-sized refrigerator with a freezer and a 2-burner stovetop. There are ample pots and pans if you feel like making your favorite vacation meal or a microwave oven for heating up the leftovers from one of our amazing restaurants in town. A toaster and drip coffee maker round out the appliances which are at your disposal. The Amish-made wood table and chairs are the perfect spots for breakfast for two.

Bathroom:
A sliding barn door opens to reveal your tiled floor bathroom. An artisanal counter rests on legs made from logs. The expertly tiled shower is large enough for two and can start your day or end your night on just the right note.

Title: Cliff Dweller:  Spend a night Suspended from the Ridgeline!
Description:
Treehouse overlooking the Dal√§lvan river on an organic farm. In a secluded setting. Treehouse is fully equipped with microwave two burner hot plate and conventional oven. Inside toilet and shower hot/cold running water. Electric radiators. Electric blanket. The bed is made up ready towels gowns & slippers. Sauna and hot tub included. Car park next to the treehouse. Outside grill. Meals on request. Nearby busses. Transport on request.
Pets by arrangement. The space The space
Private Entrance to the treehouse.
A treehouse overlooking the Dal√§lvan river with spectacular views. Set in woodland on an organic farm in Sweden. Private and secluded among forests. Bubble pool included and sauna included.
Skatboet Treehouse Magpies Nest is 36 square meters and 6 meters high.
All modern conveniences in the treehouse. Hot and cold running water. Electric radiators for heating. Shower and toilet.
No internet inside the treehouse. Internet within the farmhouse area.
King size bed. Room for extra guests. Fully equipped with oven microwave two burner hot plate. The bed is made up ready with bed linen towels slippers and gowns and an electric blanket. Watch the Northern lights aurora borealis during December to March.
From December to March the temperature outside is normally minus -25c degrees Celsius. In the winter there is flat skiing. Ski resorts nearby. Roma alpine and others. Visit the copper mines and Silver mines a short drive away. Bison farm 6 kilometres away.
Therapy treatments offered Swedish body massage happy feet at 500 krona for an hours treatment.
Cows horses two cats and chickens on the farm. Moose springbok swans and many other wild life. Walks in the forests and around the farm.
Mushroom apple and berry picking in season in the forests around.
Enjoy the tranquility in your own space and time. Beautiful sunrises and sunsets.
Pets by arrangement.
Meals by arrangement.

Title: Treehouse Adventure
Description:
High perched in two century-old oaks Pitalaya will welcome the most romantic of you...
A spiral staircase will lead you to the heart of the cabin connected by a bridge suspended from an interlaced terrace in the heart of the branches of a majestic leaning oak.
Perched at a height of almost 7m it can accommodate 2 people and its access is reserved for adults. The space The space
3 cabins perched in the trees in the heart of the Pyrenees in the Barousse Valley a magical place to stay with family friends or lovers.
All our cabins are equipped with lights (solar and battery) dry toilets water point and washbasin for the extra toilet with locally made handmade soap tables chairs and deckchairs as well as additional gas heating. Towels linens duvets plaids and blankets are provided and beds are made upon arrival.
La Pitalaya cabin (7m high 2 people): the romantic with a four-poster bed formed by the branches of the tree access by a spiral staircase 2 terraces including one covered connected by a suspension bridge.
Cabane du Brame (5m 3/4 pers): the cocooning with a bed in 140 a bed in 90*200 on the mezzanine accessible by a rope ladder a junior bed in 70*160 and a large semi-covered terrace
Peyre Hitte cabin (3m 2 to 7 pers) : the fairytale perched on 3 trees with a bed in 140*200 2 bunk beds and 1 single bed in 90*200 Guest access Guest access
Site with an exceptional environment very frequented by deer and other animals of the forest located 20min from the motorway exit in the heart of the Pyrenees 400m from the village center and 700m above sea level.
Car parking on arrival on site access to the cabins on foot (70 to 120m from the car park) reception building with office and sanitary facilities open 24 hours a day. 2 ha landscaped site that promises privacy and moments of relaxation with a Nordic bath (reservation required) and wooden games (free access). Other things to note Other things to note
Restoration options:
Breakfast is included in the overnight rate we carry it in a basket that you lift with a pulley to the cabin for an indoor or outdoor tasting.
As an option you can book a warm and hearty evening meal basket made with local produce.
For groups of 4 to 10 people we offer an atypical form of catering in the Kota Grill : all-inclusive meal from aperitif to dessert around grills in a small hexagonal chalet with a grill in the center of the table topped with a host for a memorable and very friendly meal.

Title: Chulavista Dome
Description:
Have You ever experienced sunrise waking up in the trees? Here is Your chance. Our treehouse is place to relax and commune with nature and all this only 35 min drive from Tallinn city center. The treehouse provides an intimate simple and calming retreat for 2 people. The space The space
Our quests has described the treehouse as being truly relaxing romantic and unique place youll ever stay. What could be better than falling asleep in the trees and waking up to birds singing around you ‚Äì all this near the city?
You have whole apartment in trees with kitchen bathroom sleeping area fireplace and deck.
The treehouse from the main house parking lot summer kitchen saunas and pond is about a 200m walk.

Guests will have free parking in our parking lot and access to outdoor kitchen. Bikes to ride with during the rental time. Pond for swimming and cooling down in hot summer days.

Description:
The treehouse is a private getaway for a couple that want to experience the magic.
For a video tour type the following link into your browser:
https://tinyurl.com/a72vevp5
There have been several movie and other photo shoots done on property. Please text request and details and we can negotiate fees.
Our other AirBnB is just next door; meemaws-country -cottage which sleeps six. Guest access Guest access

Title: Raven Rock Treehouse
Description:
No children under 5 years of age for safety reasons. The Tree House is hand-crafted one of 3 casitas and 3 treehouses at the Bio Thermales natural resort organically integrated into our 35 acre rainforest. Guests enjoy free access from 9 am to 10 pm to the 15 natural hot and cool springs pools of various temperatures and rainforest trails. The space The space
Please message us if we will be your first or last destination in Costa Rica. We highly recommend booking on weekdays for more privacy and tranquility as we have more day visitors from 9 am to 6 pm to our hot springs on the weekends especially Sundays. If your reservation includes a Sunday we highly recommend planning a day outing to the many wonderful nearby activities.

We are three hours north of San Jose (airport) 45 minutes east of Fortuna and Volcano Arenal and the many activities there and nearby.

Guests enjoy 24/day access* to our hot springs and trails in our 35 acre rainforest at no extra charge. The pools are cleaned every morning starting at 6 am but one hot spring will always be available. Many factors may dictate scheduling including weather. We do not charge for children 17 and under -- but we will not accept reservations for the Tree House for families with children under 5 years old for whom a 20 foot fall from the balcony would be very serious.

Our hot springs are ancient ‚Äúdeep Earth‚Äù sources that bubble up through the rainforest floor laden with mineral-rich waters that have been in the Earth for at least 10000 years. Our waters are rich in bicarbonates calcium and magnesium low in sulfur and slightly acidic -- qualities shared by many of the world\s best hot springs.

Five of our 9 organic form hot springs pools are located in the rainforest and 4 hot springs pools as well as a small and a large cool spring swimming pool are located in a meadow surrounded by rainforest (see below for more information). The small and large cool springs pools both have water slides and there is a small water slide in one of the shallow and moderate temperature pools for small children.

The Tree House is built to strict Costa Rican building codes but as with all tree houses there is some movement when the wind blows and this could be uncomfortable for people very sensitive to motion sickness.

You may see our other listings on Airbnb at:

Tucano Casita (Toucan Casita) is listed as Rainforest Casita with Hot Springs: airbnb.com/rooms/30358

Mariposa Casita (Butterfly Casita) is listed as Rainforest Casita2 with Hot Springs airbnb.com/rooms/51518

Colibri Casita (Hummingbird Casita) is listed as Rainforest Casita3 with Hot Springs
airbnb.com/rooms/1896911

Tree House: Rainforest Tree House with Hot Springs airbnb.com/rooms/50435

You can check availability of each accommodation by clicking on the Calendar tab above the main photo on each listing.

Tree House features: (see floor-plan for all details):
‚Ä¢ Perched high among the rainforest trees the Tree House has large screened areas for circulation of naturally cooler breezes. It also has fans.
‚Ä¢ All onsite hot springs and recreation activities included including 24 hour access to the hot springs and cool spring swimming pools
‚Ä¢ The Master bedroom with a Queen sized bed with orthopedic mattress and hypoallergenic bedding is in a loft
‚Ä¢ One the main floor two twin-sized beds that can double as settees with hypoallergenic bedding
‚Ä¢ Hand-crafted rustic furniture from naturally harvested trees on the land
‚Ä¢ Main floor kitchen with refrigerator micro-wave coffee maker basic kitchenware
‚Ä¢ Bathroom with flash on-demand hot-water heater
‚Ä¢ Wrap around balcony for relaxing and animal and bird watching
‚Ä¢ Maid service every 3 days included
‚Ä¢ Laundry service at extra charge per load
‚Ä¢ Short walk to rainforest and hot springs pools
‚Ä¢ No telephone or television
‚Ä¢ WiFi internet for your laptop -- if reliable 24 hour internet is essential to you please message us for suggestions.
‚Ä¢ Hosts Kathy and Bernie live onsite
‚Ä¢ Languages: English Spanish German limited French

One time $10 cleaning fee; thereafter housecleaning services every 3 days are free.

Bio Thermales Hot Springs features:
‚Ä¢ Our hot springs pools are all-natural mineral water just as it flows from the Earth
‚Ä¢ Rainforest Pools from 90¬∞ - 105¬∞F (31¬∞ - 40¬∞C)
‚Ä¢ Grotto Pools in meadow flow from the 112¬∞F/45¬∞C source pool onward into two larger and progressively cooler pools which are handicap-accessible and suitable for small children.
‚Ä¢ Cool Pool in meadow is 90¬∞F/31¬∞C mineral water flowing from the thermal creek
‚Ä¢ 2 Swimming pools with continuous flow of natural cold spring water (88 degrees) - one is 1 to 1.5 meters deep and the larger is 3 meters deep.
‚Ä¢ Bathhouse in meadow with handicap accessible bathrooms and showers
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúRanchos‚Äù ‚Äì roofed tables with concrete floors and grills for picnics

Other Activities on our 35 acre rainforest reserve:
‚Ä¢ Bird-watching: many types of toucans oropendulas parrots hummingbirds and the rare green macaw
‚Ä¢ Rainforest: enjoy it from the casita porch or hot springs pools take easy walks on paths or more adventurous hikes
‚Ä¢ Fossils ‚Äì enjoy our collection or hunt (gently) for your own
‚Ä¢ Wildlife: two-toed sloths iguanas capuchin and mantled howler monkeys tree frogs birds butterflies and many others.

We are a 45 minute drive from the many activities in Fortuna and Volcano Arenal -- such as ziplines hanging bridges white water rafting slow river floats or kayaking through wildlife sanctuaries -- or a 1.5 hour drive to La Paz Waterfall Gardens and Volcano Poas.

Bio Thermales Hot Springs is open to the public for day use of the hot springs and most of our day visitors are Costa Ricans so you may also meet new Tico friends. Bio Thermales is generally not crowded however except on major holidays and Sundays.

Food/Meals: The Tree House has a kitchen. There are many restaurants and a good supermarket within a 15 minute drive. Traditional Costa Rican meals can be delivered from a local caterer for very reasonable prices (Costa Rican food is tasty but not spicy). Otherwise for those without cars we can call a taxi or synchronize a food shopping trip when we go to town for errands.

Driving from SJO airport: Please message us before booking if we are your first and/or last destination in Costa Rica.

We recommend at least a small 4 wheel drive car. The last 3 kilometers are country roads.

Three hours of daylight are needed to safely drive here from the SJO airport before sunset at 5:30 pm. The drive through mountainous cloud forests is splendid in daylight but prone to fog and rain especially at night creating hazardous visibility conditions after dark. Finding our countryside location will also be far easier if you arrive the first time before sunset. If your plane lands in the morning to noon you can drive here directly from the airport. Otherwise it is safer to book a room near the airport on your first night or ask us to book a private driver ($145) and have a rental car delivered at no extra charge.

Last night in Costa Rica:
Driving directly to the SJO airport on the same day is possible if you book a flight in the afternoon. Please be aware that you must be at the airport 2.5 hours before departure. If you have an early morning departing flight it is basically necessary to stay near the airport on the night before. Guest access Guest access
Five of our 9 organic form hot springs pools are located in the rainforest and 4 hot springs pools as well as a small and a large cool spring swimming pool(with water slides) are located in a meadow surrounded by rainforest and one cool fresh spring pool in the rainforest (see below for more information). Tree House guests can enjoy the hot springs pools from 9am to 10 pm and 35 acres of rainforest access at no charge. The pools are cleaned daily from 6 am to 9 am but one pool is always available -- there are many factors involved including weather that may dictate when the pools are ready. We have a staff operated laundry facility and guests may give clothes for washing/drying/folding for $5/load. Other things to note Other things to note
Day visitors and groups are permitted entrance to use the hot springs and cool springs pools from 9 am to 6 pm. There are usually more day visitors on weekends especially Sundays and we recommend booking week days for more tranquility and privacy. If guests book a longer reservation that includes a Sunday we recommend planning a day tour in the many nearby activities on Sundays. Day visitors must leave by 6 pm and only casita and Tree House guests may use the pools after 6 pm and enjoy unlimited access to the pools with the exception of no nighttime use of the forest pools and cleaning schedule as noted above.

We recommend either ordering a catered dinner in advance for your first evening and/or next morning breakfast or buying and bringing groceries to cook because we are 4 km from the main paved road and driving after dark is highly discouraged until drivers have quite some experience on Costa Rican roads. Also most guests prefer to settle in upon arrival and not to have to get back in the car and drive out to dinner. We provide a Catering Menu to each guest once reserved but the caterer requires advance notice of selected meals and TIMES guests would like meals delivered. We do not have a liquor license and guests must bring their own beer/wine/rum etc. The tap water is safe to drink and we sell soft drinks fruit juices and other non-alcohol beverages snacks and ice cream.

Title: The Beehive Treehouse
Description:
CHECK IN DATES ARE;
Friday- three night minimum
Monday -two night minimum
Wednesday-two night minimum
You can book 2‚Äì3-4 nights or more!
Designed to be the most romantic getaway tucked deep in the woods of Tennessee. Come experience Sulfur Ridge Tennessee‚Äôs first luxury treehouse! Perched 15 feet above the forest floor the treehouse offers a private intimate space to relax and be immersed in nature.

PlEASE NOTE-
WE ARE AN ADULT ONLY PROPERTY.
No pets.
No smoking. The space The space
-PLEASE NOTE-
THREE NIGHT MINIMUM ON WEEK ENDS
CHECK IN DATES:Monday Wednesday or Friday
Our local Amish built treehouse has an eclectic style encompassing a variety of eras all intertwined together.
From entering through the front door dated 1848 to the 100 year old stain glass window repurposed in the bathroom you will discover many interesting stories.
The treehouse is built with your comfort in mind from a luxury mattress to a cast iron claw foot tub large enough for two!
Dance the night away to your favorite songs on the jukebox.
Spend your evening underneath the stars sitting at the fire pit.
Soaking in the hot tub designed for only two will be the ending of a perfect day!

If you are a group of six or less- We also have on our property our retro inspired ‚ÄúShasta Camp‚Äù three 1962 inspired campers are available as a separate Listing to book all three campers. Think of it like a three bedroom house.

Look under - Cummins Fallsstays
Sulfur Ridge Shasta Camp

Title: The Majestic Treehouse romantic, luxury retreat
Description:
Celesterra is a spiritual retreat treehouse for people feeling the need to experience deep rest and contemplation healing from grief a new direction in life a more powerful connection with nature and/or yourself a vision you wish to clarify etc.. To spend time in retreat here you MUST include two or three paragraphs about why your heart is calling you here. Also please let us know you have read the description and agree to our guidelines. This is a magical place for your retreat! The space The space
Celesterra is a 230 sq. ft. sacred space that floats between earth and sky about 15 feet off of the ground. Built by the television show Treehouse Masters it is a beautiful serene space that is cozy warm and inviting. PLEASE NOTE: All food and cooking are strictly vegetarian with no garlic or onions (so the next guests might be able to appreciate the space as well). No meat on the land at all please.

Celesterra features a beautiful living area with wood stove and leather club chairs a dining table fully stocked kitchenette and a bathroom with a composting toilet. IT HAS NO RUNNING WATER but glorious spring water is supplied for drinking washing dishes and cleaning hands. There is a full bathroom available in the main house exclusively for your use (about a three minute walk - try a walking meditation back and forth each day!). It features a beautiful walk-in shower and flushing toilet and sink with hot and cold water. You can restock up on water there or walk about 1 minute from the treehouse to where the spring overflows into the creek and fill up there. Celesterra also features a large front deck with fabulous views of the mountains.

The bedroom is located in a loft above the kitchen area. It features a queen size memory foam mattress (like a cloud) with all natural bedding. It is accessed by a 9-foot ladder. If you have physical limitations using the ladder might prove difficult for you please let us know. See photos included here or we can send photos.

This is a wonderfully quiet space that enhances your meditations reflections and relaxation. Only serious intentions to do deep personal work will be considered. We ask for 7 days notice before booking but apply if you feel a deep need to come within the 7 day limit. Also we are happy to discuss financial costs for retreats longer than a week. We will try and work with you in any way to help make this a transformational experience.

NO DOGS please. We have a hunting dog Winston (rescue) who is human friendly but not dog friendly. Also while we love the energy of children we do not allow them to come on retreat. Other things to note Other things to note
The application is simple: Please write a thorough explanation to the question: What is my innermost heart yearning for during my retreat in Celesterra and why? If we feel your application is sincere and earnest and gives us enough information to come to a sense of right alignment we will notify you of your acceptance.

Title: √Ö Auge - River Eye - Treehouse
Description:
The Barkhouse is the only fully tree supported structure in the Gatlinburg/Pigeon Forge area. Located just minutes from all the major attractions in the area and only 5 miles from the Greenbriar entrance to the GSMNP. Enjoy the seclusion of 25 acres of trees with amazing views of the river and the mountains plus all the comforts of home.
The Barkhouse is engineered with a beautiful live White Pine growing through the center of the treehouse. Enjoy stargazing through the skylight. The space The space
The Barkhouse has a kitchen area with a microwave refrigerator/freezer combo toaster oven single electric burner and coffee maker. Enjoy charcoal grilling outdoors on your private deck or using the fire pit shared with the other treehouse located on the property. Spend time inside resting on yoga mats in the suspended cargo net area. Guest access Guest access
A door code will be given prior to arrival to enter the premise. Once inside the treehouse the entire (black circle) locking mechanism will need to be turned clockwise or counterclockwise to unlock or lock the door. Other things to note Other things to note
No pets!

Title: PRIVATE romantic TREEHOUSE ‚òÖ The Lions Lair
Description:
Owl in the Oak Treehouse was renovated in January to give our guests a completely modern experience while maintaining the uniqueness and charm of a real treehouse overlooking a small stream in a quiet valley. The space The space
The treehouse is secluded more than 300 feet from the closest house. In the winter several neighborhood homes are visible from the treehouse but summer foliage cloaks the treehouse in almost total privacy.

The main floor of the treehouse is 120 square feet and has a sitting area bathroom and kitchenette. There is also a small writing desk that folds out of the way when not in use.

The 50-square-foot sleeping loft is accessed via ladder and gives guests some of the best views of the forest and stream.

The kitchenette features a sink minifridge microwave and Keurig coffee maker.

The small bathroom has a composting toilet and a shower. Towels body wash shampoo and conditioner are included.

Outside the treehouse is a sitting area with stunning views out over the forest and down to a small stream 30 feet below! Guest access Guest access
Guests have access to the entire treehouse and platform. There is also a short side path with a bench overlooking the stream. Other things to note Other things to note
Guest parking is on the street and the two-minute walk to the treehouse takes you down a stone path through the woods up and down several flights of uneven steps and across a small footbridge.

Access to the treehouse itself is up a spiral staircase and it‚Äôs necessary to climb a ladder to get to the sleeping loft.

Children under the age of 10 are not allowed to access the sleeping loft for safety reasons.

The water heater tank only holds 7 gallons of water so showers need to be kept short. The toilet in the treehouse is a composting toilet.

This property is a real treehouse actually suspended in trees. If it happens to be windy during your stay you will feel the sway and hear some creaking sounds.

Title: Treasure Hunt Tree House in Metro Atlanta
Description:
Come Sleep in the Trees - Luxury Romantic Treehouse above Walhalla SC is just minutes from Stumphouse Tunnel Stumphouse Mountain Bike Park Issaqueena Falls & white water rafting. Oconee County has many beautiful waterfalls & hiking trails. We are close to Clemson Lake Keowee Lake Hartwell & Lake Jocassee and located just inside Sumter National Forest.

An AMAZING ROMANTIC GETAWAY for HONEYMOONS ANNIVERSARIES & BIRTHDAYS!

See our sister treehouse The Stella Vista. The space The space
PLEASE READ ENTIRE DESCRIPTION
BEFORE YOU BOOK.

This is a romantic retreat for COUPLES ONLY.
We are not PET friendly due to guests that may have pet allergies and due to the high decks we are not KID friendly.

Our romantic little house in the trees is designed with our guests‚Äô comfort in mind. It sleeps 2 people. There is a beautiful king-size custom built bed with a Rainbow Poplar live edge headboard. We chose to dress our Tuft & Needle mattress with soft comfy cotton linens and soft blankets. The white flowing drapery surrounding the sleeping area makes this a dreamy and romantic space. Hanging over the bed is a stunning vintage crystal chandelier. If you happen to catch the sun streaming in the upper windows just right in the morning or late afternoon you may see a beautiful show of rainbow prisms cast by the crystals dancing all over the room. The french door from the sleeping area leads out to a west facing deck where you can enjoy your morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evenings in the treetops on a pretty little bistro set.

Inside the cozy sitting area has a small dining table for 2 and small loveseat for relaxing and kicking your feet up.

The KITCHENETTE has a mini fridge microwave and a toaster. The wake up station is stocked with a french press coffee maker burr coffee grinder and an electric water kettle. We have whole bean coffee ground coffee flavored teas along with cream and sugar and sugar substitutes. We have plates bowls coffee cups glasses cool bronze flatware and glass stemware and of course wine & bottle openers. If you prefer to paper plates and plastic utensils we have those too. We leave snacks a few goodies juice and water. These are for you and there is no extra charge so please enjoy.

For OUTDOOR COOKING there is a Weber electric grill and an electric griddle for cooking on the lower deck. We have grilling utensils spices foil and cooking oil. All cooking must be done outside as there is very limited counter space indoors. After all this is a treehouse so enjoy the ‚ÄúGlamping‚Äù experience! There are two great outdoor dining spaces with bistro tables and chairs. One is on the upper deck off the bedroom and the other is a dedicated covered dining area downstairs that overlooks the fire pit.

The bathroom has a huge WALK-IN SHOWER with natural fossil stone tile and a river rock floor. Over the shower are copper fairy wire lights for a fun showering experience. Wrap yourself in the large fluffy bath sheets after showering. There is a petrified teak vessel sink and standard traditional potty just like you have at home. Soap shampoo hairdryer and all towels and linens are provided just bring your toothbrush.

If you want a more adventurous showering experience grab a robe and head downstairs to our new OUTDOOR SUMMER SHOWER. You will love the cool copper rain head and lighting for showering at night.

Off the back deck you can stroll across the laurel branch bridge to a private NAPPING DECK complete with a raised Double-Stack Net custom-made for just two people. Grab a pillow and blanket and snuggle up!

On the downstairs deck you can relax in the 2 cedar rocking chairs or hang out on the porch swing.

The FIRE PIT is just off the lower deck and we provide firewood and a little basket of goodies to make Smores.

You will find utensils and cooking supplies in the utility room off the lower deck.

There is NO TV or WiFi but we have a basket of games playing cards and a vintage style record player and few old records for you to enjoy. On the lower deck there is an addicting hook & ring on a string game.

Quiet hours are 10pm to 8am.

I only allow 2 guests. There is not a sleeper sofa or any room for a cot or air mattress. The treehouse is a cozy 300 square feet.

I have poured my heart into building this treehouse. I want my guests to enjoy all the wonderful and carefully thought out things I have placed here for them.

Please respect my property follow the house rules and PLEASE LEAVE EVERYTHING LIKE YOU FOUND IT.

I provide a nice clean place for you when you arrive. Fresh clean linens cozy blankets towels dish towels and dishes. All hard surfaces door knobs etc. are wiped down with sanitizing wipes between every guest. Please clean up after yourself and leave everything in good order before checking out.

I only book out 6 months in advance so if you look on the calendar and the dates you want are more than 6 months away that doesnt mean they are not available it just means the dates havent been released yet. Please check back and grab your dates once they become available to book. Guest access Guest access
You will have access to the area around the treehouse. Other things to note Other things to note
My dream when designing and building this little getaway was to provide a comfortable and relaxing space where you can unwind and enjoy some downtime. I carefully thought out all the things I wanted my guests to enjoy. All the fun little details and interesting things mean a lot to me and I want you to enjoy them as well.

I know accidents happen and that is okay as long as you let me know about it. If you do happen to break something PLEASE just let me know. Just leave me a note or message me. I need to be able to replace things before I host my next guests.

*Failure to report broken/damaged items will result in replacement fees.*

We do not have WiFi.

Cell service is best with Verizon.

Title: Luxury Stone and Timber Treehouse on 40-Acre Farm
Description:
To support the Permaculture Project of Quinta do Solcome and experiment special stay in a treehouse in the middle of corktree forest at 8m from the grown. The location and the view are a spectacular. Perfect for birds watching. Up there you can cook in the kitchen have hot shower and use compost toilet.
A childs dream experience for wild nature Lovers. The space The space
You will find up there all this:
separate and isolate bedroom with double bed kitchen with fridge and cooker a shower with hot water compost toilet gaz heater and large terrace. Guest access Guest access
After 400m of dirty road (but practicable) you can park next to the treehouse.
And you need to go up the stairs case. Other things to note Other things to note
Is recommend for people who like to be in nature and not too afraid of hight because is 8m from the grown :) Licence number Licence number
Exempt

Title: Epic Luxury Treehouse - next to Dog Mountain !
Description:
Whispering Pines

One of a kind beautiful 2 storey tree house built on 8 pine trees overlooking a ravine with an amazing view. Located only minutes from St. Catharines and Jordan Station in the heart of wine country. The tree house can sleep 2 adults and 1 child ( age 3 and up). The space The space
Your private space is located over 1000 feet (300 m) back from the road with easy access to free parking . Sitting 10 feet (3 m) off the ground the treehouse is a perfect place to relax and unwind and spend time with nature.
The treehouse comes with 1 queen size bed on the upper level and the possibility of a fold out mattress for a child. The main floor has an eating area and basic kitchenette equipped with a bar fridge Keurig coffee maker toaster and microwave. No stove supplied. A bathroom with a shower is located on the main level. Enjoy your morning coffee on a large balcony overlooking the wooded ravine. Along the creek below you may hear or see ravine wildlife. The fully insulated premise has both heating and air conditioning for your comfort. Early luggage drop off available.
Children aged 3 and over are welcome.
Major grocery stores and restaurants are located 5 mins drive from treehouse.
Bring your bikes and enjoy the scenery of the beautiful Jordan area. Guest access Guest access
Guest Access: self check-in with keypad
guest can access the entire space Other things to note Other things to note
Of Note
UNIT IS THOROUGHLY CLEANED AND DISINFECTED AFTER EACH GUEST LEAVES
*must navigate stairs to enter treehouse and bedroom (10 ft)
*no smoking or vaping on property
*no pets allowed
*no fires of any type because of treehouse location including candles and incense
*potential of noise - Treehouse is located on a farm property adjacent to orchards and vineyards and there may be noises related to agricultural operations.

Title: Le Perchoir des Graves
Description:
We offer a preserved environment in communion and respect with nature between the middle mountains and the forest.
Animals live daily on the farm.
Meals can be offered based on organic and local products by Thierry chef.

Responsible behaviour regarding the consumption of resources (water solar energy (12V) dry toilets) and respect for living beings are expected at the site.
For more information find us on our website: calgaleno.com The space The space
cabin with a kitchen and bedroom with a shaded terrace.
stunning views of the Tarragona Valley and the sea in the distance.
the kitchen is equipped .

are on the lower level. Licence number Licence number
