Title: Treehouse, facing the sunset
Description:
Located in Ringgold Georgia the treehouse sits in 16 acres of private property. It is minutes from Georgias best wineries and some of the most desirable hiking whitewater and scenic activities in Chattanooga and the Tennessee Valley. Escape to our mountaintop retreat for solitude and tranquility.

All Military Police and Firefighters will receive a 15% discount on all week day stays. Thank you for your sacrifice and service! The space The space
For a full tour of the treehouse please visit our Instagram (@SelahRidgeTreesort) and click on the Tour bubble below the profile.

Though plenty of activities are nearby for adventure the treehouse provides sanctuary for the weary soul. An arched bridge connects the treehouse to the hot tub custom-built in Alaska by Zen Bathworks. Made from aromatic cedar you\ll sooth away your worries as you breathe in the sweet mountain air.

Take in the views and sounds of the rustling trees while experiencing our spacious outdoor shower. Top off the night with a nice glass of wine or roast smores on the balcony fire pit. At our treehouse you will not only enjoy the breathtaking views and the melodies of nature but also unwind to the sound of the waterfall underneath. Bundle up in the warmth of the cozy indoors or bring in nature by sliding open the giant picture window. Our sweet escape makes kicking back in nature easy.

The treehouse is the perfect place for a romantic getaway for two. However it can accommodate up to four guests comfortably with a full size trundle bed that pulls out from below the king bed if needed.

Our Treehouse is not currently equipped with wifi. It is our hope that this provides a much needed escape from the world and that you will enjoy being off the grid. However if you find that plugging in is a necessity during your stay there is great cell service. Any hotspots you provide should work well.

Title: Trailside Treehouse - Riverside in Richmond, VA
Description:
Bakkelund treetop house is an amazing experience!
Rising up 11 meters above the ground inbetween 5 trees and spiral stairs to bring you up and down.
The cabin is basically equipped. It has electricity and a built in bed. (Space for 2 people)
The hut has a spacious terrace with an amazing view over the forest and fields.
You will come close to wildlife and birds The space The space
Bakkelund is a guesthouse on a Privat property with a beautiful garden and forest. It has all the facilities of a modern backpackers with outdoor kitchen indoor and outdoor toilet and shower Guest access Guest access
Outdoor kitchen with electricity and hot/cold water. Indoor and outdoor toilet and shower outdoor bathtub

Title: BREEZE, in a tree The Appleton Retreat
Description:
Take in the rustic fairy tale vibe of this custom-made treehouse in the midst of towering trees! Recline in a rocking chair and watch the sunset over the mountains or try your hand at some stargazing on the NEST deck overlooking the forest while listening to the nightly sounds of the forest. In the morning step out on the trailhead and explore the stunning forest. BOOK SOON!

If your travel dates are not available on this calendar visit one of our sister properties by visiting our profile! The space The space
Relax at night while you listen to gentle owls and enjoy the twinkling stars above while you warm up near a home-made stone fireplace area with bulb strung lights encircling the area. In the morning walk to the national trailhead location while the sun breaks through the trees as you hear the gentle stream of a nearby creek!

We are a RARE find in the area located on PRIVATE land and one of the only rentals in the Red River Gorge that is located so conveniently INSIDE the National Park just walking distance to great nearby hiking trails! If your dates are unavailable be sure to check out our other listings as well such as The EY Breeze and Lions Lair each providing its own unique accommodations.

This treehouse is one of our original builds and receives high reviews due to its unique build and amenities such as a swing underneath a separate bedroom called the nest which is 16ft off the ground and a handmade stone fireplace with ambient lighting.

We guarantee you this combination of outdoors & amenities provides a truly unique adventurous magical and relaxing getaway experience with your friends or and loved ones! We look forward to having you stay with us and be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!

We look forward to having you stay with us and be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!

Title: Oasis Treehouse Atlanta
Description:
Water Forest Retreat Tree House is a 168 sq ft. private heated and electrified tiny home with stained glass windows surrounding an oak tree nestled in 100 acres of forest. Enjoy your favorite drink out on the deck up in the trees while watching the birds. There are 2 1/2 miles of hiking trails with a brook waterfall marsh and pond. Come here to hike fish or just relax in this beautiful forest. We also have an OCTAGON and HIKER‚ÄôS HAVEN house. Please click on our profile picture to read more. The space The space
Regarding the Corona virus we follow all CDC cleaning protocols. We also supply sanitizer wipes Lysol and hand sanitizer.

Water Forest RetreatTree House is a great place to rejuvenate and enjoy all that Nature has to offer. Here you can hike meditate relax read write mushroom hunt fish create art music photography bird watch cross country ski snowshoe and star gaze as there is little light pollution along with many other activities in a private woodland setting.

The space which is 168 ft.¬≤ or 15.6 m¬≤ has electricity but not running water. Hand sanitizer is provided along with a wash basin or you can use the sink at the main house to wash your hands. Soap wash cloths and towels are stored in a container under the bed. On top of the cabinet there is complimentary hand made glycerin soap. Bottled water is provided or you can fill up a container at the shower as the well water is very good. The composting toilet is conveniently located in the tree house and is vented so there is no odor. Toilet paper is provided. There are directions on the bathroom wall on how to use it. PLEASE READ CAREFULLY so that it will function properly. NEVER urinate with the chute open.

The tree house has a locking door and six large windows with screens and shades for privacy. The key is located on top of the cabinet. There are two stained glass transoms above the front windows and two more in the apexes. The space has a queen size bed with a comfy hybrid coil memory foam mattress. There are 400 thread count sheets with plenty of pillows and quilts along with a faux fur throw. Two bed side tables with Tiffany style lamps complement each side along with two tall white birch logs decorated with branches crystals and fairy lights. Behind the bed side tables are USB ports with cords so you can charge your iPhone. Above the bed hangs a stained glass panel and a ceiling fan for your comfort on warm nights. There is also an electric fireplace for cold nights or you can just enjoy watching the flames without heat. On very cold nights we also supply a propane heater though the electric fireplace is usually sufficient.

Although there is no traditional kitchen there is space inside on top of the cabinet table and outdoor tables to prepare your meals. There is no fridge or microwave. We do have a large lobster pot and a tripod pizza grill available upon request.

There is a cabinet which stores some camping essentials such as a propane camp stove dinnerware cutlery cutting board sugar and sugar substitutes spices oil tin foil creamers pots pans lighters scissors wine bottle and can opener extra light bulbs mugs dish drying cloth umbrellas first aid kit paper towels Lysol cleaner flashlights propane insect repellent and a battery powered lantern. A Kuerig coffee machine is provided with assorted coffees chai latte tea hot chocolate and hot apple cider. There is also a turquoise inlaid wooden table with two chairs where you can dine write or use your computer and a small wall rack for hanging clothes. On top of the rack are two wine glasses binoculars and a mirror. Under the bed there are an assortment of games. Two pottery mugs are provided which Nancy made. The mugs are for sale at 34.00 each. Atop the cabinet is a bowl of snacks and a book binder with more information maps menus and directions on how to use the coffee machine propane stove propane heater and electric fire place.

There are 2 1/2 miles of well maintained wood lined hiking trails with some that follow Goldmine brook to a waterfall that once hosted a grist mill back in the 1700s. You can still see the large stone foundations. Along the trails you will see many of the iconic stone walls that are unique to New England. Maps are provided in the book binder and trail markers are posted along the way. There are many benches and chairs along the trail where you can sit relax and enjoy the scenery. While hiking the trails walking poles or sticks are suggested as the terrain is hilly with some stone steps and steep areas. Two walking sticks hang on the wall in the tree house. Because of the terrain hiking boots are strongly recommended. Due to the nature of the trails no ATV dirt or mountain biking is allowed. These are hiking trails only. We ask that you please respect the private sign as this trail leads to the Octagon where guests may be staying. There is a good distance between the buildings so you will not be able to see each other even in winter. We wanted to make each site secluded and private. While hiking please stay on our side of the brook as the opposite side is owned by our neighbor.

It is a five minute walk to the spring fed pond which is part of Goldmine brook. The brook is rated class A and supports a myriad of wildlife including river otters mink and great blue herons. If you like to fish bring your gear to try for pickerel large and small mouth bass white and yellow perch shiners and native trout. Previous guests have had great luck fly fishing here.

If you are looking for a place to swim canoe or kayak visit Gardner Lake state park in Salem which is only 15 minutes away. ( you will have to supply your own canoe or kayaks) Depending on water flow you can also take a dip right here in the small pool below the Goldmine brook waterfall which is a 20-25 minute walk down the trail or you can go for a swim in gold mine brook pond which is only a five minute walk away. We supply water floats that you can borrow. Looking for some ocean fun? Bluff Point state park in Groton is another good choice. Here they have a beach along with hiking and biking trails. Bluff Point is about 24 minutes away. Both places are free of charge. Please check out our guide book on Airbnb by clicking our profile picture for more things to do in the area.

The outdoor living area is conveniently layered with crushed stone. Enjoy a fire in the fire pit and meals either outdoors or in. On the deck there are two chairs and a mosaic glass table for outdoor dining along with a propane grill and a Mayan style hammock that seats two people. At ground level there is a fire pit with additional tables and chairs zero gravity lounge chairs along with tiki torches for extra light and ambiance. Seasoned wood is available for 6 dollars per five gallon bucket and includes fire starter. Please no wood deliveries after dusk. You can bring your own wood or use any of the wood on the forest floor as long as it is not being used to mark the trails.

There is a Walmart and Big Y one mile away where you can buy food drinks ice and other supplies. Looking for a liquor store? Bozrah Wine and Spirits is one mile one the right heading west on route 82. Since there is no refrigerator you will need to bring your own cooler or you can borrow ours. If you do not wish to cook there are many good restaurants close by. We provide a few menus in the book binder for you to look through. Some restaurants even make deliveries or you can use a delivery app. such as door dash.com

Enjoy a hot private outdoor shower down at the main house. The distance to the shower is about a one minute walk. The shower is private while you are using itbut is shared with other guests. Plush towels washcloths and soap are stored under the bed in a container. Shampoo and conditioner are at the shower. There is a sink here where you can wash your dishes. Under the bed there is a black plastic container to use for dirty dishes. Dish soap and scrubber are provided at the sink. There is a dish drying cloth in the cabinet back at the tree house. Due to freezing temperatures the shower and sink are not available in winter. A wash basin is provided for sponge bathing. The basin is stored under the bed. Simply use the coffee machine or camp stove to make hot water. Guests staying two nights or more during this season are more than welcome to use the inside shower up at the main house. In winter we will take care of washing the dishes.

Because of the distance Wifi is not available in the tree house but is available in the parking area and pottery studio which is a walking distance of about 300 feet. If your device is supported by an Internet provider you will be able to get online.


For the nature enthusiast take part in a guided nature walk where Nancy will discuss the history plants animals geology and mushrooms found in the area. The walk costs 15 dollars per person and lasts about an hour and a half to two hours. We usually cover 2 miles and may go off trail. After the hike we will go to the house and sample some Autumn berry syrup Shagbark hickory syrup sassafras syrup spice bush pepper and acorn or mushroom cookies when available. We also have shagbark hickory syrup for sale. You might want to bring something to drink a snack and your camera.

BEFORE YOU BOOK please keep in mind that this is a fancy form of camping (glamping!) that is semi off grid ( no running water in the Treehouse) with all that camping entails including insects animals sudden weather changes rocky paths and hilly terrain. It is a one minute walk from the parking lot to the tree house and shower. You may get to hear our resident barred owls red fox eastern coyotes or possibly come across a white tailed deer or mink while hiking the trails.

The distance from the parking area to the tree house is about 300 feet with 170 feet of that being in the forest. Since the tree house is small please pack appropriately. We will be more be more than happy to help you with your luggage.

Be mindful of check in and check out times. If you tell us you plan to arrive at three and do not show up until 9 o‚Äôclock realize that we have been waiting many hours for you when we could‚Äôve been doing something else. We have also been running electricity and heat which is wasteful. If you are going to be late please have the courtesy to let us know. Unfortunately our tiny homes are not conducive for lockbox entry and we need to show you around. We also need time to clean after check out for the next guest and are on a tight schedule.

Please read House rules.

Smoking is not allowed inside the tree house but is allowed outside of it.

For people staying two nights or more I will leave you a check in text to see how you‚Äôre doing.

We also have a pottery shop-studio that you are more than welcome to visit. There are many items for sale including hand woven scarves earrings and Shagbark Hickory syrup that I make.

Check out is easy! Please leave the key on top of the cabinet and you‚Äôre all set to go! If you would like to stay longer and hike the trails after check out you are more than welcome!

Bert and I will do everything we can to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable. Please feel free to contact us at anytime during your stay if you need anything. We look forward to hosting you! Guest access Guest access
Hiking trails yard shower and parking area. Please respect the private signs as these trails lead to the octagon or Hiker‚Äôs Haven where guests may be staying. You will not be able to see the octagon or Hiker‚Äôs Haven from the tree house nor they you. We wanted to make all places private and secluded. While hiking please stay on our side of the brook as the opposite side belongs to our neighbor. Thanks for your cooperation! Other things to note Other things to note
Please bring your own personal toiletries food drinks and ice for your cooler. If you do not have a cooler you can borrow ours. We also have extra ice packs if you need them. Also bring suitable footwear for hiking outdoor shower or if you want to walk in the brook as the stones can be slippery. We do not do wood deliveries after dusk but if you would like more wood we will get some ready for you and leave it by the basement door outside.

Title: Sugar Creek Treehouse with hot tub
Description:
Our Cuckoo\s nest tree house is close to many destinations. It is hidden above a small village at the edge of the forest and is good for couples and families with children. The space The space
The tree house stands on the edge of an oak forest overlooking the small village of Bottenbach. Through your own access from the road you are also independent of the associated farm. At night you can switch on a lighting of the path from the parking lot otherwise there is no lighting in the village between approx. 24:00 and 4:00. City-dwellers are always very enthusiastic about the sight of the clear starry sky.
In summer the terrace offers shelter from excessive heat from the canopy and can sit outside for a long time in the evening and enjoy the view. In winter the sun comes through the bare branches and inside the marble plate heater creates a cozy atmosphere.

For child restraint there is a fold-down grid on the ladder in the upper sleeping area (see picture) and doors with latches on the two entrances on the outside on the terrace. Guest access Guest access
Our guests are welcome to come to the farm to watch the daily work pet the animals and also to stoke and grill a campfire. Unfortunately this is not possible near the tree house because of the fire hazard. Other things to note Other things to note
In the neighbouring village of Rennhofen there is a beautiful beer garden Baumhaus. :) Just google :)
We have 2-3 bikes to rent at the farm.

Title: Porumbacu tree house close to Carpathian mountains
Description:
A four-season TREEHOUSE packed with all the modern amenities! An experience to remember with exquisite craftsmanship throughout enjoy the unique features yet simple pleasures of life in the trees! The Treehouse is equipped with radiant heat flooring and a propane fireplace for the winter and air conditioning for the summer! With two bedrooms and one bathroom you will find romance privacy and charm all nestled in the woods near Mount Sunapee and Lake Sunapee.

Knock this one off your bucket list: SLEEP IN A TREEHOUSE! The space The space
A four season TREEHOUSE packed with all the modern amenities! An experience to remember with exquisite craftsmanship throughout enjoy the unique features yet simple pleasures of life in the trees! The Treehouse is equipped with radiant heat flooring and a propane fireplace for the winter and air conditioning for the summer! With two bedrooms and one bathroom you will find romance privacy and charm all nestled in the woods near Mount Sunapee and Lake Sunapee. Knock this one off your bucket list: SLEEP IN A TREEHOUSE!

Every inch of this one-of-a-kind treehouse has been crafted with the utmost attention to detail that invites you to discover the many surprises it holds‚Ä¶ including a mouse house!

Other features include wrap-around deck raised high above the trees where you can relax and enjoy the solitude surrounding you and a lower deck with bench seating and a Weber Spirit grill that converts to a griddle ‚Äì cook your morning pancakes in the great outdoors! In the evening sit back and relax around the fire pit with your favorite drink!

Walk through the hand-crafted ‚ÄòHobbit Door‚Äô to discover a welcoming main room with radiant heated Travertine stone flooring and walls covered with reclaimed barn board from the 1800‚Äôs. Dine at the table built on a kiln-dried tree stump. The galley kitchen is equipped with a microwave convection oven two-burner cook stove and under-the-counter refrigerator/freezer.

A soapstone propane stove keeps the house cozy on snowy winter days while a central air conditioning cools down the heat of the summer.

The treehouse offers two bedrooms to comfortably sleep four. The lower level bedroom has a full size bed and the upstairs bedroom has a queen size bed.

The kitchen is fully stocked with utensils dinnerware pans a toaster and Keurig coffee maker with coffee and creamer.

The tree house is a self-contained private area located on a well-lit road with parking for two vehicles.

Must be 21 years of age or older to rent.Guests have access to the entire property.

Title: Treehouse near Bar Harbor. Luxurious and private!
Description: *Brand New* The Ash Hill Treehouse is suspended between Ash and Maple trees. This is a real treehouse built in the trees and you won‚Äôt want to miss out on an experience like this! Five steps will lead you up a path as you embark on a 100 foot winding bridge elevating you from ground level into the canopy of the trees where you will start your much needed getaway. Relax by the propane fireplace. The perfect place for couples or solo travelers that want to getaway and enjoy the sounds of nature. The space The space\nThe Ash Hill Treehouse is the perfect mix between rustic and modern. Guest access Guest access\nFeel free to walk the 15 acre property and experience nature.

Title: Viking house in the tree! Jacuzzi, Sauna, + 23–° ¬∞!
Description:
The Observatory tree-house is a vacation experience that quite literally rises above the rest! Built not for the faint of heart this tree-top adventure offers the best views of the Red River Gorge. The space The space
Once you trek up to your new home in the swaying Eastern White Pine you may feel exposed to the unforgettable raw nature of the canopy!This tree house is designed for able-bodied folks and is NOT meant for unsupervised or small children.

Ascend the wandering wooden staircases into the canopy to begin your exploration of this pirate ship in the trees.You`ll discover spectacular views from a glass bedroom with built-in skylights a screened-in hammock lounge with plenty of storage and a cozy kitchen with a wrap-around porch.As you navigate from room to room through floating walkways and steep ship ladders you may be wondering what it must have been like to create such an epic abode... Guest access Guest access
Access to Wifi on our red office porch and in the office parking lot. Other things to note Other things to note
Kitchen: The Observatory kitchen has a gas stove french press coffee pot cookware dishware soap and kitchen linens . Above the sink you‚Äôll find a 5-gallon water dispenser for your cooking and cleaning needs. We supply two 5-gallon jugs of potable water during your stay. For perishables a 75 L Yeti cooler is provided. Please bring your own ice.

Living/Dining: Screened-in lounge on the lowest level with a futon and two hammocks a porch and bar-style seating for two on the mid-level and the most spectacular views from the highest level on the Observation deck that leads to the bedroom.

Bathroom: Observatory has a private composting outhouse. You are also welcome to use our guest shower and bathroom at the RRG Headquarters at any time during your stay.

Bedroom: A full bed above the trees and a full-futon in the lower hammock lounge. Please note that while this tree-house was designed for two there is room for two additional guests in the hammock lounge.

Additional Amenities: Weber charcoal grill wall heater in the bedroom solar powered kitchen lights and solar charging station for small electronics battery-powered lanterns and a private fire pit with camp chairs.

**Important** While we allow dogs at our rentals we do not recommend them for Observatory. Your furry friends will most likely not be fans of the steep ladders/stairs.

4WD and high clearance vehicles are recommended but not required.

Title: La Paz at Treehouse Mountain!
Description:
Take in the rustic fairy tale vibe of this custom-made treehouse in the midst of towering trees! Open the 15 ft glass garage door & watch the sunset over the mountains or try your hand at some stargazing on the stargazing deck while listening to the nightly sounds of the forest. In the morning step out on the trailhead and explore the stunning forest of the Red River Gorge

If your travel dates are not available on this calendar visit one of our sister properties by visiting our profile! The space The space
At night listen to gentle owls and enjoy the twinkling stars above on the stargazing deck warm up near a fire while enjoying the solitude that the forest has to offer. In the morning walk to the national trailhead location while the sun breaks through the trees as you hear the gentle stream of a nearby creek!

We are a RARE find in the area located on PRIVATE land and one of the only rentals in the Red River Gorge that is located so conveniently INSIDE the National Park just walking distance to great nearby hiking trails!

If your dates are unavailable be sure to check out our other listings as well such as The Eagles Nest and Lions Lair each providing its own unique accommodations. This treehouse is one of our newest additions providing AC Heat and Electricity!

We guarantee you this combination of outdoors & amenities provides a truly unique adventurous magical and relaxing getaway experience with your friends or and loved ones!

We look forward to having you stay with us and be sure to book soon before it fills up fast!!

Title: Magical Treehouse - winter wonderland getaway!
Description:
www . valterria . com

The Totem Houses of Valterria are located in the Valterria Adventure Park located in the privileged environment of the Merindades.

Imagine sleeping among trees jumping on zip lines taking a ride on our ebikes enjoying the sunset on your terrace with unique views. You can enjoy the tranquility of the rural world and immerse yourself in countless adventures. The space The space
Treehouse located in the forest of the Valterr√≠a adventure park.
Its hexagonal shape accommodates two people with the possibility of a double bed or two single beds.
It has a toilet and a shower.
The terrace of this cabin has east orientation. Guest access Guest access
An adventure park at your feet:

- Climbing zip lines and jumping in a single tower of 24 meters high. Climb up its climbing and climbing tracks or from the stairs inside. An adrenaline monster through which to access the circuits of high rope bridges.

- Hanging bridges. It runs 18 extra long bridges at 11 meters high through the canopies of an oak forest.

- Giant zip line. Jump and slide along the large double zip line of 300 meters in length.

- Enchanted forest of molars. Turn on your imagination thanks to a circuit built between giant rocks joined by bridges and with different challenges.

- Cafeteria. Skewers rations or some dishes that come out of our kitchen‚Ä¶ In a family atmosphere and with the best views of the Merindad.

- Food Truck. Come and see our Foodtruck mounted on the chassis of an old bus that will delight young and old. In the you can enjoy our pizzas and focattias with a wide variety of ingredients waffles creps ice cream and much more in our adventure atmosphere.

www . valterria . com

Title: Varena Treehouse West
Description:
Our lovely space is a lush urban oasis and permaculture farm. Enjoy goats pigs emus roosters parrots tortoises cats and friendly people. Located in Little Haiti near art district 15 minutes from airport and South Beach. Fresh veggies eggs and honey when available! Late night train horns and early rooster crows also!
Please check in by 7 pm on arrival day. The space The space
Walk up narrow staircase to the 3rd level of the treehouse nestled within the pithocilobium tree. Feel like youe living in the trees! Beautiful view of canopy and animals. There\s a double bed for two. Shared kitchen downstairs. The Bahamas style bathroom is located a few steps away from the Treehouse and the lovely outdoor shower is also close by. Bathroom and shower have hot water.
Due to height of treehouse no children are allowed (sorry). From the canopy room you will hear animal sounds and possibly midnight train horns.
Mosquitos are at their peak during rainy season (June-September) we have a net over the bed citronella candle two fans and incense to keep them away from you in the Treehouse but that\s not a guarantee.
Miami summer is hot. While our beautiful canopy of trees helps keep the farm a lot cooler than other parts of the city be mindful that the Treehouse only has fans for cooling. It does not have an air conditioner. Please consider our Cozy Cabin room or Cute Cedar Camper listings if you are sensitive to mosquitoes or prefer air conditioning. Click on my photo and scroll down to see all our interesting listings on the farm!
Please check-in by 7 pm.Guest access

Title: Treehouse Lika 1
Description:
‚ÄúLa Selva at Nomad Tree Lodge‚Äù is an adventure accommodation offering a Home to surfers yogis and nomads from around the world.

We offer daily yoga and foot access to 2 world class surf breaks (intermediate/ advanced).

Were not perfect were not luxury but life here is really beautiful in its raw simplicity. If you sign up for this adventure commit to surrendering to the jungle and immersing yourself in this unique experience.

NOTE: wifi in communal space only no guest kitchen. The space The space
Our rooms are all uniquely beautiful in their rustic simplicity. Think of the space more as ‚Äúglamping‚Äù than as a hotel.

You will get to your cabin by a series of pathways & rope bridges through the trees. Nestled in the jungle your little a-frame treehouse Cabina is your own little jungle nest to reset & relax.

The Treehouse is breezy and open (even though its 100% screened and protected from bugs) and youll often see monkeys right out your front door! Listen to the waves crashing at night and the jungle sounds in the morning. Your little Paradise.

You‚Äôll have access to the shared bathhouse with a bathroom and shower shared with 1 other cabin.Guest access
You will have access to the pool yoga shala and the main lounge where we have wifi connection and seating. For an additional charge we offer breakfast and daily yoga classes.

We dont have a shared kitchen! But there are plenty of restaurants nearby.

Title: ER69 - Rachel's Tree House - Great location...close to all the action!
Description: Come sleep in the trees...This is the perfect place to come when you need a break. This beautiful treehouse sits on five acres of wooded property minutes from the 75/285 and less than two miles from the The Battery and Truist Park. After your walk down the sparkling path past the firepit you enter the house by crossing three bridges to the porch. Has a full kitchen and bathroom. The sleeping loft has a ships ladder and a king size bed with soft linen bedding. Truly awesome place to recharge. The space The space\nThe large 400 square foot deck sits 23 feet in the air. full in suit bathroom fiber internet kitchen and AC/Heat. Its a great way to recharge your soul when you need a break from the norm. Other things to note Other things to note\nPets are welcome but there is a $65 pet fee.

Title: Mink Cove Treehouse
Description:
NOW WITH ELECTRIC!! The Treetop Flyer is a small one-room treehouse with a loft wrap-around porch lower deck propane grill and nearby fire pit. There is NO PLUMBING but we provide a jug of spring water and theres an outhouse at the base of the stairs. The farm also has a centrally located Community Kitchen and a Bath House which are shared with other guests on the farm. NO PETS - NO EXCEPTIONS. Please read ALL the house rules and full description. HomeGrown HideAways is also on FB and IG. The space The space
HomeGrown HideAways is a hundred-acre farm campground and event facility with treehouses yurts cabins camping etc. The owners Nathan & Jessa live onsite with a parade of dogs cats chickens and ducks. For the safety of our own animals (and yours) we cannot allow any additional animals onto the farm. Anyone arriving with an animal of any kind will not be allowed to stay and no refund will be given.

INTERIOR: The interior of the Treetop Flyer is complete with 4 double beds pillows sheets and light blankets (2 futons that fold open on the main floor and 2 mattresses in the loft) barnwood table with 2 benches for eating and playing games and a jug of spring water. There is an electric fireplace for heat but no indoor plumbing. You get the entire treehouse to yourself. A trash can is provided but we do not have trash service on the farm so you need to take your trash to town with you upon departure. (NOTE: Please let us know if you plan to bring your own linens. We offer a linen discount of $3 per person if we don‚Äôt have to do extra laundry. Beds will still come with a fitted sheet and pillows with pillowcases just no blankets or top sheet. You can request the discount as a refund or farm credit to use towards eggs firewood or other items).

EXTERIOR: The treehouse features a covered wrap-around porch above and massive deck below with swing picnic table propane grill and firewood bundles (bring cash). The upstairs porch and lower deck have solar lights. Please note that the lights do not come on until dark and they will only stay on for as much time as the battery was able to re-charge during the day. A private outhouse is just a few steps away from the base of the stairs or you can use the shared-use bath house in the main camping field. There is also a nearby firepit that overlooks the gardens. Parking is available at the base of the treehouse is but very limited. If you are bringing a group some will need to park in the parking area near the Community Kitchen.

CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT: Guests can check in any time after 4pm but we do recommend arriving before dark. Depending on our cleaning schedule we may be able to accommodate an earlier arrival time with advance notice. Rentals are unlocked so guests can just follow the instructions sent with the check-in email to find their location and let themselves in. Check-out is at 11am so that we have time to clean the rental before the next guest arrives. If something comes up and you need to leave before your scheduled check-out date please do us the courtesy of sending a message once you have cell service so that we know not to expect you.

UNPLUG AND RECONNECT: HomeGrown HideAways does not have cell service or wifi but there is a landline in the Community Kitchen for guests to use. We hope that you will take the opportunity to re-connect with nature yourself your family and other guests. In addition to the shared kitchen space we also have a pavilion with cornhole set up for rainy days and a massive bonfire area where we encourage guests to pitch in on firewood to share stories and s‚Äômores. Please note that quiet hours are from 10pm ‚Äì 7am and sound carries far in the holler.

SHARED BATH HOUSE: In addition to year-round outhouses there is a seasonal BATH HOUSE with 4 flush toilets and 2 solar-heated showers. The bath house is rustic with a concrete floor so we recommend shower shoes or flip flops. Towels and toiletries are not provided but we do have extra for purchase if you forget yours. In the winter months when the bath house is closed we open the restrooms in the community building for showering (1 full bath and 1 half bath).

COMMUNITY KITCHEN: The farm has a brand new (2021) centrally-located solar-powered chef-inspired COMMUNITY KITCHEN with 4 ovens 5-burner gas cooktop microwave refrigerator with farm-fresh eggs coffee-maker toaster dishes cutlery baking sheets basic cooking supplies (oil salt pepper etc) plus HomeGrown farm goods s‚Äômore kits and other goodies. BRING CASH for the honor system. Please remember that this space is available for ALL visitors of the farm so guests are expected to clean up after themselves and not to loiter when others are waiting. To prevent over-crowding we ask that a maximum of TWO people from your group occupy the space at a time and children MUST be accompanied by a guardian at all times. Meals may be eaten at the picnic tables on the porch under the pavilion or you can take food back to your site. FOOD SCRAPS MUST BE PUT INTO THE COMPOST BIN ‚Äì NOT IN THE TRASH. Please do not discard food on the ground as it can make our animals sick and attract unwanted wildlife.

THE FARM: We are a farm in the mountains so we have all the good (beautiful views babbling brook hiking trails) and the bad (insects howling coyotes poison ivy) that nature has to offer so come prepared. We recommend hiking boots bug spray and weather-appropriate clothing. Be prepared to encounter INSECTS (mosquitoes ticks chiggers) WILDLIFE (deer turkey snakes toads and dare we mention the bear track we spotted one spring?) WEATHER (hot cold rain snow) TOXIC PLANTS (poison ivy stinging nettle wild mushrooms) just to name a few. There is a steep and rugged 1.5-mile hiking loop that takes most folks about an hour (if they can get past the first 10-minute uphill climb). We also have playground swings disc golf hula hoops a croquet set and a creek full of geodes to hunt.

CAMPFIRES: Most sites have their own fire pit except for the primitive camping area. There is also a large communal fire pit near the Community Kitchen. Due to the spread of invasive insects we ask that you DO NOT BRING FIREWOOD unless it is store-bought/kiln dried. We have bundles for sale here for $5/bundle (bring cash) or you can scavenge dead wood from the forest floor for free. DO NOT cut down live trees and DO NOT burn plastic glass trash gas or anything that isn‚Äôt wood or paper. There is plenty of fire-starting materials under the Pavilion next to the bundles. On your way to the farm you will pass the local fire department. Please make note of the fire danger sign. If the fire danger is high a campfire may not be advisable ‚Äì please check for local burn bans.

SMOKING: Smoking is not permitted within the vicinity of any building on the farm. Please do not discard cigarette butts in the firepits or on the ground. They must be completely extinguished and can be thrown in the trash.

TRASH: In case you missed it before we do not have trash pick-up on the farm and very much appreciate it if you can take your trash with you when you leave the farm. We do have recycling bins for clean plastic and aluminum cans. Paper and cardboard can be put in the box next to the firewood bundles under the pavilion for others to use for starting fires. We also have a compost bin available for all food scraps paper napkins and paper plates. Please do not discard food on the ground as it can make our animals sick and attract unwanted wildlife.

MOTORIZED VEHICLES: We do not allow ATVs 4-wheelers golf carts or any non-medical motorized transportation. Bicycles are welcome and encouraged.

GENERATORS: We highly discourage the use of generators as they can be quite noisy and produce toxic fumes. Please talk to us in advance if you require one for a specific purpose.

ACCIDENTS: If a child or member of your party has an accident involving bodily fluids please take the time to clean up after them. First aid kits are supplied in most rentals and in the Community Kitchen. If bedding is involved we have coin-operated laundry facilities in the Community building to begin the washing process. Please notify us of such events.

COOLERS & CANDLES: Coolers should be left outside so that the condensation doesnt damage our floors. Candles are not allowed due to too many wax spills.

NEARBY: We are just 8 miles from the Berea Pinnacles 6 miles from Get Outside Ky (they rent canoes kayaks SUPs and e-bikes) 3 miles to Tater Knob Pottery 20 minutes to Anglin Falls and a scenic hour from Red River Gorge. Berea is known for its arts and crafts the historic Berea College and outdoor recreation. In addition to hiking at the Pinnacles there are several other trails throughout town and the newly opened Silver Creek Bike Park.

NOMS: Our favorite places to eat in Berea are Noodle Nirvana Native Bagel Company Happy Jack‚Äôs World Sandwich Bar Nightjar Apollo Pizza PapaLeno‚Äôs and El Rio Grande. In Richmond we like Masala Indian Purdy‚Äôs Coffee Co. and Thai Smile. Note: Madison County is DRY Berea is MOIST and Richmond is WET so plan your alcohol accordingly. Guest access Guest access
Guests have access to all 100 acres of the farm EXCEPT the private rentals the residence and the chicken/duck houses. DO NOT LET YOUR CHILDREN CHASE THE BIRDS!

We HIGHLY recommend arriving before dark. There are very few streetlights on the road coming in and none on the farm. It gets REALLY dark out here and some of our city guests have a bit of trouble with this.

Rentals are unlocked for your arrival. Be sure to save/screenshot/download the check-in instructions you receive in your inbox as there‚Äôs no wifi or cell service once you arrive. Other things to note Other things to note
Items we recommend bringing: CASH for firewood eggs and farm goods; bug spray; hiking shoes/mudboots; slippers; earplugs (sometimes the coyotes throw big parties); and shower shoes (the bath house is rustic with a concrete floor).

We live onsite. If you have any issues during your stay PLEASE come knock on our door so we can assist. Theres nothing worse than finding out in the review that you didnt enjoy your stay and its something we could have easily fixed.

We are constantly striving to make the farm better and sometimes we forget to update the listings with the latest changes and improvements. For the most up-to-date information we suggest you follow our HomeGrown HideAways social media accounts where we also advertise on-farm workshops classes and events.

Title: La Pitalaya hut, perched at 7m, romantic night
Description:
Beautiful views of Lake Petit and the mountains all YEAR! This chalet has been completely remodeled and is just beautiful! If your wanting a romantic getaway in the mountains it would be hard to beat this one. The lake with boat rentals and miles of hiking trails. The cabin is close to Big Canoes core amenities and trails. This cabin has upgraded high speed WIFI and TVs in each room. Many of our guests come and end up buying a home here. If your looking to relax THIS IS THE PLACE! The space The space
This chalet has one bedroom and one bath. It is approximately 600 square feet. The kitchen is completely stocked with everything you would need to cook a full meal and then some. There are two TVs in the cabin one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Both have smart devices attached to them if you have netflix or some other streaming service. The couch is also a sleeper sofa that turns into a queen bed. This cabin is maintained IMMACULATELY. If your looking to come to the mountains this is the place! We occasionally allow guests with a child to stay in the cabin as a fourth person. But you must ask. WE DO NOT WANT MORE THAN TWO ADULTS STAYING IN THIS CABIN.

**Owner is a licensed real estate agent lic#370513
The owner is a licensed real estate agent with Harry Norman Realtors and is always willing to show properties in Big Canoe and nearby communities with Guest access Guest access
All of chalet. Laundry room is only available if guests are staying over three days or if specifically requested by the guest. Other things to note Other things to note
NO SMOKING OR PETS INSIDE THE CABIN!

Title: Forest Treehouse
Description:
Unusual accommodation open all year round: dream cabins just for you perched 10 meters in the trees (easy and secure access). Isolated from everything peace is guaranteed for an unforgettable night in the heart of the forest for lovers families or friends ideal as a gift for those you love. The space The space
Perched on a magnificent tree the Mauret wood hut is comfortable and rustic. Access is from a wooden staircase and then a footbridge fully secured by a net that leads directly to a small terrace. Inside many windows create a bright atmosphere and allow you to fully enjoy the surroundings.
It is equipped with dry toilets a kitchenette with gas and sink a cozy seating area additional heating tables and chairs inside and on the terrace storage areas and solar electricity (lamps and socket).
This cabin does not have a shower. We provide you towels and gloves for a rustic toilet in the kitchen sink.
Upstairs there are two small bedrooms under the rooftops. In all the cabin is designed to accommodate four people in hotel formula that is to say clean and prepared beds... you do not have sheets to bring and breakfast is provided. Guest access Guest access
A 10-minute walk in the forest from the parking lot takes you to the foot of a staircase (plan a pair of sneakers). This leads you to the departure of a suspended walkway to the terrace of the cabana. Other things to note Other things to note
Breakfast included in the price. For meals you can cook in the cabin or go to a nearby restaurant.

Title: In Brendez√Ø - Les Cabanes des Volcans
Description:
Text idea for your hut


 As long as there are huts in
the woods nothing will be totally lost. 

Whether you are a child in the countryside or in the city the hut is a part of your childhood.
What if for the time of a getaway you find the joys of these suspended moments?
Go for an atypical stay by combining well-being and respect for nature in a chic and intimate setting offset from everyday life.
All in newly clothed wood. The space The space
Unique... Cassis cabin. The cabin is installed on a wide platform hanging from the trees and supported by stilts. Accessible on one level thanks to the natural slope you will however have the real feeling of being high with 5 m under your feet.
the cabin is insulated in sheep\s wool. It ensures natural softness in the middle of the season and freshness in the summer. It includes a 140 cm bed that faces a glazed window. Lying down you\ll have a bird \s-eye view of nature. a hanging wooden walkway

A bathroom is at your disposal : a showera sink and a private toilet. The bathroom is private to the hutTowels are provided

The hut has electric light but also photophores for a more romantic atmosphere!

If you can	 separate from your mobile phone or computer you will be able to charge it on a socket.

A small fridge in the cabin and an espresso coffee machine are providedno breakfast scheduled.

You will spend a stay in lazy mode during summer bucolic during spring shimmering during fall and in trapper mode during winter !

Title: TreeHouse in the Cloud, (Close  toTheme Parks
Description:
A treehouse 4 m from the ground where you will sleep in the intoxicating smells of wood. Here nature gives you all its secrets without electricity with dry toilets and well water a return to springs away from the world. Village at 1km.

NEW !
In winter Philippe offers extra heating for warm evenings in the hut. The space The space
Philippe and C√©cile built this spruce cabin made of douglas and insulated with straw it offers rustic comfort. The 25-square-metre platform is accessed via a milled staircase. There is everything you need to sleep rest and have fun for children : a sofa bed games reading a small table and two Chilean girls for the terrace ..
When handing over the keys a bottle of water 4 cups a garbage bag and a battery lamp will be provided. All you have to do is plan your picnic and bedding kit. Guest access Guest access
In a forest of 10000 m¬≤ a zip line games branches to make huts will delight young and old alike.
A picnic table a dry toilet a pump on the well for a toilet in the wild. Other things to note Other things to note
At an altitude of 940 m nights can be cool !
C√©cile and Philippe recommend that you come equipped with a warm down.
For your winter evenings if you\d like you\ll be offered extra heating for ‚Ç¨5 for refuelling.

We also rent a lovely Ecological House Gorges de l \Ard√®chein Chauzon.
You can find all of our rentals on airbnb.

Title: Rainforest Tree House with Hot Springs
Description:
The Arrow is a classic hit you in your heart A-frame with the addition of a swinging rope bridge! What more could you want? This treehouse is a favorite and youll see why! It is simple yet cozy and comfortable. There is a queen-sized bed and a bathroom with a beautiful claw-foot bathtub. This is the perfect retreat for couples! (Not designed for children). The space The space
The Arrow is a classic A-frame with the addition of a swinging rope bridge. It is simple yet cozy and comfortable. There is a queen-sized bed and a bathroom with a beautiful claw-foot bathtub. Guest access Guest access
You will have the whole treehouse to yourself! Other things to note Other things to note
Since these are treehouses you will need to e-sign a liability waiver. We are located in the woods so all animals and insects that come with nature will be prevalent.
Since we are in a rural area we have limited wifi available. Also there is a long hilly driveway. If the weather is rough you will need to be careful. If you get stuck we will assist you if we are available. A four-wheel drive vehicles is recommended if there is snow.

Title: Sulfur Ridge-Tennessee's First Luxury Treehouse ¬Æ
Description:
Cozy 15 m2 cabin on the edge of the forest perched 5 m on stilts.
Located at the Porte des Vosges 25 minutes from Epinal 40 minutes from Gerardmer Lake and the slopes in winter.
Many mountain bike trails in the village of Julien Absalon.
Possibility of booking by the week or on dates other than those displayed on request. The space The space
1 double bed on the mezzanine 1 convertible bed in the living room. If you want to sleep on the net: provide a sleeping bag.
Kitchen with dining area refrigerator dishwasher oven and microwave.
Bathroom with sink shower and dry toilet.
Electric radiators for a warm atmosphere.

For cooking you will have at your disposal organic eggs olive oil vinegar salt pepper herbs of Provence flour rice pasta.
Breakfast is not served but you will find for your stay homemade jam 1/2 liter of milk as well as a serving of butter and a small brick of orange juice per person.
Coffee pods and tea will also be available in number.

No wifi but very good 4G reception for SFR good for Orange.

For reservations of 2 nights in winter we provide two bobs and will give you the location a toboggan spot 30 minutes away.

Title: The most spectacular treehouse in Colombia.
Description:
The hut perched in the 21st century in the paradise of the Ard√®che . In a space of one hectare you have an appointment with an exceptional place. Equipped with hottub and sauna heated by wood you will love the magnificent terraceshammock etc.... The space The space
Hottub (= Nordic bath) and private sauna heated by wood stoves.
The operation of the hottub and sauna is your responsibility. It takes between 4 and 6 hours of heating for the 1500 litres of water in the hottub and 15 to 20 minutes for the sauna. Other things to note Other things to note
Rental from 2 nights. July and August from a week.
Barbecues have been prohibited since 2010 by the Prefect of the Ardeche.

Title: Lost Garden _ treehouse on the edge of the reserve
Description:
For an overnight stay a weekend or a week come and recharge your batteries in a warm wooden hut on stilts and all comfort !
You will enjoy a para-hotel service the bed (queen size) is made towels are provided cleaning and disinfection of the room are included.
The large bathtub promises you moments of relaxation.
The kitchen area allows you to be independent.
I propose you the classic or customizable breakfast (price extra). Other things to note Other things to note
Before your stay you can order me additional services (cheese platter surprises decoration bouquets of flowers balloons ...) as well as your classic or personalized breakfast!
Rate based on the chosen formulas.

Title: Celesterra: Transformation Amidst Heaven and Earth
Description:
Icaco Treehouse is a tiny gem hidden away in the mountains of Rio Grande just 25 minutes drive from the SJU airport and below the rainforest. The name comes from the first indigenous living here meaning God of the mountain; who is said to protect us from natural disasters. It is nettled by the side of a peaceful arterial stream of the Esp√≠ritu Santo river on a 9-acre farm with private entrance. A perfect place to relax disconnect from the craziness out there and reconnect with nature. The space The space
Because of the Covid situation unfortunately right now Im not provided sheets blankets nor pillows for safety matters. Also I dont host pets! I hope that you can understand me and come to my place because youll have the most amazing nature experience in the Caribbean. Youll love the beauty of the surrounds: including a rustic tiny house that comfortably fits 4 and provides basic amenities for a comfortable stay with a view of the Yunque National Rainforest. The first floor is fitted with a small electric stove and water reservoir hand-pumped from the cristal clear stream connected to the sink and the shower below. Also there is a basic bathroom with toilet paper.

The friendly calm Esp√≠ritu Santo river lays at the doorstep. With its natural pools its the perfect place to chill with a beer and enjoy its shallow waters. Also youll be able to walk through a trail where youll see many beautiful trees and birds.

Please be gentle with windows and mahogany surfaces. Take good care of this gem so others can enjoy it as much as you and youll return. This is a property with full contact with nature. So insects lizards and non-poisonous snakes bound around. The river is easily hike-able but enjoy it at your own risk and be aware of rising water levels.Guest access

Title:
The best in tiny living!
TreehouseTopia
Description:
The Trade Winds Treehouse is simply our most luxurious getaway in the forest. Two twin treehouses perch side by side like owls roosting on a limb. It features full electricity running water heat a private bathhouse a slide and even a hot tub! The space The space
*Important*
Access to this cabin requires driving up a gravel road with various steep sections. Most vehicles can make it but we do recommend 4WD and/or high clearance. If your vehicle cannot make it we can give you and your things a ride up.

Full Bathroom: featuring tile shower flush toilet hand sink towel hooks bath exhaust fan and more! Approximately 50 feet away from the two tree houses on a gravel path with night lighting. The bathhouse is a log cabin which includes a living room area loft with a full size bed plus a comfy couch & bar sink (sleeps 3 total)

Full Compact Kitchen: featuring 3 burner stove half size fridge cookware eating utensils dish rack kichten sink rolling island with integrated cutting board kitchen exhaust fan and ample lighting. Interior seating in the kitchen is limited but can accomodate 6 people with additional outside seating available.

Two treehouses: one master quarters with a queen mattress downstairs plus a sleeping loft for 1 additional person (sleeps 3 total) and the other features a kitchen downstairs compact futon downstairs and sleeping loft with a full size mattress upstairs (sleeps 3 total)

Full electricity plumbing and flush toilet

SPRING-FED HOT TUB! Enjoy in the spring summer and fall! We need to disconnect it when temperatures are below freezing. 

Amazing all natural location.

Ample parking for 3 or more cars.

Easy access to exceptional hiking trails and climbing areas including several within walking distance.

Title: Tree house safari
Description:
Pure relaxation in the middle of nature in a beautiful valley in the Eastern Algarve between S√£o Br√°s de Alportel and Tavira.

You have an open living and sleeping area a kitchen bathroom with walkin shower a separate compost toilet and a large sunny terrace. In the garden barbecue hammocks and a small pool to cool down. The space The space
It is equipped with a double bed (with mosquito net) oven with comfortable seating area. Kitchen with gas stove. Guest access Guest access
In the garden there is a barbecue hammocks and a small pool to cool down. Other things to note Other things to note
We live here Off the Grid solar power water from our own well. There is a compost toilet - save water - save the planet :) Licence number Licence number

Title: Suburban Treehouse Getaway - Newly Renovated!
Description:
Secluded cottage near Hocking Hills attractions. Scenic woods and ravines. Private stocked lake open for swimming catch and release fishing and non-motor boats. Great for cozy nights inside by the fire or as a home base for exploring the Hills. There is a large gravel hill at the entrance to our cabin. 4-wheel drive is required with any severe weather conditions (ice snow heavy rain). Get ready to unwind and enjoy nature. The space The space
Stocked pond for fishing and swimming. Scenic views. Community area with shelter house and picnic tables. Plenty of books movies and games. Guest access Guest access
Full access to cabin and lot. Access to private lake and community areas including dock shelter house picnic area and basketball hoop. Other things to note Other things to note
4WD is required for all severe weather conditions (ice snow heavy rain)

Title: THE BELLA LUNA Romantic Mountain Treehouse
Description:
Skyview Tree House - Casa Kalitero is a unique accomodation surrounded by olive groves and green. 5 to 10 min distance from Airport Zakynthos town and Kalamaki Beach.

The Tree House is located behind a cypress hill therefore not on a busy street. Zakynthos town is in 30 min walking distance. The combination of the ambience and privacy makes Casa Kalitero Tree House the ideal place for an extraordinary and relaxing holiday. Enjoy the romantic nights with the panoramic sky view from your bed. The space The space
The tree house is next to the main House Casa Kalitero. Its surrounded by the garden of the property with plenty space to relax. The tree house is fully lockable and weatherproof. Access is very easy and possible for everyone.

The tree house:
-Electricity
-Coffee machine with coffee and tea
-Water heater
-Flowing water
-Mini fridge & freezer
-Dishes
-Double bed (1.30 x 2m) with panoramic sky view
-Mini Bathroom with toilet and hairdryer
-WIFI
-Fan
-Insect screens on the windows
-Mini balcony with garden view

Outside the tree house:
-Free parking
-Private outdoor rain shower with warm water and changing room including bathrobes
-Covered terrace with relaxing area and dining table
-Sunbeds and umbrellas in the garden
-Access to the organic garden fruits

Title: Caba√±a Treehouse Mountain View
Description:
*Bathroom and kitchen renovations coming Spring 2022.*

Our Sea Loft is a great opportunity to stay in a unique treehouse-like space. It has the privacy of a single-family home yet its close to many amenities!

Please read the full detailed description for more information before booking. Hope to see you soon! The space The space
Our home is unique because it offers the privacy of a single family home that is surrounded by trees and peaceful marsh views but its also in a fantastic location close to great dining shopping and activities in Harbour Town.

The Sea Loft is bright and airy inside with an open-concept kitchen/dining/living area with floor to ceiling windows throughout the home. It has one bedroom with a queen bed but we are able to accommodate up to four people with a murphy bed and sleeper sofa in the living area.

Our home is clean comfortable and quiet. Please note that the current photos do not reflect the updates coming Spring 2022. New pictures to come! Guest access Guest access
Guests have access to the entire home. Other things to note Other things to note
Please note that the Sea Loft is pet free and smoke free. There are stairs on the property. There is a driveway area but please note that it is not paved.

Title: Cozy West Virginia Treehouse
Description:
Welcome to Hemlock Hill Hideaway - a unique glamping experience while being minutes from Boone city limits!!

A perfect place to connect with nature! The space The space
The treehouse is approximately 10x10. There is a loft consisting of a full-size mattress while facing a clear semi-see-through roof. A futon with a full-size memory foam mattress sits below it.

DURING THE WINTER MONTHS (NOVEMBER 7 TO TBD) there is a non-water portable toilet in a tent off the treehouse but NO sink or shower amenities. (Please see the picture provided.) We do not have the means to keep water from freezing when temperatures fall below freezing and do not want to risk damaging our bathroom items. You will need to bring water for cleaning and drinking.

PLEASE REMEMBER THAT WINTER IN THE MOUNTAINS CAN BE UNPREDICTABLE. We might have snow. We might not. We might have ice. We might not. If you decide to venture out here during the winter months please be prepared to deal with snow and ice. The steps to the treehouse can get treacherous. We work very hard to keep our guests informed of the weather conditions - particularly bad weather. We are also not responsible for any accidents or injuries or damages to your vehicles that might occur as the result of the bad weather.

(During the spring summer and fall months the bathroom will consist of a portable toilet and sink in a tent off the treehouse. A shower station sits on the other side of the treehouse. Although there is no plumbing both have water. You would only need to bring drinking water for yourselves.)

There is electricity and WiFi. There is a cooler and an electric kettle available for you to use. Outside of the treehouse there is a fire pit a grill a hammock and a slide - plenty to do while relaxing in nature!

Please bring blankets/sleeping bags and pillows to sleep. (Both the foam mattress & futon will have freshly laundered sheets.)

A space heater is provided but you will still need to make sure you bring plenty of blankets to keep warm. Also - be aware that plugging in too many devices along with the space heater can trip the breaker.

If you plan to use the grill please bring your own charcoal. Grilling utensils are provided.

Firewood is provided for the fire pit.

Although smoking is allowed on the premises we ask that you do not smoke inside the treehouse. If you decide to smoke please clean up after yourselves.

Checking out is easy! We ask that you throw away your trash & recycles and return the key to the lockbox. We will take care of the rest! There is no need to refill the water or take the sheets off of the mattresses. Guest access Guest access
Please park in the designated parking area as shown in the picture.

We are located at the end of a quiet street - although we are minutes away from US-421 and all of the amenities the High Country has to offer!

1 mile - Pine Run Paddle Access for kayaking canoeing and tubing
2 miles - Food Lion
~4 miles - Blue Ridge Parkway entrance (we are close to two BR Parkway entrances)
4 miles - Rocky Knob Mountain Bike Park
4 miles - Brookshire Park
7 miles - Starbucks Other things to note Other things to note
The hideaway is behind our backyard so you may see/hear us from time to time. There may be a cat or a dog running around although we find that they do not go out there as much without us.

If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to ask. Thank you!

Title: Magical Treehouse: Secluded Mountain View Off-Grid
Description:
This unique treehouse Le Beau Marais has been featured on the hit TV Show Island Life¬© on HGTV¬© and is what vacation dreams are made of. Enjoy the newly expanded spacious deck where you are one with nature and where the deer will greet you as you sip your morning coffee. Walk to many shops and restaurants HERITAGE PGA golf tournament and the iconic Lighthouse in Harbour Town Yacht Basin. You have access to 3 private beaches in Sea Pines. The space The space
This 2022 renovated home features 2 private ensuite bedrooms and is a unique escape destination and one of Travel & Leisure‚Äôs¬© top Islands in the Americas with top-of-the-line comforts of any 5-star luxury rental or hotel suite. The treehouse is only rented out a few months of the year. If you find this book it.

Le Beau Marais is in the thick of everything yet tucked away into a private and tranquil world that is perfect for clearing your mind and refreshing your soul.

You should not need to pack anything other than your flip-flops golf clubs and a toothbrush. We hope we have included everything and anything you could ever desire or ask for.

Unique to Deer Island homes this home features full-sized appliances.

200Mg+ High-Speed internet

4 Tommy Bahama¬© backpack beach chairs with umbrella towels etc.

High thread count linens with several pillows
Each bedroom has alarm clocks ceiling fans earplugs etc.
Fully provisioned kitchen including cookware bakeware drinkware wine and beverages coffee condiments breakfast necessities snacks and the usual condiments. Other things to note Other things to note
This home is pet-free smoke-free and not a good fit for families with children under 2. The exterior staircase will be difficult for small children.

Title: Whispering Pines Treehouse
Description:
Ti Kas is all wood with one bedroom with a king size bed complete kitchen saloon with smart TV with WiFi connection & sofa. In case of a third person an extra bed will be provided. One toilet inside & bath on the balcony. From the guest balcony theres a wonderful view of the ocean & neighbouring Martinique. Lush greenery & birds surrounds our property including seven varieties of mangoes Lime Lemon & sour orange trees. Yoga & mediation place is available. Please see pics for more. The space The space
You will have an opportunity to be one with nature. Bamboo plants bird song and clean fresh air. Tropical rains are also welcome since it helps maintain the lush green so abundant all around. Its also a quiet getaway from all the distractions. Tropical plants are on location...Coconut six varieties of Mangoes Bananas Avocado Lime Lemon Soursop and the famous sour Orange trees among other trees. . . . . Guest access Guest access
Please see pictures of entire property that are listed.. Since the gate is automatic an electronic key will be issued to guests upon arrival for their convenience. Other things to note Other things to note
Private parking is available to all guests. The La Toc and Vigi beach can be reached after 10 minutes driving. Theres a hospital nearby where COVID-19 test can be done if YOUR country requires it for reentry.

Beautiful luxury chalet perched in the trees. A beautiful place to relax in complete privacy with the sound of the small adjacent river. The cottage has all the amenities a king bed as well as a spa among trees. Located in the heart of nature you will find relaxation and fresh air! Guests can also enjoy microbrewery beers in the village of Sutton and other surrounding villages.

Title: Modern Tree Dwelling w/Water Views+Cedar Hot Tub
Description:
This treehouse is one of a kind and made out of recycled materials placed 20ft up a tree! It is a cozy place to relax and be completely surrounded by nature there is no water or electricity. It is located about a 1/2 mile from our check-in office/parking. Cars are not allowed at the camping sites and parking is available at the main office. They are hike in or we will provide transportation only once at check in and once at check out. The space The space
Made of of recycled materials and placed 20ft up a tree the treehouse is a cozy place with one bedroom three beds and back deck with table and chairs for relaxing. Please be aware that there is no water or electricity. Sometimes in summer months it still be very warm at night! The treehouse is in a remote location. Commercial vehicles are not allowed at the site. You must leave your car at our main office and then either hike in or be shuttled in. Guest access Guest access
Guests cannot drive their car to the treehouse. Parking is available in a gravel lot at our main office. We will transport guests once upon check-in and once at check-out. Any other time you must walk.

There is an outhouse directly across from the treehouse and regular bathrooms and showers are conveniently located at our main office along with wi-fi. Other things to note Other things to note
The Treehouse is located about a 1/2 mile from our check-in office/parking. We will provide transportation once at check-in and once at check-out. We have maps to get you to downtown Helen from via the Hardman Farm trail located across the street from our main office.

Guests need to bring pillows and sleeping bags. They are not provided. All that is provided is the shelter and mattresses.

This is just like camping except instead of a tent you are using our shelter. Plan to bring any supplies you would need if you were camping.

Tents can be pitched next to the treehouse for an extra $10 per tent.

Please let us know if you will be arriving after hours so we can make arrangements for you. You can check in late via no contact check in!

Title: Cottage in the Woods B&B "The Owls Nest"
Description: Newly constructed in 2021...the Chasing Fireflies treehouse is perched over 15 feet up among the trees! Complete with modern amenities and oversized windows enjoy the calm peaceful view from this treehouse bordering the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. Let nostalgic memories of your youth come back to life when you stay at the Chasing Fireflies treehouse. This Farmhouse style treehouse has oversized windows that will bring the outdoor beauty in and is full of modern amenities while providing you whimsical and enchanting experience.The Chasing Fireflies treehouse sits adjacent to the Great Smoky Mountains National Park at the base of Cove Mountain in Wears Valley. This open concept 1 bedroom 1 bath treehouse sleeps up to 4 people. The treehouse is full of amenities. In addition to a queen bed and sofa bed it offers a full size bathroom & shower and kitchenette. Chasing Fireflies has oversized windows which provide a feeling of having the National Park in your living room. Regardless of the season relax in the air-conditioned or heated treehouse after your day‚Äôs activities. The kitchen has a 2 burner cook-top refrigerator and combo convection/microwave oven. Enjoy your favorite show on the 55 big screen smart-TV or use the free WI-FI. When you arrive at the Chasing Fireflies treehouse you will experience the life-like flashing and flickering lights of fireflies; along with firefly decor in the treehouse. While your treehouse sits in the trees you access Chasing Fireflies via the set of stairs (30 steps) & catwalks or a service set of 15 stairs. The outsides decks provide ample outdoor seating and viewing areas. Use the decks to sit and relax or dine outside in the fresh mountain air. At night Chasing Fireflies transforms into a nightly light display with over 150 feet of outdoor lights.

Title: Little Goldies
Description:
If youre looking for an immersive jungle experience while retaining creature comforts and staying close to civilisation this gorgeous open-plan tree house is just the place! The space The space
Highlights:
- Open plan bedroom and living area with chairs and table comfortably situated to witness the magnificence of nature
- The space can accomodate 2 to 4 people with 1 double bed and 1 extra double matress
- Proper bathroom with a WC and a shower overlooking the jungle
- Fall asleep and wake up to the sounds of the jungle
- Live among tree tops
- Observe the unique flora and fauna Guest access Guest access
You can easily get here without a 4x4 and park on the property. A quiet gravel road takes you from the main road (costanera) to the tree house (1km drive).

Whats nearby:

Youre really well connected here - there is a choice of restaurants around here (including the famous farm to table gourmet reservation only dining experience) one of the most beautiful beaches in the area (Playa Hermosa 2km away) with great surf cacao tour medicinal plants tour and more.

Uvita is just 8km away - with Ballena Marine National Park is nearby known for its humpback whale migration and the land bridge that appears at low tide to Punta Uvita and its iconic whale-tail rock formation.

Domincal surfer town with a good choice of vegan and non-vegan restaurants bars good surf and cool vibe. - 14km

Title: Water Forest Retreat- Tree House
Description:
Have you ever dreamed of sleeping in the trees? Like a Peter Pan?
As a little child you wanted to have your house high in the branches?
Our hacienda in the trees makes your dream come true.
But when it blows that the hell\s moves. Are you ready for it? The space The space
We offer not just overnight accommodation in a unique building. Nowhere else in the Giant Mountains such a facility to stay open throughout the year you will not find.
There is NO NETWORKING: NO electricity NO gas NO water NO stoves NO fireplaces and even NO Wifi. Thats means NO HEATING !!! Just and only pure nature!
It is strictly forbidden to use open fire (candles stoves etc.)!!!! Only LED lamps please! Guest access Guest access
If you settle in our Hacienda in the branches we will arrange for free using of toilets and showers on Mountain chalet Port√°≈°ky (portasky.cz). You can order breakfast lunch and dinner. You can also subscribe to our specialties delivered almost to your sleeping bag (all for fee). Other things to note Other things to note
You are not the usually forest. The behavior of visitors subject to the rules of KRNAP. Our forest is unique in that it will stay overnight and in the morning you will be amazed at how much wildlife around you through. Of course you can not make a noise!

Title: Treehouse for dreaming
Description:
The Shack is what dreams are made of! Enter over a 40 foot swinging bridge then step into a house in the woods! There is a full bath a kitchenette and a day bed/ lounge area on the main floor. A European style ladder takes you up into the loft where youll find your queen-sized bed sleeping area. Outside you can warm by the fire on a deck large enough for the family. The space The space
The Shack is what dreams are made of! Enter over a 40 foot swinging bridge then step into a house in the woods! There is a full bath a kitchenette and a day bed/ lounge area that doubles as another bed to sleep at night on the main floor. A European style ladder takes you up into the loft where youll find your queen-sized bed sleeping area. Outside you can warm by the fire on a deck large enough for the entire family. Guest access Guest access
You will have the whole treehouse to yourself! Other things to note Other things to note
Since these are treehouses you will need to e-sign a liability waiver. We are located in the woods so all animals and insects that come with nature will be prevalent.
Since we are in a rural area we have limited wifi available. Also there is a long hilly driveway. If the weather is rough you will need to be careful. If you get stuck we will assist you if we are available. A four-wheel drive vehicles is recommended if there is snow.

Title: Treehouse with Jacuzzi bathtub + infrared cabin
Description:
You\ll love my place because it has magic and is special. It is in the middle of a primary tropical wet forest at 3000 meters above sea level at 33 km from Cll 82 with Kr. 7 of Bogota (+/- 55 min. ) or 25 min. from La Calera you will find a very comfortable and well-equipped cabin.
Built at 8 m high in the canopy of the trees with good views birds moss bromeliads and ravines.
On a sidewalk of good and friendly farmers easy to get to. It\s an unforgettable experience. The space The space
You can arrive by car or there are public buses from La Calera that leaves you about 1 km from the Cabin.
It is very cozy and quiet.
It is a very beautiful region very quiet and safe and very close to Bogot√°.
You can go for a walk to the Chingaza National Natural Park where the water is born for Bogot√°. Guest access Guest access
The forest is beautiful and 300 m away there is a very clean and very cold water stream. Other things to note Other things to note
It is recommended to bring boots and good raincoat to walk comfortably and warm clothes to be in the house.
Its always nice to wear warm clothes and a raincoat.
There are several very nice walks and walks in the region and sometimes very humid and cold.
The walk to Chingaza is very close it is beautiful and unique...!! You need to buy the tickets in advance to enter the Chingaza Natural National Park. I can present them with a foundation that also allows you to enter the park more easily and they have very good guides.

Title: Treehouse Village - The Box
Description: Casa Cascada is a unique cabin in the middle of the forest with a stuning waterfall just in front of the balcony. The place is located in a private green comunity with no neighbors. The place is perfect for couples who want to disconnect from the world and connect between them and nature. Get away from the hustle and bustle and enjoy this quiet cabin in the middle of the forest. Follow us on insta! @casa.cascada The space The space\nCasa Cascada is a wood cabin built right over a serene waterfall and is a perfect private romantic getaway. The studio-sized cabin features a king bed as well as a larger hanging covered patio suited for entertaining or lounging. The lounge chair on the terrace is a perfect place to sit and read while listening to the sounds of the waterfall and creek.
