Title: Observatory Tree House
Description:
No children under 5 years of age for safety reasons. The hand-crafted Magical Jungle Tree House is one of 3 casitas and 2 treehouses at the Bio Thermales natural resort organically integrated into our 35 acre rainforest. Guests enjoy free 24 hour access to the 12 natural hot and cool springs pools of various temperatures and rainforest trails. The space The space
The Magical Jungle Tree House is handcrafted with many artistic wood work and furniture a tile bathroom with a flash on-demand water heater for the shower and a nicely laid out and well equipped kitchen. It is set back a bit in the rainforest but still close to the hot and cool springs. The balcony almost completely surrounds the tree house.

Our hot springs are ancient ‚Äúdeep Earth‚Äù sources that bubble up through the rainforest floor laden with mineral-rich waters that have been in the Earth for at least 10000 years. Our waters are rich in bicarbonates calcium and magnesium low in sulfur and slightly acidic -- qualities shared by many of the world\s best hot springs.

Five of our 9 organic form hot springs pools are located in the rainforest and 4 hot springs pools as well as a small and a large cool spring swimming pool are located in a meadow surrounded by rainforest (see below for more information). The small and large cool springs pools both have water slides and there is a small water slide in one of the shallow and moderate temperature pools for small children.

Note on wifi -- we have a fiber optic cable to the main office that is about 98% reliable but had to install repeaters to bring wifi signal to the casitas and tree houses. The repeaters are not as reliable especially in bad weather. However we can help you send or receive email one way or another via the fiber optic cable.

The Treehouse is built to strict Costa Rican building codes.

To see all our listings including the Colibri Casita3 please go to https://www.airbnb.com/users/show/54000 and on the left side of the page three listings will show. At the bottom of them click on ‚ÄúView all listings‚Äù to see all 5 listings.

You can check availability of each accommodation by clicking on the Calendar tab above the main photo on each listing.

Treehouse features: (see floor-plan for all details):
‚Ä¢ Perched high among the rainforest trees the Tree House has large screened areas for circulation of naturally cooler breezes. It also has fans.
‚Ä¢ All onsite hot springs and recreation activities included including 24 hour access to the hot springs and cool spring swimming pools
‚Ä¢ The Treehouse2 is all on one floor with a Queen sized bed with orthopedic mattress and hypoallergenic bedding.
‚Ä¢ There is also a twin-sized bed that can double a a settee with hypoallergenic bedding
‚Ä¢ Hand-crafted rustic furniture from naturally harvested trees on the land
‚Ä¢ Main floor kitchen with refrigerator micro-wave rice-cooker coffee maker basic kitchenware
‚Ä¢ Bathroom with flash on-demand hot-water heater
‚Ä¢ Wrap around balcony for relaxing and animal and bird watching
‚Ä¢ Laundry service at $5 charge per load
‚Ä¢ Short walk to rainforest and hot springs pools
‚Ä¢ No telephone or television
‚Ä¢ WiFi internet for your laptop -- if reliable 24 hour internet is essential to you please message us for suggestions.
‚Ä¢ Hosts Kathy and Bernie live onsite
‚Ä¢ Languages: English Spanish German
One time $10 cleaning fee; thereafter housecleaning services every 3 days are free.
Bio Thermales Hot Springs features:
‚Ä¢ Our hot springs pools are all-natural mineral water just as it flows from the Earth
‚Ä¢ Rainforest Pools from 90¬∞ - 102¬∞F (31¬∞ - 40¬∞C)
‚Ä¢ Grotto Pools in meadow flow from the 104¬∞F/42¬∞C source pool onward into two larger and progressively cooler pools which are handicap-accessible and suitable for small children.
‚Ä¢ Cool Pool in meadow is 90¬∞F/31¬∞C mineral water flowing from the thermal creek
‚Ä¢ 2 Swimming pools with continuous flow of natural cold spring water (88 degrees) - one is 1 to 1.5 meters deep and the larger is 1.6 meters deep.
‚Ä¢ Bathhouse in meadow with handicap accessible bathrooms and showers
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúRanchos‚Äù ‚Äì roofed tables with concrete floors and grills for picnics
Other Activities on our 35 acre rainforest reserve:
‚Ä¢ Bird-watching: many types of toucans oropendulas parrots hummingbirds and the rare green macaw
‚Ä¢ Rainforest: enjoy it from the casita porch or hot springs pools take easy walks on paths or more adventurous hikes
‚Ä¢ Fossils ‚Äì enjoy our collection or hunt (gently) for your own
‚Ä¢ Wildlife: two-toed sloths iguanas capuchin and mantled howler monkeys tree frogs birds butterflies and many others.

We are a 45 minute drive from the many activities in Fortuna and Volcano Arenal -- such as ziplines hanging bridges white water rafting slow river floats or kayaking through wildlife sanctuaries -- or a 1.5 hour drive to La Paz Waterfall Gardens and Volcano Poas.

Bio Thermales Hot Springs is open to the public for day use of the hot springs and most of our day visitors are Costa Ricans so you may also meet new Tico friends. Bio Thermales is generally not crowded however except on major holidays and Sundays.

Food/Meals: The Tree House has a kitchen. There are many restaurants and a good supermarket within a 15 minute drive. Traditional Costa Rican meals can be delivered from a local caterer for very reasonable prices (Costa Rican food is tasty but not spicy). Otherwise for those without cars we can call a taxi or try to synchronize a food shopping trip when we go to town for errands.

Three hours of daylight are needed to safely drive here from the SJO airport before sunset at 5:30 pm. The drive through mountainous cloud forests is splendid in daylight but prone to fog and rain especially at night creating hazardous visibility conditions after dark. Finding our countryside location will also be far easier if you arrive the first time before sunset. If your plane lands in the morning to noon at SJO airport ‚Äì or 11:00 am at Liberia airport -- you can drive here directly from the airport. Otherwise it is safer to book a room near the airport on your first night or ask us to book a private driver and have a rental car delivered at no extra charge.

Last night in Costa Rica:
Driving directly to the airport on the same day is possible if you book a flight in the afternoon. Please be aware that you must be at the airport 2.5 hours before departure. If you have an early morning departing flight it is basically necessary to stay near the airport on the night before. Guest access Guest access
Guests enjoy free access to the hot springs swimming pools and rainforest trails from 9 am to 10 pm.

Laundry: we have a full laundry facility and we will do laundry for $5 per load (wash dry and fold). Other things to note Other things to note
Day visitors and groups are permitted entrance to use the hot springs and cool springs pools from 9 am to 6 pm. There are usually more day visitors on weekends especially Sundays and we recommend booking week days for more tranquility and privacy. If guests book a longer reservation that includes a Sunday we recommend planning a day tour in the many nearby activities on Sundays. Day visitors must leave by 6 pm and only casita and Tree House guests may use the pools after 6 pm and enjoy unlimited access to the pools with the exception of no nighttime use of the forest pools and cleaning schedule as noted above.

We recommend either ordering a catered dinner in advance for your first evening and/or next morning breakfast or buying and bringing groceries to cook because we are 4 km from the main paved road and driving after dark is highly discouraged until drivers have quite some experience on Costa Rican roads. Also most guests prefer to settle in upon arrival and not to have to get back in the car and drive out to dinner. We provide a Catering Menu to each guest once reserved but the caterer requires advance notice of selected meals and TIMES guests would like meals delivered. We do not have a liquor license and guests must bring their own beer/wine/rum etc. The tap water is safe to drink and we sell soft drinks fruit juices and other non-alcohol beverages snacks and ice cream.

Title: KY Breeze PRIVATE Treehouse ‚òÖ  Romantic RRG Forest
Description:
In our woods 50 meters from the parking lot you get your own tree house. Input power for charging mobile computer etc. We made your bed.
You will have access to hot water so that the outdoor shower will be comfortable.
The fire pan is ready outside. Electric heater in the cabin.
Very good breakfast on the door can be ordered.
For other cooking; bring primus or similar. We have plastic storage boxes for food etc. A really nice place romantic. And completely private. The space The space
A great starting point for Romsdalseggen Rampestreken and via ferrata at √Öndalsnes. Ice fjord is a gem!

We always respond quickly to messages and are excited to welcome you. Guest access Guest access
You have the forest to yourself romantically and privately.
Own electric heater in the cabin so it doesnt get cold.

Parking between the garage and the black main house upon arrival.

Hot water can be found in the tap in front of the black main house. Other things to note Other things to note
New this year:
* Sauna! We offer the riverside sauna this one you can easily book yourself via our websites. There is also an outdoor shower with fresh river water included in the bath rental. Good cook daring to swim in the river?

* Breakfast in bed? We offer homemade rolls eggs from local farm coffee butter juice happy salmon and other snacks - high quality lots organic - delivered in a great picnic basket at the gate of the tree house every morning at 8.30. 290 kr per person. To be ordered no later than 5 pm the day before.

Title: Tree House and Sauna with Beautiful Mountain Views
Description:
A unique cozy and modern tree house located in a picturesque pine forest will envelope you in peace and quiet and bring unforgettable memories. You will find yourself surrounded by nature with easy access to secluded endless beaches and crystal-clear sea. The rustling of trees singing of birds and star gazing in the night will be all you need to forget the busy rhythm of city life. You will explore ancient lighthouses and see many other unique and abundant sights of Hiiumaa Island! The space The space
Sorry there is no electricity now. You will find comfort and peace in our cozy house. The lower spacious floor contains a kitchen with all the necessities such as a gas grill a washstand a dinner table as well as a hammock. The upper deck is a relaxation zone with two chaise lounges and a small table. Inside the living room is a fireplace/wood burner which can be used for cooking or boiling water. The room also has a double bed with a pull-out bed extension for two more people a table with chairs and a storage chest. Big windows offer majestic views of the forest. The house is insulated theres a fireplace inside so you will be warm even in the colder months of spring and autumn. Electricity is supplied by solar panels. A lovely fire pit with benches is set up on a meadow near the house. Close by there are an outside shower cabin and a toilet. You will find supermarkets bars cafes a bank a pharmacy and a hospital in picturesque town of K√§rdla 15 km away. The sea is an easy 800 m walk from the house.
In addition to the wonderful forest and the sea the island has a lot of amazing things to see - ancient lighthouses the old Suuremeyza estate an open-air ethno-museum (an old peasant farm) there are also tennis courts a golf course horses excursions to seals and etc. and so on.
The cozy town of K√§rdla (15km) with supermarkets bars cafes rental cars and bicycles.
All sorts of festivals are held on the island (jazz classical music etc.) Cafe Day Jan Day craft fair and many others.
Also yacht parking beaches for surfers and kiters.
We hope you will enjoy staying at our tree house and have a great time on the magic Hiiumaa Island!

Title: The Tree house in Ano Korakiana
Description:
Cozy Rustic Authentic Treehouse for two by a babbling brook. Full Bed w/Linens & Towels. Shared Bathrooms
11 acre Organic Vegetable Farm supplies local restaurants French Broad Food Co-op and Farmers Market. The space The space
Rustic Cozy Treehouse has a full-size bed. Candlelight adds to the memorable experience. There is no electricity in the Treehouse. Shared Bathroom. Fire Ring. Charcoal grill. Two Bathrooms w/Showers (Outdoor Shower is closed in winter) Guest access Guest access
Guests are welcome and encouraged to walk all 11 acres of our organic farm including the woodlot the creek and the vegetable fields. Access to the greenhouses is restricted. Your room completely private. The farm itself is shared with other guests and farm family. Other things to note Other things to note
Common courtesy please.
Do NOT throw cigarette butts garbage cans bottle caps etc in the fire pits!
There is a dumpster at the Farm Entrance.
PETS must be friendly to other dogs and people.
Pets CANNOT be left unattended while you are off the farm - if you leave they go with you.
If you consume alcohol it must be confined to your personal space. All guests and residents must be enjoying themselves. Any excessive noise obnoxious behavior or general disrespect will not be tolerated. You will be put out for drunkenness. No refund. I am sole judge jury and Hangman if has to go that far.
Smoking allowed on the farm. Stay a reasonable distance away from buildings crops and other guests. No smoking - of any substance - in the Barn or the Treehouse - or the Bathrooms. No butts on ground ever.
WARNING
Under North Carolina law there is no liability for an injury to or death of a participant in an agritourism activity conducted at this agritourism location if such injury or death results from the inherent risks of the agritourism activity. Inherent risks of agritourism activities include among others risks of injury inherent to land equipment and animals as well as the potential for you to act in a negligent manner that may contribute to your injury or death. You are assuming the risk of participating in this agritourism activity.

Title: Panorama: Magnificent treehouse,cozy
Description:
Unusual accommodation open all year round : dream cabins just for you perched 10 meters in the trees (easy and secure access). Isolated from everything calm is guaranteed for an unforgettable night in the heart of the forest as a lover family or friends ideal as a gift to those we love. The space The space
Perched between two magnificent trees the large Mauret hut is both comfortable and rustic. Access is from a wooden staircase and then from two walkways fully secured by a net that leads directly to a large terrace. Inside many windows create a bright atmosphere and allow you to fully enjoy the surroundings. And its great asset is its second terrace perched on a part of the roof to fully live this unique adventure.
It is equipped with dry toilets kitchenette with gas and sink gas heating tables and chairs inside and on the terrace solar electricity (lamps).
This cabin doesnt have a shower. We provide towels and gloves for a rustic toilet at the kitchen sink.
The living area has two convertible sofas. Upstairs there is a large room under the roofs. In all the hut is designed to accommodate up to seven people in a hotel formula that is to say clean and prepared beds... you do not have to bring any sheets and breakfast is provided.

Title: Treehouse Canopy Room: Permaculture Farm
Description:
Want a natural and rustic adventure in the heart of the Lotois vineyard valley in a quiet and secluded setting surrounded by animals in a hut perched 4.5 meters high come visit us.
We created an association to promote develop value and exchange alternative methods eco-constructions and educational practices around the world. With your reservation in the cabin you become a member of the association and participate in it. The space The space
Remember to wear your sheets down and towels. (One double bed in 140x190 and 3 single beds)
In an ecological desire the toilets are dry.
Possibility of extra bedrooms (sleeps 9 kitchen bathroom extra ) . Guest access Guest access
Pets are allowed. Ours (dogs cats horses hensgoldfish) will be happy to welcome them.
Various swimming points nearby. Other things to note Other things to note
Our rider friends are welcome to join us. As the hut is located in the heart of the park your horses will be welcomed in an enclosed and secure space.

Title: Eagles Nest Tree House
Description:
Near the sea and the mountain come and relax in a refuge 10 minutes from Biarritz. Perched on stilts at more than 3 m surrounded by trees in a lush garden the hut is fully equipped for you to enjoy a great comfort in the middle of nature. The fully-equipped summer kitchen is under the hut and the toilet is at its foot. You will wake up to bird song optional organic breakfast at ‚Ç¨5 ‚Ç¨9 or ‚Ç¨12/pers. except from April 16 to May 2. The space The space
Come and try the unusual and poetic experience of living in a warm and comfortable hut.
High quality king size bedding of 180.
Linens and towels are of course included in the service.
Washable slippers are available for your stay.
For the toilet you have the choice between the cosy of a bathtub inside and the exotic of an outdoor shower (but under shelter) .
A bottle of wine from our reserve or local apple juice is offered.
Ranked 2 Star furnished tourist accommodation.
From April 16 to May 2 without optional breakfast service.
Please read the house rules in full . Guest access Guest access
You will also enjoy the lush garden from sunny days a ping pong table a slackline in summer a barbecue...A small grocery store is available on request with local and/or organic products.
Possibility to buy bottle of champagne. Other things to note Other things to note
A radiator will warm up chilly nights and a ventilator will cool down hot days.
We do not accept credit cards for the payment of breakfasts or possible cleaning fees ( only cash check ).
Please take a minute to read the rules of procedure .
For breakfast you can choose the French breakfast at ‚Ç¨9 (tea or chocolate coffee toast with honey jam butter hot croissant milk specialty orange juice or local apple) or Canadian breakfast at ‚Ç¨12 (the same as the French with pancakes or eggs to choose from) or the autonomous menu at ‚Ç¨5 (like the French breakfast without the croissant or the milk specialty) arranged the day before in the summer kitchen. All 3 organic except croissants. (EXCEPT for April 16 to May 2 when the rental will be autonomous )

Title: Nomad Jungle Treehouse - surf / yoga (shared bath)
Description:
My place is close to public transport the airport the city center parks art and culture Plitvice lakes capital town Zagreb 4 rivers. You‚Äôll love my place because of the location the ambiance the people the outdoors space and the neighborhood. My place is good for couples solo adventurers families (with kids) and furry friends (pets). The space The space
My place is situated in abandoned village there is no electricity so it is ideal for robinson tourism.
Sorrounded with two pristine rivers untouched nature it is perfect for your relaxing time that you will always remember....
I also have canoes bikes and quad vehicles to make your stay more adventures. Guest access Guest access
Once you arrived in town of Karlovac I will meet you and guide you to my place.

Title: Treehouse Escape on 5 Acres- TreeHausATL
Description:
Unique charming spacious private tree house overlooking working diversified family farm. Enjoy solitude surrounded by only the sounds of nature and our farm animals. Woodstove heats the space for cozy 4 season get-aways. Fire wood and lanterns are provided. This is a popular off-the-grid space. Please look at our Vintage Airstream and Providence Area Camper if you require additional space or electricity.
Ask about our special whole weekend or multiple night pricing! The space The space
This is a spacious though rustic off the grid accommodation in the trees overlooking our farm fields to the south and the forest to the north. Fresh breezes blow through the open windows in the warm weather and the wood stove keeps the space cozy and warm in the cooler seasons. If light air and views are what you are looking for this is the place. Working sustainable farm: vegetables dairy goats livestock guardian dogs cats heritage hogs poultry horses sheep and a water buffalo! Please leave your pets home so as not to stress our animals.
If you need more space please see our other listings; Vintage Airstream and 28 camper. Guest access Guest access
The tree house has no electricity (lanterns are provided) or plumbing. The Tree House is marked with a sign on the driveway. There is no lock on the door. There is a composting toilet close by a spacious outdoor shower on the pond side of our house and a real bathroom available in the house for cold-weather guests. There is a charcoal grill for use by our guests. You must provide the charcoal and ice. Other things to note Other things to note
As a Tree House in the woods on a working farm please anticipate that u might experience some insects and hear various animal sounds. Please bring insect repellent if u think you might want it. Expect that u will hear the sounds of the crickets katydids tree frogs song birds wood peckers owls coyotes rooster peacocks cats dogs or other animals. If u would like to explore the farm fields woods etc you might want to bring boots depending on the weather...
There are several breakfast spots in close proximity. Both Providence and Warren RI are great destination spots and meccas of great restaurants. We are happy to give you recommendations.
Our daughter calls the Tree House home when she is on the farm. You will be staying in her personal space with her personal furnishings and possessions. Please be respectful!
If the TH is not available when you want it please check out our Vintage Airstream and Working Farm Providence Area Campers

Title: The Sugar Maple Treehouse @ Vermont ReTREEt
Description:
Beautiful self-built wooden tree house situated on top of a horizontally-grown pine tree. Only a 5 minute walk from the sea which borders the property. Two skylights allow you to enjoy the trees the blue sky and the birds above. Plenty of privacy and space around the house and a sunbed for lazing about. The land is part of the natural park has stunning views across the ocean & amazing sunsets.
The cabin is decorated with handmade details has a comfortable double bed a fridge & gas stove. The space The space
Directly- on the sea-front this self-sustained Eco-treehouse is a 20 min walk away to nearby Foz beach and it is the last sea-front accommodation between Lisbon and Cabo Espichel. The rocky sea pools are only 5 min. away.
The treehouse is the proud highlight of the Cantinho Alberto Caeiros project celebrating the poetry & philosophy of our famous poet: Fernando Pessoa. The love for nature which he expresses can be found in this lovely space in the middle of a protected nature area. We let nature speak for itself without the need for any fancy adornments keeping its wilderness and raw beauty. The shower outside is sun-warmed using recycled scaffolding material and wood. We try to recycle and up-cycle: we used old wine bottles for lamps and restored an old Oak-tree door. The wooden bed is self-built and the kitchen counter has a grand view of the trees.
The tree house is run on solar energy (12v.)
Finishing touches are hand made details such as the cushions from local wool.

Key points:
-rocky sea pools where you can let the waves crash over you .
-Located on top of a rare horizontally grown & typically Portuguese pine tree.
-Table chairs and hammock amongst the trees.
-Unforgettable sunsets.

-All basic amenities available: 2-pit gas stove for cooking a fridge and your own sunwarmed outdoor shower (cold in winter).
-The (dry) compost toilet is shared.
-The tree house is situated within 15.5 acres (6.3 hectare) of agricultural land which gives you unparalleled privacy and sense of nature.
-All beaches are nearby.
-The Village has a small supermarket a bakery a coffee/lunch place and 2 restaurants. We have good contacts and are happy to advice and book you a table.

Location and transport:
-Merely 40 minutes from Lisbon. With your own car you have greater autonomy to explore the area.
-Otherwise a bus from Sete Rios or an Uber will get you here as well.

Please note there is no ATM in the village. Guest access Guest access
You have access to all the land.
The main entrance is accessed via a good dirt road from the village of Azoia. You can exit the bottom of the land to go down to the rock pools and walk to the beach. Other things to note Other things to note
Please note that under NO circumstances we will allow BBQs / open fires during the hot & dry summer months.

The water on the land is good enough to cook with but we advice not to drink it. Bring enough drinking water. Licence number Licence number
Exempt

Title: The TreEscape
Description:
This treehouse is one of a kind and made out of recycled materials! It is a secluded place to relax and be completely surrounded by nature. There is no water or electricity and it is located about a 1/2 mile from our check-in office/parking. Cars are not allowed at the camping sites and parking is available at the main office. It is hike in we will provide shuttle when you check in and check out to get you and your gear to and from the site! The space The space
The treehouse is a cozy place with one bedroom two beds and deck for relaxing. On main level is one king size mattress and in the loft is a full size mattress. Please be aware that there is no water or electricity. The treehouse is in a remote location. Commercial vehicles are not allowed at the site. You must leave your car at our main office 1/2mi away and then hike in. Guest access Guest access
Guests cannot drive their car to the treehouse. Parking is available in a gravel lot at our main office 1/2mi away. During normal business hours we will transport guests one time at check-in and once at check-out. Any other time you must walk. Other things to note Other things to note
This is just like camping except in the trees! We only provide the space and the beds. Please plan to bring with you anything that you would need on a regular camping trip--i.e. linens/sleeping bags/pillows lights/lanterns cooking tools etc. We do have firewood available to purchase for $5 a bundle or you are more than welcome to bring your own!

Title: Gypsy Treehouse Gazebo - Walk to Beach
Description:
Come spend an unusual night in our treehouse : the LOVNID.
A funny wooden sphere for 2 close to nature : an unusual bed and breakfast ideal for lovers...
Our guesthouse is at 55 Beynac Road in the village of Lembras 10 minutes from the center of Bergerac.
www.bellevue-cottage.com The space The space
Less than 3 hours from Bordeaux Toulouse La Rochelle Clermont Ferrand.
Near Bergerac come and spend an unusual night in our cabin perched the LOVNID¬Æ. Nestled in our park this wooden bubble awaits you for a stay in harmony with nature.
It all starts with a walkway of about ten meters then a terrace perched 3 meters high and you discover a cozy nest amid birds and trees for a getaway for two.
Its transparent dome and portholes will give you a magical night with the starry canopy for bed sky.
A dedicated bathroom is available nearby.
Back on land in the morning well have a hearty breakfast.

Some practical information:
* In the current context additional precautions have been put in place particularly regarding disinfection of frequently touched surfaces.
* The Lov Nid is a cabin designed for up to 2 people (adult or child)
* Inside just a bed : impossible to eat.
* The cabin and the entire property are really non-smoking and non-smoking
* No water electricity heating or air conditioning in the cabin.
* During the summer the temperature inside the cabin can exceed 25¬∞
* In winter it can be cool or even cold indoors
* Use a mosquito repellent if you attract them!Other things to note

Title: Girgola Treehouse Experience Ger√™s
Description:
Come stay for a Weekend getaway in a rustic treehouse on the heart of the Rocky River. We are located south of Cottonville on Plank Rd Norwood. Treehouse has Queen size mattress in loft & queen size futon in living area. Comes with heat ac directv mini frig m/w Weber grill shower toilet and an outdoor fire pit for your convenience. Enjoy outdoor porch sitting listening to the sounds of water flowing over rocks. Theres a shelter for parking or camping. 4 Kayaks and 1 canoe available The space The space
Prices include access to canoe and 4 kayaks. During summer months weather permitting.
You can launch a canoe or one of 4 kayaks just steps away from the treehouse and float the rocky river. 2 landings: one located about 45 minutes away or another thats approx 4 hours away for your convenience.
Fire pit outside for small campfire or cooking. Other things to note Other things to note
I tell everyone that comes to stay please prepare as if you are going camping.
I provide bed linens (no towels) a bed a shower a microwave a coffee maker a sink a toilet a charcoal grill and a fire pit. Those are the only things that are included with the rental.

Title: Cherry Treesort "Miss Molly"
Description:
A charming treehouse with an atypical (open-air) comfortable shower 5 minutes from Cousteau Reserve and its diving clubs enjoy the tropical garden and magnificent views of the pigeon islets from the top of the cheese maker. The space The space
Charming cabin perched in a cheese-maker overlooking the islets pigeon with its atypical shower (under the foliage the stars) offering all the comforts for 2 to 4-6 people Guest access Guest access
Guests can enjoy a large private heated saltwater swimming pool equipped with a waterfall and around the deckchair pool a swing bed and a small relaxation loungeunder a pretty little carbet surrounded by a magnificent tropical garden and relaxing where butterflies hummingbirds iguanas sugar trees and our faithful fishing martin front of the eyes of our cat Ulysses and you can also enjoy the BBQ area and the small lounge located under the cabin a swing for children and you also have a court to play balls and petanque. Other things to note Other things to note
The 2 large king-size beds (2mx2m) are equipped with mosquito nets plus 1 BZ

Title: 02 - Treetop Flyer
Description: This cozy treehouse is for outdoor lovers. It sits feet from the 4288 acre Sebasticook Lake; great for kayak or canoe trips swimming or bass fishing. On the other side were right on the 4 Season Rail Trail; great for hiking biking or ATV riding. Close (1 +- mile) to stores and restaurants. Were also close enough to almost anywhere in the state for day trips. Travel to the ocean Acadia National Park Moosehead Lake Area Baxter State Park and more. Let your Maine adventure begin. The space The space\nEver wanted to stay in a treehouse? This space is not very big but it makes up for size with a breathtaking view of the lake. It is not fancy but its comfortable. You can bring your ATV. We have 2 kayaks or a canoe for you to use. There is plenty of space for parking of your vehicle and trailer. Theres a firepit with wood provided picnic table and BBQ grill. We book only during the summer months. We start booking in June and end about mid September.

Title: Le chalet du Pibeste  www.chalet-pibeste.com
Description:
Lyon country House is a 3 hectare property by the Sa√¥ne just across from Paul Bocuses. We offer bed and breakfasts and a luxurious detached cottage and very soon a cabin perched 6 meters high among trees . The perched hut at the end of the park will have stunning views of the Sa√¥ne with a sublime sunset.
It should come as no surprise that you encounter deer or sheep on the property even 15 minutes from Bellecour ! The space The space
Cabin for 4 people comprising a kitchenette a dry toilet a bar for dining with 4 a lounge area with two bench beds with 180 degree views of the sa√¥ne a mezzanine of 11m2 with queen size bed with plunging views of the sa√¥ne a terrace of 12m2 with weber barbecue. As the cabin is an ecological project in total connection with nature we have provided a water reserve for the kitchen and small evening toilet.
For those wishing shower access we have a dedicated shack in THE SPA area that is automatically privatized for shacks in the evening from 8pm to 9PM. This private access to THE SPA is included in the price of the cabin as well as the breakfast delivered in the morning in a pannier that you climb up to the terrace thanks to a pulley.

Title: The Looking Glass:  A Pair of Mirrored Treehouses
Description:
Lakeside cottage at the end of a private road. This charming 3 bedroom (sleeps 6) plus bunkie (sleeps 5) with southern exposure right on the water is the ideal location for a summer family getaway. A newly painted and refreshed cottage with a large deck perfect for evening supper or drinks.

Outside there is plenty of space to sit and soak up the sun. Along 300 feet of water frontage sits a large boathouse with plenty of furniture to lounge and relax or jump off the docks. The space The space
The kitchen has many amenities including stainless steel appliances dishwasher toaster coffee maker cappuccino maker and an ample supply of dishware. Outside of the kitchen is a screened in gazebo which is a perfect spot for dinner.

*** 7 day minimum Friday to Friday check in and check out required

***We will provide a clean set of sheets and towels kitchen towels and beach towels. A cleaning crew will turn over the cottage prior to your arrival. If you require a change of sheets or additional cleaning throughout the week this too can be arranged for an additional $400 cleaning fee.

***Please note you are responsible to take your garbage and other waste/recycling with you. You will be charged $20 per garbage bag left behind.

*** Paper products: the cottage will provide you enough to get started but vacationers must supply their own.

*** Life vests are supplied. Vacationers must bring their own children‚Äôs life jackets due to safety and liability concerns.

***Security deposit is $2500 per booking.

Title: Cherry Treesort "Sweet Ashley"
Description: This little tree house is primitive with no electricity and no water but has a bath house nearby. This is tent camping in a tree house. Located behind the historic R.M. Brooks Store it is the perfect place to find peace and beauty . Perfect for hikers. Rest in the huge branches of this nearly 100 year old Oak Tree. A Queen bed awaits you for your restful nights sleep. Underneath you can picnic at the table or swing in the swing that hangs below. This is the perfect place to unplug. The space The space\nThere is a queen size bed and two chairs for sitting and relaxing. A small table with two chairs for playing cards or eating. A dresser for storing clothes with a mirror above it. Two night stands on each side of beds. Very spacious and easy to move around in.

Title: Finca La Diva  Bed &  Breakfast
Description:
Treehouse Grove is a Treehouse Resort designed and built by the ‚ÄúTreehouse Master‚Äù Pete Nelson. The Willow Treehouse is the most private Treehouse in the lower grove and can hear the constant roar of the local favorite Norton Creek. This Treehouse features a large swing under the treehouse while upholding the luxury creature comforts you‚Äôve become accustom to such as high-speed Wi-Fi a shower toilet heating and cooling kitchenette and of course your favorite streaming channels. The space The space
The Willow is your perfect Treehouse getaway in Gatlinburg! As you enter the Treehouse you will find the well-equipped kitchenette with a mini fridge microwave coffee pot utensils and murphy table for 4. With a queen bed in the master and a queen bed in the loft this Treehouse comfortably sleeps 4. If you are fortunate enough to stay during the Great Smoky Mountain fall or winter you are in for a treat. Snow occasionally turns the forest into a picturesque winter wonderland. Stand beneath the covered view deck and watch the cascading snowfall accumulate around you while enjoying a steaming cup of hot cocoa. Prepare a meal or another drink in the stocked kitchenette and fully enjoy each moment. Book your stay today! Guest access Guest access
All Guest at Treehouse Grove will have easy-to-use entry keypads into their Treehouse. Guest also have access to all the amenities at Treehouse grove including but not limited to grills firepits picnic tables hammocks swings walking and hiking trails and Norton Creek! The Pavilion at Norton Creek Resort is also available depending on the season. Other things to note Other things to note
As much as we love pets and our furry friends Treehouse Grove abides by a strict no-pet policy. The access into the grove can be steep for some and difficult to navigate depending on weather conditions. Different seasons and attractions include Winterfest Autumn Foliage Freshwater Fishing Outlet Shopping Miniature Golf Restaurants Snowboarding Snow Skiing Water Tubing Sledding White Water Rafting Churches Caves Forests Library Live Theater Museums Rec Center Theme Parks Waterfalls Winery Tours Health Beauty Spa Antiquing Cinemas

Title: Treehouse
Description:
On a 2 hectare estate located on the heights of the municipality of Ferdrupt the hut is perched at 7 m 50. It will seduce you with its charm and comfort. It can accommodate 2 to 4 people. A panoramic terrace of 40 m¬≤ with stunning views of the meadow the forest and the massifs. This is the place to recharge your batteries.
Options:
- Relaxation area (spa/sauna) wellness area with massages Kota grill (for your barbecue in winter or in bad weather). All by reservation only. The space The space
For your convenience the cabin is supplied with cold water (outside the freezing period if not we provide a water bottle in the cabin).
Powered by electricity it features high-performance electric heating.
It is equipped with 4 sleeping accommodations a mezzanine bed for 1 person a bed for 2 and a folding bed (blanket duvet and pillows are available)
A kitchenette with sink small kitchenware dishes electric hob (campsite type) electric kettle fridge coffee table and dining area for 4 people. Separate dry toilet inside the cabin. At the foot of the cabin a barbecue.
At your disposal a communal sanitary area close to the car park is at your disposal with 4 showers 2 toilets and a diving area open 24 hours a day.
You can also approach the farm animals (rabbit poultry. sheep llama horse...)

- Kota Grill by reservation.Guest access

Title: We Call This The Treehouse
Description:
House with 2 bedrooms and an ideal room for families overlooking the Douro River. Good sunlight an equipped kitchen a living room with a TV and a playstation and a covered terrace for meals and leisure. The house is set on a farm with vineyards fruit trees aromatic herbs and vegetable gardens. On the farm there is an infinity pool and a treehouse that enchants children. Nearby there is the Casa de E√ßa de Queiroz the Caminhos de Jacinto the Termas de Ar√™gos and the Douro River. The space The space
Quiet and quiet space great for resting. Guests can enjoy the farm go hiking or get to know this region by bike. In the surroundings have good regional restaurants. Guest access Guest access
Guests will see the entire farm and can even take part in rural activities if its of interest to you. Licence number Licence number

Title: Pioneer Cabins + Luxury Treehouse  with Lakeviews
Description:
Here we are in the middle of nature facing the sea and the forest... If you like nature you will fall in love with Dreams.
The Canadian house was built by two Canadian friends in wood. Features two separate bedrooms a functional kitchenette and a spacious terrace overlooks the ocean. The space The space
Choose destinations that are friendly with the environment.
Valance your flight CO2 footprint with a 100% ecological destination.

The money that you pay to stay at Ensue√±os will be of much help to protect 1/10th of this island‚Äôs forests and coasts.

Ensue√±os uses just alternative sources of energy -sun and wind- and we recicle all that wastes that we produce. We have a lovely permaculture garden. We grow our veggies with no artificial fertilizers nor pesticides. We have plenty fruit trees and we enjoy a peaceful and harmonic existance with all beings around.

Of you are comming to Little Corn Island we invite you to know our simple way of life. We can happily share with you the ‚Äúmagic‚Äù secrets to take care of our planet and enjoy a quite and healthy existence.

Choosing traveling destinations that are fully respectful with nature contributing to its environmental valance is the wisest thing that we could all do when we decide to go and discover the world in a respectful & sustainable way.Guest access
Dreams is a natural space with many common areas: the garden the beach the forest. It is only expected in return the respect nature deserves. Other things to note Other things to note

Title: Bear's Pat'
Description:
Our Purple Palace TinyTreeHouse here at Llama Meadows Peace Farm: We welcome all who wish to find the nurturing peace and solitude of nature at Our Peaceful Organic Retired Llama Farm we no longer have llamas. We truly enjoyed raising Llamas for 24 years our oldest one live to be 25 years and 10 days old here in Beautful Benzie County. .A True Camping Experience
The tree house is nice & cozy just right for 1 or 2 people Children 7 yrs or older are welcome with parents. Limit is two. The space The space
You use the Campground 150 ft away for the Outhouse and Campfire with a Grate Grill for cooking your Food on. There is a 6 ft table to use for preparing your food on. We have a Outdoor Shower with Hot Water. The treehouse is 8 by 10 (small) cute and cosy. We love sleeping in it up in the tree with the birds Guest access Guest access
Campground 150 ft away for the Outhouse and Campfire with a Grate Grill for cooking your Food on. There is a 6 ft table to use for preparing your food on. We have a Outdoor Shower with Hot Water. Other things to note Other things to note
The TinyTreeHouse Overlooks Our Gardens. Guest are welcome to walk our Labyrinth and stroll through our Organic Garden We are around with tips on where to go and things to do locally

Title: La Cabane de Lyns
Description:
Pamoon is a contemporary style treehouse sleeping 2 with stunning views of Pigeon Mountain. Nestled within the tranquil hills and valleys of the Appalachian Mountains of North-West Georgia it is surrounded by natural beauty and panoramic backdrops within its very own 15 acres of private woodland and walking trails. The space The space
For a video tour of the Tree House \Pamoon\ visit our website:
lifeshouldbe.net

PLEASE NOTE: We are unable to accommodate check-in on the following days; Christmas Eve Christmas Day New Years Day Memorial Day July 4th Labor Day Thanksgiving & Sundays.

Pamoon boasts a light and airy open plan living space with modern fully equipped kitchen. The bedroom has its own screened in porch for relaxing and taking in those stunning views. Our beautifully decorated bathroom has a full size shower with luxurious bathrobes for your comfort.

You will find the gas bbq on the rear deck along with seating and sun loungers. Our beautiful calming Japanese Ofuro soaking tub situated on a separate relaxation area amongst the trees is a big hit with all of our guests.

This heated cedar tub has no jets which leads to a beautifully calming experience the perfect way to cleanse the mind and soul in the natural surroundings. A tin roof covering this space adds to the experience when rain or snow decides to fall.

Take time to walk the peaceful wooded trails on your secluded 15 acres that are home to deer turkey and the beautiful Red Cardinals.

Life should be...living alongside nature.

In the evenings as the sun sets spend time by the fire pit perfect for roasting s\mores and relaxing with a loved one sipping cocktails and enjoying quiet conversation.

Whatever you choose to do with your time just relaxing or hiking and exploring rest assured you will make many wonderful memories at Pamoon. Our hidden gem will offer you peace seclusion and privacy for your well-being and the chance to just sit back take a moment and re-charge.

Our property management team are close by if you have any issues or queries during your stay ‚Äì we are very lucky to have them as our neighbours.

For your arrival information the tree house is situated at the end of a long driveway. The first part of the drive is shared with our two other vacation homes but then splinters off with sign posting leading to your very own hideaway in the trees.
Amenities include:

- Covered Japanese Ofuro Soaking Tub heated all year round (the water is replaced and the tub is sanitised ready for each new guest).
Please Note: This is not a traditional hot tub/jacuzzi and has no jets.

- Bedroom sleeps 2 Comfortable mattress and good quality linens. Hairdryer provided.

- Open plan living area/kitchen.

- Wireless internet WiFi. Due to our rural location the internet speed can be slower than in urban areas.

- 43 4K Ultra HD Resolution Smart TV with \HULU\ streaming service.

- Fully-equipped kitchen full-size stove fridge/freezer microwave dishes pots cutlery Glassware dishwasher Coffee maker (Keurig & Drip) and toaster.

- Dining table for two.

- Gas BBQ on Rear Deck (gas & utensils provided).

- Fire Pit and Seating (wood provided)

- Outdoor Hook and Ring game

- Laundry closet with full-size separate washer and dryer.

- All Linens/towels and soaking tub towels provided.

- Large enclosed shower unit with detachable shower head. Unisex bathrobes provided.

- Fully furnished throughout by a professional interior designer.

Note : Pamoons\ interior and exterior has been designed with adults in mind. Our home has no child safety locks on doors/windows and the soaking tub area is not gated. Guest access Guest access
Parking on Site Other things to note Other things to note
Pamoons interior and exterior has been designed with adults in mind. Our home has no child safety locks on external or internal doors and the soaking tub area is not gated.

The Japanese soaking tub is a heated calming experience. It does not have jets like a traditional hot tub. It is emptied and sanitized after each departing guest.

Title: Icaco Treehouse:Rustic tiny treehouse by the river
Description:
You can experience the thrill of sleeping at a height of 5 metres among the leaves of the great linden tree.
The suite is built entirely of wood and furnished with natural materials in line with our eco-friendly philosophy.
A very comfortable king size bed an area with an exposed shower and bathtub and a living area with a sofa bed LED TV a corner infusions and a minibar. The terrace exclusive area for guests of the suite is an extraordinary observatory of the sky and the river landscape. The space The space
Uniqueness and hospitality in an old station returned to life to live a green vacation on two wheels surrounded by extraordinary nature.
You can choose the type that best fits your needs one of the rooms built in the double or family station a mini apartment or the Tree House Suite 5 meters from the ground.
You will find a full service dedicated to cyclists and discover the territory with a sustainable approach by renting electric bicycles or bringing your own.
The outdoor pool in the heart of the village will allow you to relax in the reflecting body of the sky you can choose to relax your muscles after a day spent cycling in the heated whirlpool (up to 35¬∞ in winter) or simply stay in the sun on our solarium.
A SPA area for exclusive use can end your days of relaxation (service included for the Tree Suite). Guest access Guest access
An indoor parking lot will welcome your car being a little close to the A4 Peschiera exit (Valeggio direction) it will be easy to find us along Via del Garda on the right side. Other things to note Other things to note
WANT A SURPRISE Or ARE YOU CELEBRATING A SPECIAL DATE?
We can offer support and suggestions: a bottle of bubbly a cake or a bouquet of flowers your favorite photos or a romantic setup.

DO YOU WANT TO BOOK YOUR BIKE ON THE DAY OF YOUR ARRIVAL?
E-bikes muscles mountain bikes or racing bikes?

Send us a message! (services for a fee).

Title: Tradewinds Treehouse
Description: Woodberry‚Äôs Farm Treehouse! Retreat to total seclusion and privacy at the far side of our 94 acre farm. Tucked away in the trees on a ridge is a fully functional 380 sf treehouse with a small kitchen full bath with double shower heads. Relax on the wrap around deck soak in the distant mountain views. Hang the hammocks from below or fire up the pit for s‚Äômores. Lounge on the sofa in front of the gas fireplace play some board games or watch a movie. Cook together or hike to the on-site lake. The space The space\nGuests will have the privacy and exclusive use of the entire treehouse. Located at the back end of our 94 acre farm which neighbors several thousand undeveloped acres guests are guaranteed a true getaway. When you step through the French mahogany doors you are faced with a 9‚Äôx20‚Äô span of glass wall looking out over the valley to the distant mountains. The 380 square foot floor plan has a 5x8 full bath with double head shower tiled in antique reclaimed roofing slate. The jade basin sink sits atop a real tree root retrofitted to accommodate it. The kitchenette is also tiled in the reclaimed roofing slate and has a mini fridge microwave toaster gas stove with small oven and coffee service. The dining space is graced with a beautiful Italian marble bar table with a reclaimed wood base. The cozy living area has a relaxing gas fireplace and the sofa is super comfortable. Stretch out in the king size bed with memory foam mattress. The wrap around deck features a longe area a high top dining set. Grab the hammocks and hang them under the treehouse or go for a hike and find your perfect spot. Guests are also welcome to take the short hike to our private four acre lake. Perfect spot for a picnic and you can use our canoes and paddles. Bring fishing gear if you like. You can catch and release or have a fish fry.

Title: Skyview garden Tree House - Casa Kalitero
Description:
COVID-19 UPDATE: Wee still open for guests. Place has been cleaned and disinfected with commercial-grade cleaning products.
#############################

A simple yet comfortable small shaker cabin placed in the middle of the Massanutten Mountain with views to die for of the Shenandoah River and National Park. Wake up to the sight of the magnificent Blue Ridge Mountains and the town of Luray VA from 1500 feet. The space The space
We debated long and hard whether to list this place on airbnb. After all this is our hideaway with a view that regretfully only a few will ever get to enjoy. But because we love it so much and in the spirit of the sharing economy we felt compelled to open its doors to others and allow you to experience the wonderful warmth that this small and rustic cabin will bring to your soul your heart and your sight. While here every sense is lifted every smell improved every sound a symphony.

If youe looking for modern comfort and the latest gadgets this is not your place. Instead if you want to warm yourself up you\ll need to place wood in the stove. If you want to check the latest stock prices you\ll need to call your broker because Internet is NOT available. If you want to watch TV in your room please look elsewhere.

However if you prefer to wake up to the most extraordinary sunrise in your life simply sleep on the futon couch and open up your eyes in the early morning. If you find delight while hearing the buzz of a hummingbird just place a few seeds in the balcony. If you want to reconnect with your inner self seat in one of the shaker rocking chairs pull up your legs and open that book you always wanted to complete. If youe lucky you may even see a black bear or two roaming around (no worries they are not dangerous).

The Cabin is located at about 1500 feet overlooking the Shenandoah River the town of Luray and the Blue Ridge Mountains. The view is a feast to the eyesight. But don	 stop there. Visit the Luray Caverns 6 minutes at the bottom of the hills. Hike to your heart\s content on the Massanutten (Stephen) Trail a mile above or in one of the dozens other nearby paths. Bring a road bike and challenge yourself to the top of the mountain. Go horse back riding. Explore the Virginia wine country. Or just...relax.

Welcome to a place where time has finally slowed down! Other things to note Other things to note
Q & A:

Q: Why do you rent this place?
A: We use it one month per year at most. Why keep this jewel to ourselves? Please enjoy it as if it\s your place as well.

Q: Why is there no Internet?
A: I work in the high-tech sector. I am connected 24/7. I wanted a place where time stands still be close to nature and could truly get away from it all. We want to share not only the place but the experience as well.

Q: What if I need something from you?
A: Just send me a text message or give me a ring. You\ll get my number after your booking is confirmed.

Q: The fridge is very small will we starve to death?
A: Hey no drama here. Yes the fridge is small but there is also an ice cooler you may use. Simply bring your own ice and please drain it before leaving. That should keep you alive for a bit longer :-)

Q: Should I bring sheets and towels?
A: No worries. We will provide bedding and towels blankets soap shampoo and toilet paper. If you need anything else please let me know and I will do anything in my power to have it ready before your arrival.

Q. Nice wood stove do I can have to purchase firewood?
A. No need to do so. I usually provide plenty of firewood for my guests. You may find it in the back deck. Please cover the wood with the tarp after youe done to protect it from the rain and allow other guests to warm themselves too :-)

Q: I love this place can I extend my stay?
A: If available sure knock yourself out. Simply get to an internet cafe or use your smart phone and book again. But please contact me beforehand out of courtesy.

Q: Great decoration what style is it?
A: Shaker style. From wikipedia Shaker furniture is a distinctive style of furniture developed by the United Society of Believers in Christ\s Second Appearing commonly known as Shakers a religious sect that had guiding principles of simplicity utility and honesty. Their beliefs were reflected in the well-made furniture of minimalist designs. We are not shakers but we are guided by the same principles.

Q. What\s the sleeping situation?
A. Well youe welcome to sleep any way you\d like :-) But to be more specific there are two bedrooms both with full-size beds. One bedroom has a platform bed with a memory foam mattress and the other one a Murphy bed with a memory foam topper. There are also two full-size futons located next to the stove in the living room. If youe not into futons there is also a comfy inflatable full-size bed found in the closet where the Murphy bed is. Please take your pick.

Q. There are no bathroom faucets!
A. Mmm that wasn	 a question but yes theye there. These faucets and vanity were a DIY project of my own design using copper piping and shut-off valves and reclaimed wood. Just turn the valves one quarter of the way counterclockwise to open the water supply. Pretty cool hugh?

Q. Is the Cabin self-sustainable?
A. Not yet but I\m working on it. With your booking contribution I created a system to capture rain water to the cistern below (the mountain is dry and water is a precious commodity here) and eventually I will install solar panels on the roof. Currently all waste water goes into a septic tank so as soon as I implement the above steps the Cabin will technically be able to be off-grid.

Q. What other environmental measures have you implemented?
A. In addition to capturing water from rain and eventually energy from the sun I have renovated the bathroom and kitchen using reclaimed wood some of it from a nearby old farm. The dish and body soaps and most house-cleaning products are environmentally-friendly to help natural decomposition of waste water in the septic system. The floor is made up of natural cork and wood and the entire place was recently re-insulated to improve energy efficiency. If you\d like to know more about our eco-efforts please contact me.

Q. Why are there so many water jugs in the kitchen?
A. Drinking water in colorful jugs as well as the 5-gal dispenser just outside the kitchen comes from a nearby natural water spring (best tasting water I ever had). I leave plenty of it for you because TAP water is NOT potable. In fact I ask my guests to be mindful of tap water usage because there is no well or city-piped water source. Instead water is collected to a cistern below from rain or trucked in (by me) if need be. It is therefore a precious commodity. Simply shut off faucets when not in use be careful not to leave the toilet running and take shorter showers if possible. That\s it! :-)

Q. How is the house heated?
A. The main source of heat is the wood stove. You\ll be surprise how efficient this rustic appliance is. Depending on the temp it may take a couple of hours to bring the thermometer up to your standard so exercise a little patience. There is a heat-infused fan and a tea pot on top of the stove. The fan will propagate the heat efficiently and the tea pot (with water) will act as a natural humidifier making you more comfortable. In addition there is a wall heater in the kitchen (dial) and another one in the bathroom (switch) that you can control. Finally a baseboard heater in the entrance hallway will keep the bedrooms (and water pipes) warm. In short you\ll be cozy!

Q. OK so I will be warm in winter. What about the height of the summer heat?
A. Oh you\ll will be warm in summer alright :-) But seriously there is an old and fairly inefficient AC wall unit in the dining room. There is also a ceiling fan in the living room and another one in one of the bedrooms. I\ve found that opening the windows creates a nice airflow that cools the place down. But if youe looking for a in-house refrigerator this small cabin may not be for you.

Q. What\s the deal with you being a Superhost?
A. Well then since you ask...I\m a Superhost because wee relaxed about our guests despite us having full-time jobs of our own. However I\ve come to be rather fond of that title and I don	 appreciate when a guest leaves a review saying that the place was too isolated or that the place was not what they expected (there\s only about 40 pictures). If a guest does not read the detailed description where I specify the exact distance to places or the meticulous portrayal of the house or whatever then their reviews should be kinder. I truly enjoy 5-star reviews. If there\s something you do not like while here I beg you to let me know and I promise to do what I can to revert your perspective. Remember communication is king.

Title: Peaceful Harbour Town Treehouse with Marsh Views
Description:
In the south Portugal in the middle of the Alentejo lies a powerful gem. In the midst of a forest that has been untouched for decades lies the tree house. Ancient cork oaks olive trees and birds surround you. You sleep in the the pure nature and experience the power silence and coolness of the forest.
Up on the hill you have a wonderful view. There is an outdoor kitchen with a fireplace and a shower.
There is the possibility to rent a caravan and to put up your own tent or van. The space The space
The area around the tree platform with its seating area is completely private as well as the toilet there.
The ruin with its open outdoor kitchen and fireplace can be shared. So the composting toilet and the outdoor shower.
Natural places in the forest with hammocks and stumps invite you to linger.
The entire area is freely accessible.

If its raining it is possible to put a tarp over the platform. You can also sleep in the ruin.

between 5‚Ç¨ and 750‚Ç¨

On request there is a midnight snack for 5‚Ç¨/ person under a gigantic starry sky

Title: Harbour Town Treehouse - Sea Loft in Sea Pines
Description: The treehouse you always wanted as child but can enjoy as an adult. I started out next to three trees that had to be removed but you still may feel a treehouse sway if the wind blows the right way. We are a working farm raising beef cattle and offer horseback riding lessons arena rides and trail rides along with kayaking down our local river in McMinnville. Our guests have the opportunity to experience farm life and assist us in gathering eggs feeding the cows or helping with the horses. The space The space\nThe treehouse has a studio style main floor with a kitchenette that includes a refrigerator microwave toaster oven small electric skillet and Keurig coffee pot; Full Bathroom and queen size bed there is also a loft with a queen size bed. Guests have the option of a family style country breakfast typically served at 8am or can be provided with country eggs and homemade sourdough bread to cook their own breakfast included with your stay. Your choice will be requested at the time of your reservation. Guest access Guest access\nGuests have full access to our farm which encompasses 70 acres for hiking and trail rides. A gas grill is available for guests to use along with an outdoor wood fire pit or a gas for pit on our cover patio. We are centrally located 1 hour from Nashville and Chattanooga in Viola Valley TN. Area attractions include Cumberland Caverns The Caverns five plus State Parks and recreational areas for hiking kayaking fishing swimming etc within 30 minutes. We offer horseback riding lessons arena rides pasture rides and guided or self guided trail rides for experienced riders. Kayaks are also available for rent during your stay with us.

Title: Perched cabin with spa and sauna
Description:
Three room treehouse with huge windows in a reading room area set at the end of a field looking towards Mt Moosilauke. Walking trail to the river is outside your door.
Like camping but better! Surrounded by forest and fields. w/ your own Firepit and new for 2022 ..outdoor shower (with heated water!).
We are a 10 min drive from many trailheads two access points to the AT and Rumney Rocks (trails and world famous rock climbing). Relax and enjoy your solitude. The space The space
Have a White Mountains farm experience and a tree house stay all at once. Currier Brook farm is a 250+ yr old 22 acre working farm located along the Baker River. The tree house is located along the forest line in the back pasture. It has three small rooms plus a sleeping nook. One of the rooms has large picture windows for walls and makes for a comfortable space to read while enjoying the outdoors inside. The tree house is equipped with a camping propane stove cast iron skillets utensils plates bowls drinking vessels and potable water containers. **We provide an ample supply of potable water at the treehouse. There is an indoor composting toilet and a solar shower bag. Fire ring and charcoal grill are also at the tree house area. Enjoy walking running or mountain biking along the extensive old railroad trail that cuts through the farm and goes from Montreal to Central NH. Like hiking or climbing? We are 10 mins from Rumney Rocks Mt Moosilauke and sections of the AT. Planning to hike the AT and need a ride to the farm? We may be able to provide transport with advance notice. The treehouse is far enough away from the workings of the farm and the farm house that you can expect privacy unless you initiate a visit to the farm area. You will need to walk in all of your belongings unless we are available to use the lawn tractor and trailer to take it back. It is a 5 minute walk from where you will park. NO ELECTRICITY. Bring your headlamps lanterns etc ***NEW*** Propane heater buddy available (safe to use inside). Propane provided. If you decide to use there will be a $10 charge for propane.
Note: You may or may not be able to drive to the treehouse (it depends on time of year and how wet the drive is. There is a cart at the parking area about a 5 minute walk from treehouse. New for 2022! Private outdoor shower house. Solar charging station for your devices. Wood for the firepit provided (additional charge per bundle). Propane provided for indoor cook stove and an indoor propane heater for those cool mornings and evenings.

The Villa offers food service at very convenient prices and of excellent quality you can request prices once you have made your reservation.

Title: Cozy Treehouse near Helen, Ga
Description:
Come away to beautiful East Sussex to experience a unique stay in The Buzzardry. This stunning structure will not disappoint ‚Äì from the luxurious copper bathtub with exquisite views over woodland grounds to the extravagant beamed ceilings that protrude through the building this magnificent treehouse offers unparalleled style and luxury. With full facilities available including two en-suite bathrooms with showers a fully equipped kitchen a barbecue and drinks deck at the front. The space The space
This fantastic 2-bedroom treehouse is generously spaced for you to fully enjoy the lofty environs. Climb up the spiral staircase and across the walkway to find a delightful decked terrace; a perfect place for balmy evenings in the treetops.

The Buzzardry sleeps 4 people in 2 bedrooms (which can either be used as 2 doubles or 1 double and 1 twin) each room has its own ensuite shower room. The master bedroom also has a luxurious copper bath with views over the woodland.

The open plan living area and kitchen has all mod cons; oven induction hob fridge dishwasher microwave kettle and sink. There is a dining area for four and a comfortable seating area which includes a TV and woodburner (wood provided) to make things extra cosy in the winter months. There is also underfloor heating throughout the treehouse. We are plumbed in and on grid with broadband available.

Double glass doors give you access to the open plan circular living area with gorgeous views over the woodlands from each angled window. The lounge includes comfortable seating a TV and a cosy wood-burning stove which despite the propertys mod cons provides heating with the old-fashioned way for this well-insulated space as well as underfloor heating to keep your toes toasty. There is also a dining area for four with views through large windows and glass doors for the feeling of al fresco dining a small kitchen complete with oven hob microwave kettle and sink.

To the right is a super king-sized bedroom which can also be used as a twin room and is so spacious it comes with wardrobe space and a beautiful morning view of leafy light. The jewel in this cedar crown is the master bedroom which fans out into its own spherical space containing a king-sized bed wardrobe space and an opulent copper bath tub. This room is not just metres above the ground its miles above other self-catering accommodation - this is treehouse chic. Both bedrooms are beautifully appointed with their own en-suite bathrooms.

Outside is a spacious deck where you can look over the lakes into the gardens and fields beyond. It has a table and chairs for outdoor dining and a gas BBQ. The lake gardens are available for you to enjoy as is the tennis court in the grounds of Marklye. Other things to note Other things to note
Please note that although this property welcomes children we advise parents that the treehouse is high in the air and advise vigilance when staying here with youngsters.

Title: Chasing Fireflies Treehouse- NEW!! Treehouse sits adjacent to the Great Smoky Mountain National Park
Description:
The Snuggery is a converted outbuilding that has been set up for a cosy stay with a wood burning stove and lots of snuggly wraps to cuddle up in. The open plan interior high vaulted ceilings and natural oak flooring create an interior which is fun light and airy. Walking enthusiasts will enjoy walks from the back door straight on to the North Downs Way and there is a bench by the front door fitted with a heated element perfect for warming up your walking boots.The space The space
A self-contained one bedroom outbuilding perfect for a romantic break away Guest access Guest access
The Snuggery is separate to the main house and entry is with a key that‚Äôs kept in a key-box by the front door. I will send you the code a couple of days before arrival. When you are here guests will have access to the immediate garden surrounding the Snuggery which includes a small patio with a table and 4 chairs Other things to note Other things to note
We provide tea coffee sugar muesli milk salt pepper and oil. There‚Äôs also a nespresso coffee machine and we provide capsules.

The kitchen is well equipped with all the basics you will need to cater for yourselves including washing up liquid dishwasher tablets kitchen roll cling film and silver foil.

For bathing we provide hand soap hand cream and shower wash.

If you run out of any of the above during your stay please just let me know and I can restock for you!

Title: NO SUNDAY CHECKINS BARNOWL INN , HOTTUB- TREEHOUSE
Description:
Shepherds Hut in delightful rural setting yet within minutes of all that Oxford has to offer. The Perch Pub (where Morse regularly visited) is a five minute walk and serves excellent food. There is a Golf Driving Range five minutes in the other direction. Waitrose is a ten minute walk. The space The space
Our self-contained Shepherds Hut offers the unique opportunity to enjoy a base in the countryside but only a 25 minute walk to the centre of Oxford. A kitchenette (a small fridge and a hob but no oven) shower room and wood burner provide all home comforts. Towels provided. Microwave can be provided on request (in advance). Guest access Guest access
We are happy to accommodate dogs but they must live in an outside pen next to the Shepherds Hut. Due to the wooden floor dogs should not go into the hut. Other things to note Other things to note
Dogs welcome but only with prior notice and should be housed in outside kennel.

Title: TreeHouse in South West of France. Peneleau
Description:
A cosy and spacious self catering home nestled in the heart of rural Cambridgeshire . Ideal for Family Getaways Short breaks or Long Term rental. With tranquil surroundings five Bird Reserves within a 3 to 20 mils radius perfect for Dog walkersHikersBirdwatchers ....
30 min drive to Cambridge City Centre30 min to Ely Cathedral20 min drive to Huntington station15 min to Historical St Ives built on the banks of the River Great Ouse1 mile from Somersham and its amenities . The space The space
Milestone House comprises an airy Modern Cottage with beautiful surrounding views . Double bedroom with en/suite bathroom is located on the first floor and is accessed from outside of the house. The second bedroom is located on the ground floor with two single beds and en/suit .
Spacious living area together with fully equipped kitchenTV and WiFi .
We are very happy to host your well behaved pets as we are animal lovers. In the interest of hygiene we would just ask not to leave them alone in the house and keep them off the furniture (beds and sofas). Please feel free to bring your own linen if you wish your pet to sleep on the bed. Dogs are also restricted to the downstairs part of the cottage only.
We place these rules in order that all our guests may enjoy the cottage - non pet owners and pet owners alike. Guest access Guest access
Use of private driveway and car port . Access to our private paddock and front garden . Other things to note Other things to note
We are very happy to host your well behaved pets as we are animal lovers. In the interest of hygiene we would just ask not to leave them alone in the house and keep them off the furniture (beds and sofas). Please feel free to bring your own linen if you wish your pet to sleep on the bed. Dogs are also restricted to the downstairs part of the cottage only.
We place these rules in order that all our guests may enjoy the cottage - non pet owners and pet owners alike.

Title: Tree house eco lodge
Description:
Surrounded by stunning countryside our beautiful cabin is the perfect place to relax and switch off. The location is totally secluded with stunning views over the Meon Valley. Come for a few nights and we promise youll leave feeling rested and reenergised.
During these unprecedented times we wanted to offer a place where people can take a moment away from it all. Where you can get back to basics and enjoy the benefits of being surrounded by nature and nothing else.. The space The space
Everything has been carefully considered and beautifully designed to help our guests slow down switch off and leave feeling revitalised. Think tiny hotel room in the wild as opposed to your normal shepherds hut. Our cabin has electric and made entirely using wood from the surrounding trees (all of which were felled due to dieback).

There are beautiful walks some to cosy pubs. In the cabin youll find some maps and our personal recommendations.

If you have any questions please just ask. Here is some more information of what to expect: The cabin has everything you need. Nothing you dont:
A large king sized bed with luxury linen bedding.
A woodburner inside.
A firepit and picnic bench outside.
A bathroom with flushing toilet and hot shower.
A kitchen with two gas hobs and a fridge/freezer.
A table and dining area.
We offer a generous amount of bespoke cut woodburner logs within our rates. More of these smaller logs are available for purchase during your stay to keep you toasty warm!

We also provide a secured bin of seasoned cut logs to be used on the fire-pit ¬£10 per bin which can be purchased on arrival and can be topped up during your stay.

Title: Hacienda in the branches
Description:
Hoots Treehouse (www.hootstreehouse.co.uk) is a picture-perfect romantic luxurious treehouse with all mod cons in an area of outstanding natural beauty - only 45 minutes south of M25. Clad in aromatic cedar wood beautifully furnished - ideal private woodland retreat for couples. Can also comfortably sleep 2 children (from 6 years) on single mattresses in loft area accessed by a ladder and hatch. A wonderful place to chill-out and lose yourself - you wont want to leave! Sheer bliss! The space The space
Minimum 2 night stay - check-in any day of the week. Guest access Guest access
Hoots has its own dedicated parking area. From here there is a boardwalk with steps that lead directly into the treehouse (about 50m).
There are loads of beautiful walks from your doorstep - access through a stunning deer park is a 5 minute walk from the treehouse.
There is a tennis court that can be used (however please bring your own racquets and balls!)

Title: Treehouse Village - The Shack
Description:
Relaxation at The Oak Barn Danbury is inevitable. Surrounded by oak trees the secluded fenced patio with comfy seating hot tub and BBQ will allow quiet relaxation after a day exploring the Essex countryside on your doorstep. Inside enjoy a beautiful open plan oak beamed kitchen / living area with all the amenities you could need to enjoy your stay 3 luxurious beds and a large bathroom. Being child friendly free parking and fast Wifi are a given. A seasonal pool is just an added luxury! The space The space
Welcome to the beautiful Oak Barn in Danbury. 1000 sq ft of light quiet secluded space for a relaxing get away.

Bedroom 1 has a luxurious king size bed with memory foam mattress quality linen and is double aspect looking out over the tree lined garden and horses (when they arn	 on their holidays!).

Bedroom 2 has an equally luxurious sprung double mattress quality linen and enjoys views of the horses and National Trust Forest behind.

The large bathroom comprises of an overized bath for relaxing after a day exploring picturesque Essex a seperate shower toilet and basin. All amenities such as shampoo soap and toilet paper are provided as would be expected.

The open plan oak beamed Living/Dining/Kitchen area is light and spacious even for 6 people. The double sofa bed can be made up or left folded for your arrival.

The 42 TV in the living area is linked up to a Firestick for App access and live TV.

A seperate nook is available for reading or if you need to check the laptop and Wifi signal is strong so you can keep connected!

The dining table can be set for 6 and the kitchen is equipped with oven hob microwave fridge (with small freezer) dishwasher toaster coffee machine kettle and all equiptment you need for self catering. A selection of tea and coffee is also provided to get you started.

Washing is available at a small fee.

Outside the barn becomes even more delightful as you can choose to see in the evening on your private patio either from your 6 person hot tub or outside seating area whilst someone BBQ\s for dinner.

During the summer months (weather dependent) a private heated outdoor pool is available daily between 9am and 12.30pm unless otherwise agreed.

Parking for 2 cars on the shared drive is available.

The Oak Barn Danbury is family friendly (2 little boys live on site!) so if there are any specific child requirements please just message me before you come and I will try and accomodate.

We hope to see you soon x

Title: The  treehouse of Cerro Verde. ECORREFUGIO
Description:
An open plan annexe on the outskirts of woodlands is found on the owners property it‚Äôs own private entrance parking & hot tub. Fully equipped kitchen inc oven/hob fridge kettle and dishwasher. Living/bedroom has a 65 Smart 4k TV with On-Demand TV with Sky & Netflix available.The bed is a quality king size bed.Wi-Fi is included. All bed linen and towels are provided. Table for either dining or a workspace. Up to 2 dogs*. The space The space
Open plan room with en-suite luxury shower room. Bi Fold doors and 5-person luxury hot. Guest access Guest access
One allocated parking space at the top of the drive directly in front of the lodge. Directions will be provided a short time before arrival. Other things to note Other things to note
