Title: The Third Day Lodge
Description:
Inspired by Soho Farmhouse. A stylish converted barn set in the grounds of a Georgian Lodge within the South Downs National Park. Conveniently located close to the picturesque market towns of Alresford Petersfield Alton and historic Winchester it is an ideal base to both explore Hampshire and kick back and relax in luxury. The space The space
Rustic luxury is the barn‚Äôs style; whitewashed timber walls heated oak floors industrial iron Nkuku lighting and furniture sit comfortably alongside crisp White Company linen feather duvets and generous sized pillows. Relax and restore after an action packed day with Neal‚Äôs Yard toiletries and fluffy towels. Comfort is key. Ideal for couples friends and solo travellers alike with the option of a super king or twin beds.
A Nespresso coffee machine toaster kettle fridge freezer oven hob microwave and egg cooker are all on hand plus a gas BBQ & Chiminea log burner on the private Terrace. Breakfast provisions of granola yogurt fruit sourdough bread and jam are provided along with eggs from our own hens for delicious boiled eggs.
The Barn is equipped with the usual mod cons with TV Chrome Cast WIFI and Sonos Music System.
There are Sweeping views from the bedroom french doors up the field where the majestic Redwood Tree and often Pheasants Hare and Roe deer can be seen. You are free to explore North Lodge‚Äôs paddock to visit North Lodge‚Äôs chickens and there are several footpaths off the property one which leads to the famous ‚ÄúPub with no Name‚Äù in just under an hour. Guest access Guest access
Private terrace with seating & coffee table bbq and wood fired Chiminea additional larger table with parasol to the side of the Barn. Guests are welcome to wander around the paddock to see the chickens & meet the owners friendly Border Terriers. Other things to note Other things to note
Breakfast & Dogs!

Please note: We provide a complimentary breakfast of granola yogurt fruit fresh sourdough bread butter fresh eggs and jam.

Dogs: We love dogs we have two! we accept small to medium well behaved ones. We ask that they please keep their paws on the floors not the bed!

Title: Baumhaushotel Krautsand Haus LOTTI
Description:
COVID-19 Restrictions for England
Guests can book with confidence that we will refund any reservations that needs to be cancelled due to government COVID restrictions.

Upper Farm is a 30 acre farm located in the rural hamlet of Henton in the beautiful South Oxfordshire countryside and is around 1 hour from London and less than 5 miles from Junction 6 of the M40 motorway. The space The space
COVID-19 Restrictions for England
Guests can book with confidence that we will refund any reservations that needs to be cancelled due to government COVID restrictions.

Upper Farm is a 30 acre farm located in the rural hamlet of Henton in the beautiful South Oxfordshire countryside and is around 1 hour from London and less than

Due to the additional cleaning and sanitisation required to keep our guests safe we are unable to offer any form of early check-in or late check-out.

Sparrowhawk Lodge is tucked away at the edge of the farm.

With a sauna in the luxurious bathroom and with its own private year round outdoor hot tub you are surrounded by acres of green paddocks and views over our 1 acre fishing lake. Its the perfect setting for guests who want to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

Sparrowhawk Lodge is ideal for couples looking for a romantic getaway walkers cyclists anglers and business travellers.

Kitchen / Dining
- Dining table & chairs
- Fully fitted kitchen (Oven hob microwave kettle toaster slimline dishwasher)
- All pots pans and cookware provided
- Fridge with integrated freezer compartment
- Tea coffee milk sugar & cafetiere
- French doors leading to veranda and hot tub

Living
- L shaped sofa
- Flame effect electric fire
- LG 43 inch Smart UHD 4K Television with Netflix subscription
- Sky+ HD Satellite receiver with Entertainment Movies and Sports channels
- Catchup TV (BBC iPlayer ITV Hub ALL 4 Demand5)
- French doors leading to veranda and hot tub

Outside
- Large veranda with stunning views over the lake & Chiltern Hills
- Al Fresco outdoor dining
- Year round outdoor hot tub with Bluetooth sound system
- Weber Charcoal BBQ

Bedroom
- King size bed with award winning Simba Sleep Experience (hybrid mattress hybrid pillow duvet)
- Egyptian cotton bedding
- Bedside tables lamps and USB charging
- LG 43 inch Smart UHD 4K TV with Freeview Netflix & Catchup
- Hairdryer
- Iron and ironing board

Ensuite
- Large free standing bath
- Sauna
- Walk in shower

Linens towels bathrobes and toiletries provided

IMPORTANT EXTRA INFORMATION
We have a zero tolerance policy on drugs. Anyone found smoking or taking drugs or any other illegal substance will be reported to the police and evicted from the property immediately. There will be no refund for any unused nights and you will forfeit the full security deposit.

There is no smoking permitted inside the accommodation. Smoking is permitted outside only. Please use the ashtray provided.

No excessive outdoor noise after 11pm.
Absolutely No parties or events.

Maximum of 2 well behaved dogs per property. ¬£15 per dog per stay charge (payable on arrival).

Title: Casa Cascada: a unique cabin with waterfall
Description:
Gorgeous wood cabin self contained space with large decking area on hill top giving delightful views over Bourne Woods. The space The space
Self contained space with necessities including TV fridge kettle microwave and toaster.
Please note for longer stays there are no cooking facilities but there are fantastic local restaurants and takeaways to choose from Guest access Guest access
The cabin is separate to but on my property. On site parking is not available however there is free street parking across from the property. Also please be aware that I have two small and friendly dogs who share the garden.
Members of my household will use the path in front of the cabin to access our driveway however this will not intrude on guests Other things to note Other things to note

Title: Les Cabanes du Puy Mary : Lucioles
Description:
On the South Downs Way nestled in a beautiful spot amongst trees with countryside views across farmland The Nest is a hand-built wooden cabin positioned at the top of Springfields on a family-run working farm Springs PYO. In an area of natural beauty yet a short walk to the PYO areas farm shop and wonderful cafe at The Gooseberry House it has immediate access to footpaths and is ideal for walkers and cyclists.
Private parking space and occasional distant road noise across fields. The space The space
The Nest has been lovingly hand built by our family during lockdown using reclaimed woods pallets disused gym wall-bars and many other items we could find for the interior yet is fully insulated and equipped with modern comforts. We want guests to feel the fun and excitement of staying in something a little different yet privacy away from daily life. There is a small kitchen area with cooking facilities a fridge and microwave. A Feather & Black double bed 2 comfy chairs to sit on and enjoy the view across fields with the doors open. There are several outside seating areas to enjoy the sun all around with outside lighting amidst the trees and a fire-pit for cosy nights outdoors sitting and enjoying the stunning sunsets. Some logs and kindling is provided but all extra is available to purchase at the farm shop.
Good 4G signal only in the cabin (so use your break as a rest from the world!) but there is full wifi available at the farm shop cafe should you require. Guests can also bring portable dongles if require.
We would ask guests to bring some soft indoor shoes or slippers for their own comfort as muddy shoes and boots stay outdoors!
PLEASE NOTE: There is now access to use of a private gym in a nearby farm building on Tuesday and Thursday mornings from 6.30a.m -7.30a.m. This may also mean some distant noise at this time. Guests are welcome to join by prior arrangement when booking their stay. Please enquire.

Title: Cherry Treesort "Nona's Nest"
Description:
White Deer Lodge is situated in the village of Barkway. Surrounded by open fields and beautiful countryside. It is a new build in our garden next to our home. There is a huge driveway with private parking for the lodge. The main accommodation upstairs is open plan with an ensuite bathroom. There is a kitchen downstairs. Breakfast hamper includes cereals eggs bread bacon mushrooms tomatoes jams tea coffee
See the deer outside your window and hear the owls at night.
Sorry no pets. The space The space
A beautiful oak interior with a cosy rustic feel. The setting is very peaceful and quiet surrounded by countryside. There is a seating area outside the front of the lodge and a small area out the back of the lodge overlooking the fields. Extras available to book in advance: Movie hamper ¬£10 bouquet of flowers ¬£30 cheese and cracker selection ¬£20 Prosecco strawberries and truffles ¬£25 homemade birthday cake ¬£25. Please message for more info or to book. Check in 3pm. Check out 10.30am Guest access Guest access
Key code entry. Private parking right outside the lodge.

Title: Magical Jungle Tree House with Hot Springs
Description:
An absolutely stunning little escape with boutique decor and a stylish super comfy interior. Set in a a beautiful corner of the village just a stones throw from the village pub this is a truly relaxing escape. The gorgeous decor super comfy bed along with little touches such as the Neom essential oils pod St Kitts Herbery products make this an extra special place to stay.Relax in the evenings with a glass of wine in the wood fired hot tub and snuggle around the Indian Fire Bowl. The space The space
The shepherds hut is in the centre of a pretty village just moments from the village pub. Set on a large grassy area (that was formally a pony paddock) the hut is tucked away but with lovely views of the church.

Little Dragonfly comes with:

Wood Fired Hot Tub
Indian Fire Bowl
Kettle Toaster and Induction Hob
Luxury products
Neom essential oil diffuser

Title: Private wooden cabin with power and double bed
Description:
A beautiful brand new Shepherds Hut nestled in its own little paddock in rural Hampshire within the South Downs National Park. The huts bespoke design ensures a luxurious stay with a comfy double bed free WiFi underfloor heating wood-burning stove sofa kitchenette and ensuite. Outside there‚Äôs a fire pit/BBQ picnic table and wood-fired hot tub offering glorious views across fields. Its the perfect place to relax and unwind and soak-in the hot tub surrounded by nature. The space The space
The Good Shepherd Hut has been built by master craftsmen to a high specification with every requirement catered for. Each little detail has been chosen to create a homely atmosphere. Here you will find a fridge/mini freezer butlers sink dual hob microwave kettle toaster bluetooth radio crockery and cutlery. Theres a sofa and fold down table and chairs from which to dine watch nature or stream movies! For added luxury towelling robes and slippers are provided with an ensuite rainforest shower offering instant hot water and a flushing loo. Outside youll find your own small private paddock complete with picnic table fire pit/BBQ bench seat and wood-fired hot tub. The paddock offers privacy and plenty of space to take in the glorious views over fields. Sunbathe and watch stunning sunsets or stargaze from the Scandinavian style wood-fired hot tub. Often you will see deer playing in the fields with barn owls rabbits pheasants grouse and birds of prey.
We provide a welcome bundle of logs and kindling wood and a complimentary tea tray and continental breakfast. There are hundreds of walks and bike rides connecting us to the South Downs National Park and Ashford Hangers and a variety of pubs serving great food and quintessential English villages to discover locally. If you like watersports the coast is easily accessed within 30 minutes or simply relax and unwind soaking in the hot-tub gazing at the stars and enjoying the peace and comfort you will find here.Guest access
We offer private parking on the driveway of our thatched cottage with a 70 metre walk to access the little paddock where the hut enjoys its own secluded and private space. We are on hand to answer questions but will leave you to enjoy the peace and quiet of the surrounds. This is an ideal location for walkers cyclists and nature lovers and those just simply wishing to get away from the hassles of everyday life!

Title: Tahkuna tree-house
Description:
Our unique Ecopod was handcrafted in Wales it is beautifully insulated with sheep wool and has a lovely smell of wood. The large double glazing doors allow you to make the most of sunlight you are in the sunniest spot of the garden! The village has everything you need four independent coffee shops one bakery and two supermarkets. Further down you have the beautiful Hurstpierpoint Ditchiling and Lewes if you fancy more action Brighton is 10 minutes away. FULLY HEATED for colder days. The space The space
IF YOU CAN\T FIND THE DATES YOU WANT PLEASE MESSAGE ME AS I MAY HAVE A LAST MINUTE CANCELLATION OR THE DATES ARE BLOCKED AND NOT YET AVAILABLE.
We are close to the Downs National Park as well as having Brighton 20 minutes away. So if you want to walk and visit the village then it\s easy. But it\s equally easy to pop into Brighton for sea air or shopping.

We are located close to the A23. The nearest station is Hassocks which is 10 minutes walk from us. This is the Brighton line to London Bridge/ Victoria. Gatwick airport is 30 minutes by car.

There\s also cycle hire at the station in Hassocks which is a 10 minute walk from our house.

Hurstpierpoint is a nearby village with lots of shops and some great pubs 5 minutes by car or 40 minutes walking.

You also have Lewes Plumpton Ditchling to visit.

Cyclists and hikers are also welcome. There are two cycling cafes nearby Proper Cycling here in Hassocks and Velusso in Ditchling.

Pubs include The Bull The Thatched Inn Jack and Jill Inn The Hassocks and more. We have a curry and chinese restaurant on the High Street as well as Fish and chips and Kebab Take away.

Finally a local lady called Carly delivers amazing afternoon teas she organizes everything and even takes the dirty plates away so you don	 have to worry about the washing up check Carly\s Afternoon Teas on Facebook.

THE POD

SELF CHECK IN AVAILABLE AND OWN ACCESS INDEPENDENT FROM MAIN HOUSE.

The PODis tucked away on a corner of our family garden. It is NOT secluded and I think is not ideal for romantic weekends. If not sure please message me BEFORE booking.

You will have your own independent access to the Pod.

Own indoor kitchen area: microwave small fridge kettle tea/ coffee facilities and crockery. There is no cooker so you cannot make your meals from scratch. You can buy lovely meals from COOK at our local Budgens or eat out at one of the local pubs restaurants (BOOKING HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)

You have WI FI and TV (with Amazon Fire stick) internet can be slow at times but it is normally good.

You can also have a hammock on the veranda of the Pod we have one should you wish to relax in the Sun.

There will also be a selection of coffee tea hot chocolate and biscuits for you. Guest access Guest access
you will have your own access to the POD. using the side gate of the main house Other things to note Other things to note
We speak Portuguese French Spanish and some Italian too

Free off street parking. We also have space for 1 small car on our drive

Ironing board available on request

Some toiletries provided

Clean towels provided

Extra blankets provided too

Title: A TREEHOUSE! Adventure! Support Organic Farming!
Description:
Located within the gardens of a quaint cottage this private annex is modern cosy and relaxed. The perfect place to explore the beautiful surrounding countryside or use as a base for the areas multitude of sporting and cultural events. The space The space
The annex is split in to 4 rooms:

A cosy living room complete with wood burning fire and 70 TVDVD player and free view channels . The large L-shaped sofa is perfect to come back to after a long days out in the local countryside.

Generously sized bedroom with queen bed and stylish wood furnishing.

A modern bathroom with shower/bath and WC.

A small pantry with refrigeration a microwave toaster and tea / coffee . Please note this is not a proper kitchen and therefore doesnt have proper cooking facilities . However the area is full of fantastic pubs restaurants and delis wed be happy to recommend. And the local shop in Kirdford does a great cooked breakfast !!

Outside is connected by a series of double doors and theres a small terrace with table and chairs perfect for a sunny morning coffee. Here youll also find the hot tub overlooking paddocks.

Title: Nights of Cimes - La Grande Cabane du Mauret
Description:
River Rose Retreat is a luxurious and cosy shepherds hut located along side the stunning river Hamble in the quaint village of Botley.

The Shepherds Hut which is within walking distance from Botley village and train station has its own garden with hot tub seating area and fire pit surrounded by trees whilst gazing out on to the river.

Although we adore dogs ourselves unfortunately no dogs are allowed.

Due to the current climate please re-book if you or anyone in your house is unwell The space The space
The Shepherds hut is situated at the bottom of a field behind a working equestrian centre and farm so you will have the delight of having horses as your neighbours! This luxury glamping shepherds hut consists of a double bed bathroom and a kitchen area with seating and a log burner.
Please note we are completely off grid so the property is solar powered therefore NO TV iron or hair dryer! The hut has basic facilities including a kettle hob and camping cool box as a fridge.
Our gorgeous seating area outside has a firepit and log burning hot tub.

The hot tub
The hot tub generally takes around 2-3 hours to heat up from cold. Logs and kindling are kept underneath the hut and you pay for what you use (¬£5/ bag of logs; ¬£5/ bag of kindling).Guest accessOther things to note
Everything you need in a cosy and compact traditional shepherds hut with a modern twist. Do as much or as little as you like depending on your mood. A place to digitally disconnect (no wifi!) and appreciate the beautiful nature sounds of birds and view of the river around you.

Title: Treehouse
Description: Wake up and enjoy uninterrupted views to the beautiful rolling hills of the South Downs. Our lovingly converted barn creates a warm and comfortable home perfect for a quiet escape or a base to explore. Upstairs is a stunning double bedroom with king bed bathroom and separate area for study or additional sleeping on a sofa bed. Downstairs is a well equipped open plan kitchen and living room with a private garden perfect for alfresco dining or a sundowner drink. Come and enjoy our working farm. The space The space\nWe are so luckily to be able to welcome guests to our barn in the beautiful Milland Valley. We have decked out the barn with everything you need for a relaxing stay so just pack your clothes and come and unwind. Not only does the house have amazing views across the countryside but there is also a skylight above the king bed so that you can lie in bed and stare at the stars above.

Title: Treehouse 10 minutes from Biarritz
Description:
Charming isolated space overlooking garden and open farmland within South Down National Park. Double bed with space for travelling cot if have young family. En-suite toilet and shower with luxury products. Own lockable door with parking. Ideal for Goodwood weddings at the Tythe Barn and Southdowns Manor visits to Petersfield and Chichester as well as walking the South Downs Way. We dont accept dogs but guests may come into contact with Nora our friendly dog so must be OK with dogs. The space The space
The garden is isolated and because the garden and house is on open farmland there is a feeling of space and calm. Country roads abound for walks and escape from city life. Guest access Guest access
The garden area is shared with the owners but guests have exclusive use of the table and chairs directly outside their cabin. Please contact hosts for use of the pizza oven or BBQ facilities. Other things to note Other things to note
Please note that we have a Tibetan Terrier Nora so guests must like dogs as she is free to roam in the garden.
There are no cooking facilities in the cabin bar a toaster and kettle.

Title: Treehouse Resnice
Description:
The Look Out @ Stable Yard is set in an elevated position amongst the trees overlooking the valley. Its a self contained one bedroom boutique house set within our pretty English country garden. The fridge will be stocked with continental breakfast goodies on the first day of arrival. The property has its own access and outdoor space. Ideal for those looking for a place to stay within walking distance to the award winning village. The property does have low ceilings throughout. The space The space
We apologise but due to the elevated position of The Look Out @ Stable Yard the property is not suitable for disabled access or clients with walking difficulties.
Unfortunately the property is not suitable for children . Guest access Guest access
The Look Out @ Stable Yard is a self contained property.
Outside:
* One parking space
* Balcony with small seating area over looking the valley.
* Wood burning stove
* Wood store
* To access the property you need to walk up a ramp and make your way down 6 steps to the front door.
Inside:
*Kitchen with 2 burner induction hob microwave oven fridge / freezer sink toaster and kettle (tea and coffee supplied)
* Bathroom with walk in shower.
* Living room with wood burning stove seating area smart TV games.
* Wifi throughout the property
* Flight of stairs to carpeted bedroom with double bed luxury mattress seating area & wardrobe.
* Balcony use far reaching views.
* Small garden area with patio and BBQ
* Washing line

Title: Providence area TreeHouse Farm Stay
Description:
Our cabin is set in the garden of our home which is in an area of outstanding natural beauty. There is a decking area around the cabin with a fire pit plus table and chairs for dining alfresco or just enjoy the fresh air. We are surrounded by fields located about 1 mile from the village and pubs. You can head out for a county walk right from the door step. Several National trust properties in the area. Whether your stay is long or short there is plenty do to or just take time to relax. The space The space
Our cabin is set in the garden of our home which is in an area of outstanding natural beauty. There is a kitchenette in the main studio room and a shower room with toilet. The kitchenette has a breakfast bar and stools. Appliances include a toaster kettle two ring ceramic hob microwave slow cooker and a fridge.

The lounge/bedroom area has a double bed and bedside tables two seater sofa and television with sky TV including Sky cinema and Sky Sports.

We have a travel cot and highchair available for families with babies/toddlers.

On the decking area to the front of the cabin you will find a table and chairs for dining alfresco or just enjoy the fresh air. We have a fire pit area at the back of the cabin which can be used to cook on. We charge ¬£12.50 per night for coal and wood. (or coal only for ¬£5). We can only allow the use of the fire pit with the coal and logs we provide due to health and safety risk assessment.

The cabin is very well insulated to keep the warmth in and has two electric oil filled radiators. One of these radiators on a fairly low setting is more than enough to keep the cabin nice and cosy. We also have a wood burner look alike electric heater which has a mist flame effect that can be used without using the heater.

We are surrounded by fields located about 1 mile from the village and pubs. You can head out for a county walk right from the door step.

Check in is from 16:00 onwards as this is when it will definitely be cleaned and reset for check ins on Tuesdays and Fridays. The clean is often completed before this on other days and if the cabin can be made available to you earlier we will let you know.

Please note: Our drive way is directly off the main road through the village and you will hear the sound of cars driving past especially during rush hour.

Title: Caeiro's Tree by the Beach
Description:
A luxury detached & secluded cabin set in a private & secure garden overlooking playing fields & farmland. 6 min walk to the local pub with some great walks nearby. 5 min walk across the village green opposite the main house to NIRVANA SPA 10 min walk to Winnersh Train station & Sainsburys. Close to Bearwood golf club cricket & tennis clubs. Close to J10 M4 Reading Twyford Sonning & Henley-On-Thames
Free parking for 1 car fast WIFI & laptop workspace + cooking facilities. The space The space
As filmed by the BBC for Escape to The Country

We are family-friendly and welcome everyone from all walks of life:-)

Due to COVID we have instigated a thorough cleansing protocol in both our cabin & studio.

Oakside cabin is detached from the main house & has been designed to use the maximum amount of space.

The decor is in an industrial type scheme with steel pipes used for shelves mirrors and towel rails along with handrails support rails and lighting.

The heating system is controlled by the latest technology in underfloor water heating systems.

Inside the interior is finished in English oak (Windsor Great Park) which is used around the doors and window and there is a large solid oak beam that dominates the room. There is a sliding oak door that separates the bathroom from the main space and there is a small hanging space (with hangers) in the airing cupboard should you require it.

We have flooded the space with LED lighting to allow you to control the mood. The main space overlooks a playing field & farmland via floor-to-ceiling double glazed patio doors and in the morning as the sun is coming up its possible to see deer roaming in the fields. Outside of the french doors you have your private patio with a table and two chairs.

Inside there is a kitchenette with everything you need to cook your meals ( a 2-ring electric hob is provided) and a Nespresso coffee machine to have your first cup of coffee to start the day (pods provided). Should you prefer tea there is instant hot water delivered via a Perrin & Rowe filtered water tap for hot drinks via the sink unit.

- KitchenAid Nespresso Coffee Machine
- Fridge with Ice Compartment
- Combination Microwave Oven
- 2 Ring Electric Hob
- Plates Cups Glasses & Cutlery
- Large Philips flat-screen Smart TV and POLK sound system
- Alexa Show
- USB charging ports on the mezzanine level and in the kitchenette
- Shampoo shower gel & handwash
- Hand-Sanitiser
- 1 per person complimentary face masks (More available at ¬£2.50 each)
- Hairdryer & straighteners
- Table & chairs
- Sofa (small sofabed)
- Active Era Luxury Single Size Air Mattress - Elevated Inflatable Air
Bed with an Electric Built-in Pump Raised Pillow & Structured I-Beam Technology
- Towels
- Luxury memory foam mattress & bed linen
- USB sockets
- WiFi

We also provide tea coffee shower gel shampoo & conditioner.

To access the mezzanine level a solid beech ladder with handrails has been provided. There are solid steel pipe rails that have been installed across the top of the mezzanine to provide safety and comfort. Once you have gained access you will find a very comfortable Japanese-style double bed with a memory foam mattress and a Velux window (with a black-out blind) to look up and watch the stars. As this is a tiny house there is no standing room available on the mezzanine but you can sit very comfortably either against the wall or under the eaves and look through the round window across the fields.

PLEASE NOTE - THIS SPACE IS NOT FOR EVERYONE. The cabin is ideal for two but can sleep three as there is a small sofa bed (sleeps one) on the ground floor and/or an Active Era Luxury Single Size Air Mattress - Elevated Inflatable Air Bed with an Electric Built-in Pump Raised Pillow & Structured I-Beam Technology.

We have provided a Philips Ambilight SMART TV with internet access and an Alexa along with free wifi. There is a small fridge with an ice compartment a two-ring hob and a combination microwave oven along with a coffee machine and an instant hot water tap for drinking.

In front of the patio doors there is a small private patio and we have provided two chairs and a table for your use where you can simply enjoy the view. Or you can simply lie back on the sofa and enjoy the view from there!

Storage is supplied by a cupboard and drawers and a small hanging rail in the airing cupboard situated in the bathroom.

FREE parking for one car only.

Check out our other listing via my profile :-) Guest access Guest access
Guests will access the side gate of the main property and enter through the garden to the cabin on the right. There is a small patio with two chairs and a table for guest use.

Please note: CCTV is in operation on the entrances to the house and the driveway/garden. Other things to note Other things to note
You can expect to see your hosts and dogs in and around the garden.

Description:
Cosy comfortable woodland cabin beautifully refurbished set in the Chiltern hills in secure surroundings.great area country pursuits. Service include self catering kitchen dining area double bedroom. Separate WC and separate shower.ideal getaway from it all for 2.

Secure Parking short distance from well known restaurant ‚Äòthe sir Charles Napier‚Äô.
Within an area of outstanding beauty.

Min 2 nights Other things to note Other things to note
Departure time 11am unless by prior arrangement.
This is a non smoking environment

Title: ‚òÖTake to the skies in a Lov Nid‚òÖ
Description:
A unique and beautifully designed barn with a large open plan living area and a mezzanine sleeping deck. A recently built and timber clad giving it a rustic and original feel. The barn comes with its own private landscaped terrace providing excellent views over the fields beyond. Situated in the idyllic Cotswold village of Little Tew a stones throw from Soho Farmhouse. The space The space
There is a mezzanine sleeping deck with lovely round window looking over the orchard and fields beyond. This is accessible by ladder only so please do not book this if this is at all challenging for you.

The barn was designed to mimic a traditional barn with double crittal windows on opposite sides allowing wonderful views and lots of natural light. The space downstairs has a long central table with a well-equipped kitchen area (comprising all the usual appliances) and a wetroom with a colourful encaustic tiled floor.

The other end has a large comfy L-shaped sofa to relax on. There is a sound system which you can plug in any device and Sky Netflix Spotify etc are all accessible through the TV. Guest access Guest access
Behind the barn is a private area with beautifully planted beds around a seating area with pergola above and lovely views beyond over the orchard and fields. The parking space is immediately in front of the barn which is shared for the house and cottage beyond.

Title: Rocky River Cotton Treehouse
Description:
300+ 5* Airbnb reviews 300+ 5* for hospitality and ‚Äòthe best breakfast ever!‚Äô I am so pleased that Briar Lodge has successfully hosted so many people from so many parts of the world. In gated grounds offering secure parking and rural tranquility with easy access to Dorking Horsham Gatwick and the M25 with excellent rail links into London.

A perfect base to explore Surreys stunning National Trust sites with golfing fishing cyclingrambling and country pubs all within easy reach. The space The space
Purpose built Briar Lodge offers complete privacy and secure parking. Outside there is a patio area with charcoal bbq and views across the fields and woodland with access to the garden and terrace to the main house in the summer.

Inside we have provided everything we would like to find on a short stay ourselves. There is an en-suite shower room with plenty of towels and toiletries towelling dressing gowns a flat screen tv with free view and wifi complimentary chilled bottled water and soft drinks fresh fruit as well as a hair dryer iron and ironing board.

A fridge toaster kettle and Nespresso coffee machine with a selection of coffees are provided along with a variety of ‚ÄòTea Pig‚Äô and Pukka teas.

If you wish to have breakfast a substantial freshly prepared breakfast of your choice using the finest local produce is served to your room between 7am to 11am to enjoy at the breakfast bar or (weather permitting) on the patio or terrace. There is an additional charge of ¬£9.00 per person for this payable during your stay. Vegan vegetarian and gluten free options are catered for and guests are requested to advise in advance of any special dietary requirements. A travel cot is available on request. The cabin is a comfortable size for two and will accommodate a travel cot. If travelling with a tot access to the garden will help tire them out!

Also Room One at Briarwood is available. A spacious under-floor heated ground floor ensuite with super-king size bed double walk-in power shower plenty of towels towelling dressing gowns and complimentary toiletries. There is a fridge with complimentary chilled soft drinks a selection of ‚Äò Tea Pig‚Äò and Pukka teas along with a Nespresso coffee machine and a selection of coffees. Fully loaded smart tv with Netflix and Sky movies and wifi available. Private sitting room. Underfloor heating throughout....and fab White Company bedding. Click to see full details
https://www.airbnb.co.uk/manage-your-space/14898067/details Other things to note Other things to note
To get the most out of your visit a car is a must! Box Hill Leith Hill Denbies Wine Estate and the amazing National Trust properties within the area are all well worth a trip.
Although only a ten minute drive away from Dorking we are not on a bus route and as a rural area have no street lamps or pavements. You can however access many of the lovely bridle paths and footpaths around - one will take you to Holmwood train station with trains into London and Horsham and another will lead you into the village of Newdigate with a small local shop and post office and a great pub to enjoy lunch or dinner.

Title: Charming hut perched "Hiss√©o"
Description:
A beautifully converted Cow Shed in a rustic style with luxurious Super King bed in a studio suite with added double bunk room for up to four extra guests.

Studio has a galley kitchen with hob and oven for basic cooking.

Well fitted bathroom facilities including powerful shower and roll top bath and underfloor heating.

Relaxing Sofa in main space with Flatscreen TV and wifi throughout.

Underfloor heating throughout. Large french windows overlooking an orchard. The space The space
Set in the grounds of a Georgian manor house there are beautiful gardens and woodland to explore. Horses sheep and Chickens give a farm like feel. Guest access Guest access
There is a tennis court that guests that guests can use and possible access to pool when open in the summer months. Other things to note Other things to note
Pretty village with Cricket in the summer and Local Pub within walking distance.

Suitable for those with dogs.

Title: Hut in the wood made by hand Mont Blanc view
Description:
Relax and unwind at our woodland lodge. In a peaceful and secluded position spacious cottage is set within the ancient woodland of Burrswood with direct access to beautiful woodland walks. If the weather is ever against you during your stay we have a table tennis table plus a selection of DVDs and games to keep you occupied and a large wood-burning stove to keep you cosy. The space The space
The lodge has been recently refurbished and is an open plan layout. The bathroom has a large corner shower and there is a fitted kitchen lounge area with surround sound and a large mezzanine bedroom area with elevated views over the forest canopy.

Facilities include:

The Kitchen
Within our kitchen facilities we must point out that the oven is a combination microwave oven and grill (NO LARGE OVEN). There is also a two-ring electric hob installed and a toaster kettle espresso machine fridge/freezer French press coffee maker plus plenty of glasses cutlery crockery etc.

Living area: Wood-burning stove table & chairs for 6 people (plus 2 extra fold-up chairs) high chair available upon request

Bathroom: Mira electric shower large basin WC.

Lounge: Seating comfortably for at least 6 people DVD player DVD collection CD Player Wi-Fi Aux with iPhone 6 connection sofa bed table tennis table.

Bedroom: Super King sized bed two single beds (optional) double futon travel cot.

Outside: The Garden
The Lodge benefits from its own garden area which is for guests‚Äô private use. Our main garden is separate from this however this is a family home with children often in the main garden which we ask you to be mindful of.
There is a fire pit setup at the lower level of the Lodge garden. Please feel free to use this - there is fire lighting material by the wood burner and you can either forage for firewood in the woods or there is a lot of dry wood in the wood store at the side of the building.


Optional extras: BBQ & Pizza Oven
If you have pre-booked the pizza oven this will be set up prior to your arrival. We supply enough pizza doughs for two per person and keep them in the fridge of the lodge for you to use whenever you want. We also supply basic ingredients for pizzas (passata and mozzarella cheese) wood and also instructions on how to light and cook the pizzas. Please give us 24 hours‚Äô notice if you would like pizzas.
The charcoal BBQ is free for you to use you just need to supply your own charcoal. Guest access Guest access
The track to the left-hand side of the drive as you come in will take you down to Woodland Lodge.
There is enough space for a car to 3-point-turn down by the Lodge however if you have more than one vehicle feel free to park them all down there.
When facing the front door of the Lodge there is a key lockbox to the right-hand side on the gable end (around the corner just above the wood store) about 4ft up. You will have received the code prior to your arrival. Other things to note Other things to note
The lodge is in a secluded location tucked away from the main house. It is an incredibly peaceful location with no neighbours other than the local wildlife yet within easy reach of Royal Tunbridge Wells.

You are within the grounds of a family home because of this we request any music or noise to be taken inside the lodge from 10 pm.

Please note - *This is not a party venue where additional people can arrive unannounced.*

Rubbish & Recycling
There are three recycling boxes beside the right-hand side of the Lodge - one is for paper & card one is for (rinsed) plastic glass & metal plus one extra. There is also a small food waste caddy under the kitchen sink. We ask our guests to recycle when they can.
Please put the non-recyclable bin bags in the green dustbin at the top of the drive (please do not leave then outside the Lodge because animals will go through them and scatter rubbish everywhere!).

Table Tennis
The table is free for you to use and enjoy and the balls and bats are kept in the cupboard underneath the kitchen sink.

Our family
We have a large family that love the outdoors and we also have a large garden that needs constant maintenance - especially on weekends children will be playing and mowers mowing. If the odd child wanders down and says hello I apologise in advance but we will try to prevent this! We will try our best to prevent any disturbance at antisocial hours to our guests & ask that you avoid outdoor noise after 10pm please.

Title: Newport, Maine Lakeside Treehouse Near ATV Trail
Description:
This listing is categorically not suitable for groups of singles. Our new cottage has recently been completed. It has stunning views across Kent situated down a quiet farm lane with no other houses in sight. We are 10 mins from the centre of Tunbridge Wells Tonbridge and Paddock Wood.
It is incredibly cosy with underfloor heating throughout it is also totally eco friendly. There is an electric car charger for those arriving inelectric cars (¬£15/night or ¬£25/day charge)payable before charging. The space The space
The cottage is suitable for couples or a family not groups of singles. Dogs are welcome with prior consent. The floor mattress is a single fold up. The cottage has its own terrace with table. There is a utility room next door with washing machine and tumble dryer and space for boots and coats. It is located on a footpath so great for walking with 2 woods encircling us. The garden has open access on to a farm road so dogs need to be attended at all times. There are also lots of cycling paths for cycling. Guest access Guest access
There is one dedicated parking space for the cottage but room beside it for further cars. Guests can use the garden which includes a unique fruit garden with peaches apricots pears figs and many other fruits. Please note there is a private covered swimming pool in the garden for family use only this is not available for guests to use so children would need to be supervised at all times in the garden. Other things to note Other things to note
The nearest supermarkets are about 10 minutes drive away.
The nearest station is 10 minutes away Paddock Wood with frequent trains to London. Tonbridge station is about 15 minutes drive with even more frequent trains to London.
We are on a public footpath so multiple walks from the house.
There is a covered private swimming pool for family use only in the gardenthis is not available for guests to use so children will need supervision in the garden at all times.
Those bringing dogs should be aware there is open access to a farm road so you need to supervise dogs at all times.
We have 2 very friendly dogs but if you are afraid of dogs please let us know in advance so we can keep them away from you.

Title: Lake Joseph Waterfront Cottage
Description:
Perfect rural getaway! Peaceful & secluded lakeside setting for a relaxing adults break in our cosy hut. Pets welcome (xtra). Private bathroom facilities. Fishing available. Countryside walks nearby lead to local villages e.g. Buxted & Hadlow Down or wander round our lakes ancient woodland and shaws where wildlife and wild flowers abound. Cattle and sheep in our fields nearby. Tunbridge Wells/Brighton 1/2hr drive. Main line trains to/from Buxted/ Crowborough and London (1 hr). Discs for 4 nts+ The space The space
Our 2 huts have been neatly fitted out to provide a comfortable space to unwind and relax in private. They may be small but have all mod cons albeit in small sizes!! Either stay local for a total chill out or use it as a base for exploring the East Sussex area.
Kitchen area has kettle small fridge/freezer mini oven/toaster double ring gas hob microwave cafetiere ironing board and iron bug zapper fan log burner with initial supply of kindling and logs (top up available for extra charge) TV. Wifi. USB point Bluetooth speaker. BBQ on balcony. Firepit outside on slabs to sit round of an evening. Use of full size fridge/freezer and wash up area with washing machine and line in separate hut. Own private comfortable heated toilet/shower hut a short walk away.
Hand towels provided but please bring own bath/face towels.
Several walks nearby to Buxted Hadlow Down Rotherfield. Pubs nearby - The New Inn (a really old fashioned drinkers pub) The Buxted Inn The White Hart The Blackboys The Hurstwood plus several in Crowborough Uckfield and Heathfield. Takaways menus in the hut for collection or delivery.
Coarse Fishing (carp to 20lbs plus many varieties of other silver fish). available for ¬£10 per day (2 rods pp Must have a current angling licence). Full details sent on booking.
MAX 2 PETS ¬£5 per pet per night (payable on arrival please). Must be kept on leads except for our empty fields that we will show you and the swimming lake. Not allowed on bed. And please pick up after them.
Small safe for your valuables inside plus Keysafe outside.
We fill the bird feeders hanging on your balcony and youll have a good view of our local birdlife from the warmth and privacy of your hut!
Extra logs and charcoal available to buy. Other things to note Other things to note
Welcome pack on arrival consists of bread croissants butter milk juice drinking water tea coffee sugar. Also supplied condiments such as pepper salt cooking oil.
Nearest supermarkets in Crowborough (Waitrose Lidl Morrisons Sainsbury Local Tesco). Small supermarket in Buxted.
Petrol stations Morrisons BP and Esso in Crowborough. Esso + 2 others in Uckfield.

Title: Miera Osta Tree house
Description:
Escape to the country in this stylish immaculately clean barn conversion filled with light and surrounded by unspoiled countryside

As part of a collection of Medieval farm buildings The Dairy sits at the edge of a Sussex water meadow and boasts its own private south facing terrace

Great for anniversaries and quiet celebrations holidays or just time away enjoying the secluded and self contained accommodation
Keypad access can allow you the opportunity for complete independence The space The space
The Dairy has been beautifully renovated from a C19th brick built barn into a boutique holiday home.
Part of a medieval farmstead which dates back to the 14th century it features ;

A bright open plan living/kitchen space with large bifold doors opening onto a secluded south facing terrace with beautiful rural views..
A lovely separate bedroom and large en-suite shower room.

The addition of old mirrors decorative accent pieces and attention to detail make this property a dream location for a quiet getaway or special occasion.

The Dairy has a fully equipped kitchen complete with large fridge/freezer microwave toaster dishwasher range-style oven with ceramic hob and a Nespresso coffee machine.

There is also a washer/dryer should you need it.

Unlimited free WiFi throughout.
The lounge area benefits from a 55 inch smart TV with Netflix and an award winning Samsung soundbar which will also stream your own music via Bluetooth.
A traditional Clearview wood burning stove will ensure that your stay is always warm cosy and relaxing
We supply you with plenty of logs at no extra cost.

In the separate bedroom you will find a wonderfully comfortable King size bed from Heals of London draped in sumptuous linens and Egyptian cotton bed sheets.
The handcrafted solid oak dressing table can also be used as a convenient work space.
We have provided a state of the art Dyson fan the perfect companion for warm summer nights and a cosy hot water bottle for those frosty evenings.

The light and spacious en-suite boasts a large walk in shower beautiful limestone flooring with under-floor heating and ambient lighting. Egyptian cotton bath sheets and hand towels are provided along with hand wash and shower gel.

Outside there is a large and private south facing terrace with seating and views over the water meadows where you can stroll down to the River Uck boundary.
It is not uncommon to see herds of passing deer along with the neighbouring sheep and keep an eye out for the beautiful buzzards who have made their home in the surrounding trees.

For those of you who like to bring a bike away with you we have installed a sturdy outdoor bike rack that will accommodate three bicycles.

A BBQ can be available upon request. Guest access Guest access
The Dairy is detached and set away from the Farmhouse your parking is adjacent to the building. Other things to note Other things to note
Please note that mobile phone reception is limited with some operators better than others.

Unfortunately not safe or suitable for children or infants.

No smoking within the property.

No dogs or pets.

Limited access and steps.

Please be aware that we are part of a small Sussex farm and as such there may occasionally be the chance of farm related noise for example from a tractor chainsaw grass cutting sheep a dog and grandchildren.

No parties filming or extra guests please.

Title: Caba√±a Jasper ~ Casa del √Årbol frente al lago
Description:
The Barn is a self-contained recently converted space in the heart of the Chilterns. It is close to the riverside towns of Henley-on-Thames and Marlow and the surrounding Chiltern countryside. It is located on the edge of the village of Frieth with nearby farm shops and local gastro-pubs within a 5 min drive.

The Barn is in a private and peaceful location with off-street parking. It is perfect for couples solo travellers and small families. The space The space
The space is divided into bedroom bathroom and kitchen/living space.
The bedroom has a double bed and ample storage.
Bathroom has bath and shower facilities plus heated towel rail.
Kitchen has an electric hob microwave grill toaster and fridge.
Sitting area has a two-seater sofa armchair television audio equipment and radio.
There is underfloor heating throughout and a wood-burner for colder evenings.
Outside is a private patio with seating.
There is a key safe so guests are able to come and go as they please.
Ample parking space on a shared drive. Guest access Guest access
The Barn is a detached building in a corner of the garden: guests have exclusive access to the whole building.

A quiet location the annex is hidden away overlooking farmers fields in the South Downs National Park.Great if you love being close to nature walkingbridlepaths and local friendly country pubswe are also 2 mins away from the RSPB and Parham House.Dont forget your walking boots! The space The space
Purpose built timber framed annex separate from the main house with open plan kitchen diningseparate bathroom with wet room/walk in shower.Bedroom with king size bed vaulted ceilings living.Freeview Tv and usual kitchen amenities free wifi.Next to a national trail bridle path. Title: A Little Closer to Heaven Primitive Tree house
Description:
Sissinghurst Castle and its famous gardens are only a 15 minute woodland walk away from this peaceful and tranquil one bedroom cottage which is set in private grounds of 18 acres and surrounded by woods and wildlife. Gamekeeper Cottage is the perfect retreat for getting away from it all at all times of year but is only one hour from London by train. The cottage dates from 1798 and sits directly opposite the main house. The wood burner makes it a cosy and romantic getaway. Sleeps 2-4 The space The space
This charming one bedroom cottage is over 200 years old and has been beautifully restored retaining many of its original features including the wooden beams. A very large window provides great views to the gardens large pond and impressive eucalyptus trees beyond.

The double bedroom

The cottage has recently been extended and now includes a large double bedroom which is light and airy and has wonderful views to the pond and beyond. The French doors open onto a large patio area where guests can relax and enjoy the pond the wildlife and extensive garden area. A barbecue is available. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE EXTENSION HAS NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED SO THERE ARE NO PHOTOS YET. IT WILL BE COMPLETED AT THE END OF MARCH 2022

The open plan living room and mezzanine sleeping area

The living room has a large window providing fantastic views to the pond and gardens There is a very comfortable sofa dining table and chairs as well as the woodburner. The bathroom has a shower toilet and sink. The kitchen area has an electric oven/hob and fridge freezer. The comfortable double bed is on a mezzanine level accessed by a steepish staircase.

Please note that although the cottage can sleep up to 4 guests it is quite small for 4.

The Woodburner
The wood burner is a favourite feature of our guests providing warmth and a cosy atmosphere. All wood and kindling is provided. The wood is sustainably sourced from trees coppiced on the property. There are also electric heaters for those who don	 want to light a fire.


The outside area
Outside the cottage there is a large patio area where guests can relax and enjoy the pond and wildlife. There is a table and chairs and a barbecue. Guest also have exclusive access to the extensive beautiful garden area around the pond.

There is also a magical circle of oakBBQ/sitting area in the woodland which is completely secluded and is a great favourite of our guests. Located in the middle of a circle of ancient oak trees it is a wonderful spot to light a fire and listen to the bird life.

We have excellent WIFI - superfast fibre to the property with a download speed of 900 megabytes per second

Sissinghurst Castle and its world renowned gardens is only a short walk away by public footpath through enchanting woods. The property adjoins the Sissinghust Castle Estate so all you need to do is walk to the top of the drive cross the road and you are immediately in the grounds of Sissinghurst Castle - the Castle itself is about 15 minutes walk away through an enchanting wood.

Gamekeeper\s Cottage provides a great retreat at all times of year. In autumn and winter it is cosy and atmospheric with the roaring fire and wonderful crisp walks on your doorstep. Spring and summer are spectacular with the Garden of England as Kent is known blossoming and coming to life. Bluebell season which is usually in May is a particular favourite with carpets of bluebells in the woods.

The local wildlife is plentiful. As well as the resident ducks and chickens there are many badgers foxes and deer in the woodlands surrounding the cottage. In the dead of night you will hear the owls hooting and the dawn chorus of the numerous birds will greet you at day break.

The area has many excellent pubs some of which are over 500 years old. They all serve very good food and first class local beer. The Milkhouse in Sissinghurst and the Three Chimneys in Biddenden are both one mile away.

There are many other National Trust properties nearby including Castles stately homes and gardens. The charming village of Cranbrook is 3 miles away and the Cinque port of Rye with the golden sands of Camber 30 minutes by car. London is one hour away by train and Canterbury one hour. There are many beautiful walks in the immediate vicinity many of which can be started from the cottage itself.


Vineyards

The area is also known for some of the finest vineyards in England. Biddenden Vineyards Hush Heath and Chapel Down are a short drive away.

Yoga

Henrietta is a fully qualified British School of Yoga instructor and teaches from beginner level to advanced. Classes can be arranged directly with her either in the main house or outside in spring and summer. Guest access Guest access
Parking is immediately outside the cottage Other things to note Other things to note
We have excellent WIFI - superfast fibre broadband with a download speed of 900 megabytes per second . However we have a limited mobile phone signaldue to a poor signal from the main exchange. If you switch on wi-fi calling on your phone then calls work well in the apartment. If this does not work and you do need to make a call there is a good signal at the top of the drive and you are welcome to use the landline in the main house.

Please note that the main beam in the cottage is 6 feet 2 inches high and the double bed at the mezzanine level can only be accessed from one side. Public transport is limited and the country roads are not pedestrian friendly so ideally it is better to come with your own transport. Alternatively taxis can be booked through the local firm MTC taxis.

Title: Florida Vacation Magic, Pool, 8BR-5BA
Description:
Brand new detached house in an elevated position above a quiet rural lane. Great night skies and horses in the field next door. Outside sitting area and private parking. Lovely king sized double bed with views and high quality bedding. Local eggs provided for breakfast. The Acorn is in the heart of the village so it‚Äôs very easy to walk anywhere and find 3 great pubs. There is also a Co-op store in the village. Fully refundable booking settings. The space The space
We have stayed in many places and tried to take the good parts from each to make The Acorn comfortable and relaxing for you. There is a stereo and an ekornes stressless relaxing leather chair in the main bedroom. Downstairs is a leather sofa and an extendable dining table to seat 4 and an electric shower in the bathroom.

In the fridge will be milk and local free range eggs there are cereals and various teas and a new frying pan!
We have 2 travel cots and a high chair should you need them.

We can put another mattress upstairs if needed so it would be possible to sleep 5.

There is a lady in the village who can make chocolate brownies or Victoria sponge cake at 3 days notice. ¬£10 each so let us know if you might like to try one.Guest access
You will have the whole house along with an outside sitting area and space to park 2 cars.
We also have a large children‚Äôs trampoline in our garden which any children can use at their own risk please just walk round any time. The post code is MK45 4BG.Other things to note
The house is up a short but a little steep drive which some people may find difficult to walk up/down. However there is parking available at both the top and bottom so no need to walk it.

Title: #casa sull'albero #tree house#nature#Baumhaus
Description:
The accommodation is separate from our house and has its own entrance.
We provide a basic breakfast essentials i.e. Bread Fresh milk Tea & Coffee etc.
Free off road parking for duration of your stay.
Airport transfers available.
You will require a car as we are in a rural location.
IMPORTANT NOTE: If there is any anti-sociable behaviour or taking of any illegal substances by any member of your group you will all be immediately dismissed from the property and there will be no refunds given. The space The space
The space

The Annexe in a quiet rural location near Stansted Airport and wedding venues. It has 2 bedrooms with the main bedroom having a double bed and the 2nd bedroom having 2 single beds. In the living area there is a double sofa bed and a corner sofa suite table and chairs and a 40 TV. The living room and main bedroom have views of the peaceful garden which you have access to. The courtyard has a seating area which you can sit outside and enjoy a cup of coffee or something stronger.

There is shower room with toilet and wash basin and we provide shampoo conditioner and body wash.

In the Kitchen you will have access to Kettle Toaster Microwave and Washing Machine. We provide a basic breakfast - tea coffee cereal fresh milk spreads.

There is an Electric Hob George Foreman Grill and Microwave as cooking facilities. I also provide pans and cooking utensils.Other things to note

Title: The Willow in Treehouse Grove at Norton Creek
Description:
Dog friendly charming unique ancient cottage with uninterupted far reaching views of the Sussex countryside. Perfectly placed for guests who wish to explore the countryside visit the historical 1066 town of Battle (within walking distance) or venture slightly further to the seaside (Hastings (8m)Camber sands (17m) Bexhill (10m). The space The space
Family accommodation suitable for up to 4 guests. The cottage benefits from a large decking area overlooking stunning countryside views.
Fully equipped kitchen with oven fridge freezer microwave cooking utensils.
Dedicated Barbecue area within the well maintained gardens that surround the cottage. TV and wifi also provided.
Carport parking for one car.
Please note the inglenook fireplace is a beautiful feature but unfortunately due to the age of the cottage is not functional for live fires.
Guests will receive a complimentary welcome pack including milk tea and coffee.
This property is a strictly non-smoking venue.
Up to 2 dogs would be welcomed.

Covid 19 cleaning will always be carried out between guests using a professional fogging machine with hypochlorous acid (HOCI) which is a hospital grade disinfectant that is also organic and environmentally friendly.

Title: Unusual night in a Treehouse
Description:
Our Shepherds hut is situated within 40 acres of woodland orchard and garden in an area of Outstanding Beauty set high with stunning views of the Surrey Hills. Glorious sunsets and an abundance of bird life are often seen from the hut and within the Kilnhanger estate. Although remote the hut is positioned close to our cottage for security - privacy is still available and you may park your vehicle adjacent to the hut
Our hut is not only cool in the summer but cosy in the winter The space The space
Shepherds Hut contains kitchennete with a fridge and two electric hobs for cooking (no oven) shower towel rail toilet and double bed with electric radiator to provide warmth on those cold days ! Guest access Guest access
You are free to explore the estate woodland and pastures but please be aware of horses and their riders that use the estate Other things to note Other things to note
As we provide a continental breakfast please advise if there are any dietary requirements.

For convenience there is private parking adjacent to the hut

Title: Ecotoo+tree room pres de la Plage de Juan y Lolo
Description:
Our cosy and luxurious Hut is suitable for singles & couples that appreciate the finer things in life. The accommodation comprises an en-suite power shower-room compact kitchen dining area and double bed. Facilities includes Freeview TV/Radio WIFI and log burning stove & fuel. We provide tea coffee milk crusty bread butter olive oil various condiments and fresh eggs from our own happy chickens. The private garden with BBQ & furniture has fantastic views parking space & own entrance. The space The space
The Pilgrims Hut and surrounding lower garden is a perfect romantic retreat and is all your private space. It includes garden chairs and table grass rug with BBQ and there are stunning views across the valley. There is also a dedicated parking space and your own private entrance.

The main garden with high hedgerows and mature pond is the equivalent of a woodland glade and is a haven for bird life. Crows Jays Green and Greater Spotted Woodpeckers and of course Herons are all regular visitors and buzzards can be seen circling high above. Bullfinch and Nuthatch are more exotic but frequent visitors and during summer nights there are hunting bats and sometimes owls to hoot you to sleep. You are welcome to wander these areas as they are enjoyed by us all.

In spring and summer the pheasants return to the garden and mallard ducks to the pond to mate. In late February Toads wake up from hibernation and begin migrating to their breeding pond in Pilgrims Garden to spawn and their croaking sounds give the gardens an equatorial feel; unfortunately the temperature doesnt match! Guest access Guest access

Title: Casa da Mouta - Douro Valley
Description: One of the top 30 quirky places to stay in the UK chosen by MuddyStilletos travel guide. Sleeping two the hut is perfect for couples friends or solo travellers. It is close to beautiful walks local pubs farm shops and historic towns ... or simply a place to unwind read a good book and get back to nature. The space The space\nBeautiful bespoke Shepherds hut built on the chassis of an original hut found in a nearby copse. Located in the hamlet of Beedon Common an area of outstanding natural Beauty just a few miles away from Chieveley and j13 of the m4. Surrounded by fields there is access directly onto byways and footpaths so perfect for anyone keen on walking or cycling. The nearby villages of Peasemore Beedon and Chieveley are within walking distance and have super pubs for a drink or bite to eat. There are plenty of activities within a short drive from national trust properties to canal boat rides to quirky tea shops or historic market towns- more information in the welcome pack once you have booked. The hut itself is in a paddock separate from our garden which also houses a large lilly pond and a few chickens so lovely fresh eggs for breakfast. Beautiful views face across the fields to the west and across the pond to the east. We do have dogs ourselves and welcome your furry friends provided they can be trusted with other dogs and chickens. The Shepherds hut bed can pull out to make a double or folded away to make a single. The hut is warm and cosy thanks to proper insulation a discreet heater and a traditional log burning stove -plenty of wood provided. There is a DAB radio for your use as well as a supply of traditional games and a book swap. There is currently no bathroom in the paddock but a modern shower room and toilet is set aside for guest use in the barn next to the main house (literally 10 seconds walk through the garden). For cooking there is a baby belling stove (hob grill and oven) inside the hut with cutlery cooking utensils and tea making facilities. There is a small fridge in the shelter next to the hut. For breakfast fresh eggs bread milk juice tea fresh coffee and condiments will be provided. There is electricity inside the hut and cold running water is available outside. There is a hammock picnic bench and a beautiful oak framed shelter with outdoor wood burner for keeping warm and cosy when sun goes down over the best views in Berkshire.

Formerly the manor house gymnasium The Studio now provides comfortable accommodation for two people. It consists of an open plan sitting room/bedroom separate kitchen and shower room.
The accommodation is situated in the grounds of a riverside manor farm bordering the River Thames and is close to Oxford (on a direct bus route) Blenheim Palace and the Cotswolds. Guest access Guest access
The Studio has access to 10 acres of gardens and water meadows leading down to the Thames Path and River Thames. Other things to note Other things to note

Title: Moonlight Forest Cabin
Description:
Completely peaceful with fantastic views-totally isolated with its own private entrance.
Set in the Chiltern hills- Mary‚Äôs Cabin is 2minutes stroll from the Restaurant of the Year-
In an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty;-walking road & mountain biking- pub 7minutes up through the woods-
35mins from Heathrow and Oxford -Central London-50mins .
Couples solo adventurers and small families (with 1small child).

Sadly since the advent of Covid we no longer provide breakfast for our guests The space The space
Set isolated in the garden Marys cabin looks across the valley with woods on each side atop the hill you can see for 3miles.
The space consists of one room with double bed satTV internet- microwave fridge and kettle + a shower room with toilet and sink. Guest access Guest access
Normally we try to meet you as you arrive or failing this there are instructions- the cabin will be open for you! Other things to note Other things to note

Title: fumades squirrel cabin
Description:
A purpose built Cabin in the garden of our river home Seahorse which overlooks the River Thames with views of Ash Island. You will be welcomed into a tranquil comfortable unique retreat with all the amenities you need for a perfect stay with us. The space The space
Situated on Taggs Island off the Hampton Court Road you can drive over the islands bridge left along the road and park in our gravel driveway next to the Cabin. It has wonderful views of the River Thames and the sun pours in through the windows all day. We have an enchanting garden and the wildlife of the river is all around us. As well as offering comfortable contemporary living space you will also have exclusive use of the adjacent patio area in the garden with outdoor seating to sit and contemplate the river or just read and relax.

We have a dog called Dilly and a cat called Milo. There are in the garden from time to time but we will make sure they dont bother you.

Our guests have the entire cabin which includes a bedroom bathroom and living room. There is also a kettle toaster coffee machine microwave and fridge (Please note there is no hob or oven) There is also a smart TV with internet connection.

The Cabin is entirely electric there is no gas boiler.

(Please also note that the ¬£10 cleaning fee is for up to a 7 day stay and thereafter weekly)

Make the most of your stay by visiting one of the many places of interest around Hampton Court. The Cabin is just a five-minute walk to Londons second largest royal park Bushy Park and only a fifteen minute walk away from Hampton Court Palace. Central London can be reached by train from Hampton Court or Kingston stations into Waterloo. There are regular buses - the 111 R68 and 216 which stop just by the Taggs Island bridge. We also have many festivals and concerts locally both at Hampton Court ( including the annual Flower Show) and Hampton Court Pool open air concerts. More information on the local area restaurants pubs and cafes can be provided . We are happy to help you with any information you need.
Kingston is also a great shopping centre and with more riverside restaurants.

Title: salagnac cabins - nature design
Description:
The Little Annexe is a self contained detached unit. Set within our farmland near rural Warninglid we are located within the High Weald area of outstanding natural beauty. Access to public footpaths allow you entry into the beautiful woodlands and surrounds. Ideally situated: 6 miles from both Horsham and Haywards Heath. Only a 15 min drive to Gatwick Airport. We are also local to event venues including Slaugham Place Cisswood Hyde Estate Brookfield Barn Bolney Wine Estate South Lodge. The space The space
Kitchen appliances include a microwave oven coffee machine kettle toaster and fridge.
Sugar coffee tea is also provided.
We really hope you enjoy your stay and hope we have made it as comfortable as possible. Guest access Guest access
There is separate entrance for guests. Off road parking for your car. Other things to note Other things to note
We are making every effort to ensure that you and ourselves are at the least risk during these unprecedented times. Please let us know immediately if you are displaying any Covid-19 symptoms. We would rather refund your stay then put you/us at risk. Many thanks.

Title: Llama Meadows Farm Purple Palace TinyTreehouse
Description:
Toad Hall is our luxury lodge/ treehouse in the woods at Happy Valley Norfolk with incredible views across open unspoilt countryside with a Private Hot Tub. Suitable for 4 adults & 2 children. Under floor heating oven hob toaster kettle fridge. Wet room. King size accommodation. BBQ. Part disable/pram friendly. Ideally located close to Sandringham Houghton & the North Norfolk coast. 15 mins from Kings lynn station. Perfect retreat to immerse in nature. Wifi-4GBox The space The space
Open plan gable living room kitchen. Wet room. King size bedroom downstairs with double doors opening onto morning terrace. Watch the sunset on the west facing terrace. Double bedroom and space for children to sleep. Wet room and fully functional kitchen. Private Hot tub. Suitable for up to 4 adults and 2 children. There are space saving stairs to the first floor. These are quite steep. There is a stair gate at the top but not at the bottom. Something to note if you have small children. Outdoor dining & BBQ. The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape. Covid Measures in place. Guest access Guest access
A rural escape surrounded by woodland and open views. The lodge is hired as a whole and consists of king bedroom. Double. Fitted kitchen with oven. Sink. Hob. Fridge. Living space looking across open farmland. The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape. Other things to note Other things to note
Hot tub may not have reached temperature on arrival due to the measures we are putting in place for Covid. Bedding is provided but please strip covers and sheets and place in laundry bag provided when you leave. Toad Hall stands alone and is private. There are blinds in the gable end and bedroom. No other curtains etc so you can appreciate the rural views.
You have to drive up a farm track to reach the lodge. All types of vehicles can drive up here you do not need a 4x4. Downstairs has king bedroom wetroom living room and kitchen (oven hob toaster kettle etc). We are a rural destination nestled in the woods on a traditional Norfolk working farm situated on a Norfolk Wildlife Trust. Space saving stairs to first floor. These are steeper than house stairs. Stair gate at the top. Not at the bottom. The hot tub may not be hot on arrival due to covid deep cleaning please leave lid on and do not press buttons as this will not speed up heating times. There is a play area for children on the main Glamping site. You will need towels and to bring woodland appropriate footwear. WiFi isn‚Äôt the best but that‚Äôs due to the rural setting. Not good enough for streaming. 4g in places. A holiday to connect in nature and reconnect with each other.The ground floor is part disabled friendly. Anyone booking must be able to open doors independently for easy escape.

Title: Cabane aux Zoiseaux
Description:
Nestled in the heart of the Forest of Bowland AONB this glamping pod is ideal for hikers and bikers who want a base more substantial than a tent and less fuss than a hotel. Want privacy with absolutely nobody else around? We can almost guarantee you wont see a single person while youre at the pod so you can sit back and enjoy the stunning panoramic views that stretch for miles over the Dunsop and Ribble Valleys from the hot tub champagne in hand with nobody to disturb you. The space The space
The Shepherd‚Äôs rest is set in its own valley with panoramic views. It‚Äôs location makes it the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Anyone who stays at the pod will have great access to walks cycling and adventure. Gisburn forest mountain bike trails is a 15 minute drive there a plenty of walks to do in the area and some great places to eat out.

The pod is made out of a solid wood frame and boasts three sides of glass to fully take in the panoramic views. The pod is split in half with one side providing a comfortable and relaxing living area. There is a log burner sofa bed and kitchen unit in this side of the pod. The other side of the pod is the bedroom and bathroom complete with double bed toilet sink and shower.

The hot tub is located on decking outside the pod and backs onto an old barn in the field. The hot tub is filled with natural spring water. It is a beautiful experience to sit in the hot tub as sunset falls over the valley.

Title: Pirate's cabin in a magical place
Description:
The Woodlands cabin is situated in our peaceful woodland in the heart of Snowdonia. It has a shower (hot water included) and w.c and washbasin (no hot water in the washbasin.
Lighting is provided from a 12v solar panel system.
A log burner is provided with free wood and fire lighters.
There is a double bed.
The private wood fired hot tub is situated on a balcony overlooking the woodland area.
Pet friendly.
Outside heating is provided. The space The space
This unique glamping experience has everything you need for a restful and idyllic break from everyday life. Wake up to bird song and the sound of the stream. Enjoy your own exclusive hot tub whilst sipping a glass of bubbly. Our Hut is fully insulated and has everything you need for that perfect rustic getaway without compromising on quality and convenience.

ALL bedding and towels are included in your stay. You may like to bring extra towels for hot tub usage.

A small log burner inside to keep you nice and cosy.

There is limited telephone signal. Other things to note Other things to note
Things we do provide
In the kitchen - we provide a single gas camping stove and kettle. The kitchen area is full equipped including a cool box - you may like to bring ice with you. There is no hot water in the kitchen sink.
In the bathroom - there is a shower w.c and washbasin. Hot water is provided in the shower cubicle only.
There is a wood burner and wood and fire lighters are provided free.

Please note that this is an ECO cabin. The lighting is. 12v system run off solar panels.

Outside seating is provided.

Title: Secluded, Romantic Tree House Retreat
Description:
The Ludlow Pod is nestled snugly in the South Shropshire Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
Situated alongside a working farm with plenty of walks from the doorstep this cosy Glamping Pod provides the perfect escape to relax and unwind.
The accomodation has been individually designed and furnished in a bespoke style to provide you with a restful stay with a private hot tub included.
Luxury 100% cotton bed linen and towels are provided along with tea coffee sugar. The space The space
Wet room with shower
Double Induction hob and microwave oven with grill
Double bed with Hybrid Memory Foam Mattress
32 LED Freesat TV
FREE WI-FI
All year round heating
Outdoor decking area
Uninterrupted views Other things to note Other things to note
Travel cot & high chair available for ¬£10 per stay
Iron & Ironing board available for ¬£5 per stay

Title: The Treehouse of Borgo Stazione Salionze
Description:
The property include a comfortable king size bed fully equipped kitchen and bathroom TV and internet and car parking facilities. All the architectural details have been created by our talented local designer to produce for you a relaxing interior style using natural and sustainable materials to inspire an earthy feeling without forgetting all the modern comforts you need.The space The space
Otters Rest

You will be immersed in beautiful nature and surrounded by the sound of the water. You can enjoy the tranquillity of our award nominated Eco -House with two lovely covered terraces for a nice weekend retreat where you can read a book or just relax with a cup of tea.

Otters Rest is located in Clitheroe Lancashire in the grounds of a listed building built in 1795 with a long history associated with the Lancashire cotton mills.

We are at the edge of the town so whilst you are secluded all the amenities are within just 10 min walk. This area of the Ribble Valley is very beautiful and sits at the edge of the Forest of Bowland with Stonyhurst College only 15 minutes away. Downham and other picturesque villages are very close for you to visit and enjoy for walks and visiting the wonderful pubs.

It is an ideal base for visiting friends in the area for a walking holiday or for just the peace and quiet to have a break from chaotic cities. If you are a foodie the Ribble Valley is peppered with gastronomic experiences to suit all pockets.Clitheroe is a really charming old town with individual shops a market and even a micro-brewery situated in the beautifully converted Holmes Mill just a short walk from the house.

For a very different and very special experience try our little paradise!!!Other things to note
