Title: Full bath, Seclusion, Mtn View- Kitchen, Fireplace
Description:
This beyond the average bespoke 2020 build is ultimately pleasing to the eye with it‚Äôs curvaceous smoothed oak rail staircase handsome pillars and waxy satin cedar beams which embrace this appealing handcrafted lodge. An open plan living area leads onto 2 bedrooms with beautiful en-suites. Sitting in a field amongst the vivid greens of the Shropshire hills on an expanse of decking where you can open up the bifold doors and bring the outside in and enjoy the deliciously warm hot tub. The space The space
Sunlight floods the stylish rooms showing off the gorgeous comfy furnishings. A log burner sits in the living area where you can hunker down on a winters day. An eclectic style kitchen of chunky wood and midnight blue cupboards with an accent of copper is well equipped. The honey hues of the king size oak four poster bed with its enticing plump bedding leading to wide opening bifold doors out onto a balcony with mesmerising views. The en-suite bathroom is luxuriant with its double rainfall shower heads two sinks and heated floor. The second bedroom is welcoming with its deliciously comfy bed which cleverly can a king size double or two singles. The perfectly conceived en-suite has a heated floor and a shower to die for. In a field amongst an abundance of fruit blossom in the spring and broad leafy woods in the summer. This alluring place is tantalising in its serenity and you can‚Äôt help but fall into its bewitching peaceful rhythm. Guest access Guest access
A Private track lined by oak and sycamore trees will bring you up to a gravel parking area where you can unload and take the well lit footpath to the Lodge. We have 9 acres of private woodland with tracks for you to use right outside your front door and a field with the river Onny at the bottom which is easily accessible. Other things to note Other things to note
There is no extra charges for fire wood and kindling or use of the hot tub. The Hot tub will be ready for use on your arrival with towels along with bathroom towels hand towels and bed linen. We provide a welcome pack this includes tea coffee sugar milk butter eggs homemade loaf of bread and Jam. Toilet rolls are provided. Soap powder and softener for washing machine along with washing up liquid.

Title: Luxurious tree house perched in huge parasol pine
Description:
Our BRAND NEW traditional Canadian Log Cabin sits at the top of the mountain overlooking the Ceiriog Valley and Berwyn mountains. It is ideal for romantic breaks or just to relax and unwind making use of your own private hot tub after long walks in the hills. A mere four miles from Llangollen youll find a great base to make the most of all the fantastic outdoor activities and places to visit that we have to offer in the local area and further afield in North Wales Cheshire and Shropshire. Guest access Guest access
Guests have access to a spacious garden and an undercover private hot tub spa which is right next to the cabin and exclusively for use of guests of the cabin. Other things to note Other things to note
WELCOME PACK:

We provide a welcome pack for guests: Generally consisting of a few tea bags and some coffee so that you can have a brew on arrival without having to worry about unpacking all of your stuff. Along with other homemade produce dependant on what‚Äôs in season and what I‚Äôve been cooking / baking a slice of cake or maybe some jam may be available.

All said and done if there‚Äôs anything at all that you need during your stay please don‚Äôt hesitate to come and ask us and we will always do our best to help.

WI-FI:
We are currently without WiFi .

PETS:

With pets of our own we understand how much people like to bring them on holiday. Therefore we do accept one well behaved pet on request.

For this we make a small charge of ¬£35 for three nights stay.
For four nights plus we make a ¬£50 charge which is payable on arrival please.

We also ask our guests PLEASE NOT to leave their pets unsupervised in the log cabin as they can become quiet stressed in a strange environment.

Any questions please don‚Äôt hesitate to drop us a message.

Title: The birdhouse
Description:
Social distancing to a ‚ÄòT‚Äô !!
‚ÄòLittle Gate House is an idyllic country retreat for couples in the heart of the New Forest National Park. A cosy self-contained cabin with enclosed garden.South facing elevated position with gorgeous views.The New Forest is literally on the doorstep but yet there is easy access to visit the nearby towns villages cities and beaches.
Fab pub2 cafes (1 with farm shop) all an easy walk.
1 dog allowed - ¬£25 total payable in cash.
10% off week stays
Min. 3 nights The space The space
* In light of the Covid 19 pandemic I‚Äôd like to reassure my guests that I have a very high standard of cleanliness and I clean and disinfect all surfaces the bathroom the kitchen and high touch surfaces such as handles tv remotes light switches etc. The bedding and towels are washed at 60 degrees and I will remove all scatter cushions and blankets if you‚Äôd like me to. However I do spray them with a disinfectant spray. We are positioned in the middle of the countryside where you don‚Äôt have to come into contact with anybody else if you don‚Äôt wish to. You have more chance of meeting a wild pony! It‚Äôs self check in so you don‚Äôt even have to have any contact with me! I even disinfect the key!!
If you book and then we are put into a lockdown during your booked dates in the first instance I would hope that you would consider postponing your stay and changing your dates. However if this is not an option for you and you need to cancel then I would instruct Airbnb to issue you a full refund.

*Length of stay discounts automatically applied. Up to 10% off for week stays.

*Late booking discounts automatically applied.

*Please contact me if your required dates won‚Äôt fit in. Sometimes there is some flexibility.

*Please let me know if you‚Äôre booking to celebrate a special occasion!

*First load of kindling and logs included but thereafter charged at ¬£5 per load.

*No extra cleaning fee or security deposit
charged.

*Feel free to bring a bbq.

*Extra charge of ¬£25 in total for a dog payable in cash during your stay. Please enquire if you‚Äôd like to bring more than one dog.

*Contactless check in - just book and arrive!

Little Gate House is located a short drive up a forest gravel track set on it‚Äôs own in the corner of our 3 ¬Ω acre grounds providing visitors with a high degree of privacy and peace. The site once formed part of Ibsley RAF base during World War II and Little Gate House was one of the original maycrete buildings. The block of stables that you look out onto is the old latrine block and a couple of Stanton air raid shelters are in the paddock. Literally to the rear of the cabin is the open New Forest providing a whopping 140000 acres of stunning landscape to explore. Horse riders frequently go by as well as wildlife such as the New Forest ponies cattle donkeys deer foxes badgers and an abundance of birds such as owls woodpeckers and buzzards which are often seen circling above the trees during the summer months.

Well designed the Little Gate House provides a compact yet light and airy space. Inside the heated and fully insulated bespoke cabin you\ll find all the comforts you would expect from luxury self-catering accommodation. Living room open plan with fully equipped kitchen/dining area with full height ceilings a wood-burning stove and double French doors opening onto a large area of south-facing decking. Cosy bijou double bedroom with full height built-in wardrobe and extra storage space above the bed useful for storing bags etc. En-suite bathroom with over-bath shower basin electric ladder radiator and toilet. Wooden floors throughout. Many guests have described Little Gate House as being Small but perfectly formed and equipped with everything you need. Enclosed private garden to the side of the cabin ideal for your dog to stretch their legs!

Although guests have the convenience of access straight onto the New Forest there is also quick and easy access to all main roads for visitors to explore the many villages towns cities and beaches that Hampshire Dorset and Wiltshire have to offer.

Riding stables 10 min drive watersports/fishing 2 miles award-winning \Hockey\s Farm\ shop and caf√© 10 min walk the lovely \Royal Oak\ thatched pub and restaurant 20 min walk \The Potting Shed\ caf√© at Hyde 20 min walk (highly recommend - closed on Mondays). Ringwood (with a Waitrose Lidl and Sainsbury\s) 5 miles and Fordingbridge (with a Co-op and Tesco Express) 2.5 miles.
Please see \Getting Around\ section for walking directions to local farm shop pub and cafe.

*** Please have a look through the ‚Äòhouse rules‚Äô and it‚Äôs important you follow my directions to find us easily. Guest access Guest access
The entire space. It is for the sole private use of our guests. Other things to note Other things to note
We have dual band wifi. If your device gives you the choice then please select Gate House 5G (if not then Gate House 2.4G). The password is TOUCHWOOD. However us country folk don‚Äôt have as good a wifi as city folk so please be mindful of this. We have recently had a new router fitted and fibre optic brought all the way to the house so touchwood so far the wifi has been great!

Our property is accessed from a gravel track which has two ends. One end has a ford which is passable 90% of the year. When we have had an extreme amount of rain the ford may be too deep to drive through but there is access by coming in and out the other end of the track. Our property is 0.2 mile from the ford end and 0.5 mile from the other end. General maintenance is carried out on the track a few times a year. Come in through the electric gates and the Little Gate House will be directly in front of you on the left hand side.

You‚Äôll love my place because of the views the location the people the ambiance and the outdoors space. My place is good for couples solo adventurers business travelers families (with kids) and furry friends (pets). Private hot tub! Please note that there is an additional charge of ¬£20 per pet per stay. Note: min 3 night stay The space The space\nHot Tub!

Title: Rivendell
Description:
Stay in our beautifully crafted wooden Shepherd‚Äôs Hut set in your own private south facing field next to the river. Surrounded by rolling green hills this is the perfect eco-getaway with solar powered electricity and extensive outdoor space. Enjoy the elegant interior furnishings and cosy wood stove and explore the many walks on offer directly from your doorstep.
Ideal for dog owners hikers cyclists and nature lovers or anyone looking to get away from the normal hustle and bustle of life. The space The space
The Shepherds Hut has been lovingly crafted and furnished to provide a uniquely stylish and cosy retreat. Showcasing the natural wood and slate furniture that we make for a living the space contains cleverly designed table and benches that slide out from under the bed for spacious indoor dining and lots of hidden storage for your belongings.
The Shepherds hut has been very well insulated and even on the coldest winter days you will be dry and toasty inside with the wood burner and the gas-powered shower. No need to bring wood we have a healthy pile for you to use.
There is a toilet and shower attached to the back of the cabin with spectacular views.
Enjoy your breakfast at the table outside and maybe spot the grey heron flying in to catch his food from the river. In the evening you can sit outdoors around a bonfire to gaze at the stars and listen out for the owls or watch the moon rise over the fields from your comfy bed.
Keep your eyes pealed for badgers and otters and enjoy guaranteed peace and quiet and connection to nature.
There is no wi-fi but there is mobile phone reception.
Parking is available close to the Hut either by our house or a short walk on the other side of the hedge. Guest access Guest access
The Shepherds Hut is in your own private south facing field with fire pit and picnic table.
We ask for a donation towards wood for bonfires.
We have a second shepherds hut in its own field round the corner; the two huts are private from one another and there is no shared land between them.
Depending on the time of year you might get fresh eggs from our hens veg from the polytunnel or a selection of pick-your-own berries.

Title: Glamping at Deer Camp
Description:
The Stretton Pod is nestled snugly in the South Shropshire Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.
Situated alongside a working farm with plenty of walks from the doorstep this cosy Glamping Pod provides the perfect escape to relax and unwind.
The accomodation has been individually designed and furnished in a bespoke style to provide you with a restful stay with a private hot tub included.
Luxury 100% cotton bed linen and towels are provided along with tea coffee sugar. The space The space
Wet room with shower
Double Induction hob and combination microwave/oven/grill
Double bed with Hybrid Memory Foam Mattress
32 LED Freesat TV
FREE WI-FI
All year round heating
Outdoor decking area
Uninterrupted views Other things to note Other things to note
Travel cot & high chair available for ¬£10 per stay
Iron & Ironing board available for ¬£5 per stay

Title: Massanutten Rustic Cabin with Views
Description:
Thinking about a Spring/ Summer holiday in 2022? Why not booking one of our log cabins. Our cabins make a great base for exploring the beautiful Isle of Wight. Fully insulated double glazed and heated for all year round use. Suitable for couples or small families. The space The space
This Cabin opened in July 2020 and is beautifully finished with high quality furnishings and fittings making your stay as welcoming and comfortable as possible. Upon entering the grounds guests take the private track to an undercover parking area. Wander down the bark path and enter through French doors into the kitchen/ lounge. The Cabin has a fully fitted kitchen with microwave oven with grill fridge/freezer toaster and induction hob. All crockery and cutlery are supplied. The cabin also has a cafetiere for your morning coffee.
Relax on the comfortable L-shaped sofa bed in front of the 32 TV watch one of the many DVD\s provided or enjoy a glass of wine whilst playing a board game.
The separate shower room has fantastic water pressure providing an invigorating shower in a lovely corner unit together with a basin and flushing WC - soap and towels provided.
Through the door on the left hand side is a comfortable double bed with a quality mattress and topper all prepared with freshly washed bedding for your arrival . The comfy double sofa bed with topper has all bedding supplied and is ideal for children or adults.
You can dine at the table inside the cabin or enjoy the outdoors and eat at the picnic table next to your cabin. There is also a gravel area next to the picnic table for use with disposable bbqs these can be purchased on site if required.
Please note: we do not allow smoking/ vaping or pets on site. Guest access Guest access
We have 3 cabins on site all with their own grass and eating area.
Guests have the whole cabin to themselves and are free to enjoy several acres of outside space around them. Guests have access to the whole site of approximately 3 acres. Other things to note Other things to note
On site under cover parking is provided for cars and bicycles. Please note : only one car per cabin.
Highly recommended and Award winning local Family Pub/ Restaurant the Horse & Groom is within walking distance approximately 1 mile away. Serving breakfasts lunch dinner and Sunday Lunch. the Pub also has a childrens outside play area. Pre-booking definitely recommended.

Title: Silent Paradise in a Tree House - Monte Huam Hu
Description:
*LAST MIN CANCELLATION FOR XMAS TO COVID* Nights of 24 - 29 Dec now available *

Lovely cosy little Log Cabin in the centre of Snowdonia. Perfect for 2 can sleep 3‚Ä¶ (plus room for a travel cot if needed) with a fully equipped kitchen/ dining/ living area & shower room. Ideal for active getaways romantic breaks or a family holiday the cabin is close to forests & mountains & just 20 mins drive to the seaside.

2 night min booking. At Xmas/ New Year/ Bank Hols longer min stay applies. The space The space
* COVID-19 Update: Airbnb have imposed a Covid Sanitisation Clean between each booking and this is mandatory. We are now having to apply a cleaning fee to all bookings to cover this. Due to the remote nature of the cabin this requires a 20 mile round trip for a cleaner. This is to cover the Sanitisation Clean only and guests are still required to clean up after themselves during their stay. Cleaning products are provided.

* Please Note - For hygiene reasons we dont provide any linens/ bedding including bed sheets pillows duvets and towels (+ tea towels & cleaning cloths). Guests will need to bring their own.

We are very fond of our little Cabin and have aimed to create somewhere that is well equipped welcoming and as many of our guests say a Home from Home. We certainly love spending time there as an escape from everyday life and we hope you‚Äôll love it as much as we do!

Our self catering cabin was fully refurbished in 2016 and has a fully equipped kitchen & living area with TV & Freesat 2 bedrooms - 1 double & 1 single (note this is a fold out single bed) and a shower room.

The kitchen should be fully equipped with all you need to make a 3 course dinner or just a nice bacon sarnie in the morning. We try to keep the cupboards stocked with a few basics ‚Äì coffee tea Tomato Ketchup Salt & Pepper etc ‚Äì just in case! There is a small shop on site if you need any basic supplies too.

At the start of 2017 the cabin had a new fully insulated external cladding added to it & in late 2019 we had the roof insulated also which is keeping everyone warmer in Winter and cooler in Summer. However please remember that cabin is a simple wood construction so it most likely wont be as warm in Winter as your home is so we do ask people to pack a few warmer clothes (& definitely some Slippers!) and maybe use it as an excuse to get cosy under a blanket with someone!

Mobile signal has improved drastically in the past few years and we are able to easily stream films & shows to our devices using 4G - perfect for a lazy day in bed! Weve also been able to work remotely here as the connection is strong enough to support video calls.

We also have a large supply of DVDs and books in the cabin for cold or wet days that you might not want to go out - so stay in and curl up on our big sofas! Guest access Guest access
The place is all yours during your stay and in addition to this theres a small shop launderette (great after a day mountain biking or hill walking) & well equipped playground on site. Sadly the pub on site was devastated by a huge fire in Oct 2018 and will be closed for the foreseeable future whilst it is rebuilt. As its Grade II listed though this is taking some time to get sorted.
We can recommend alternative venues and taxis. Please ask us for more info or check the guidebook at the Cabin.

Larger shops / supermarkets and all tourist attractions are accessible by car. Most things are about 20 mins drive away (a perfect opportunity to take in the scenery!). There is a dedicated space for car parking right outside the cabin so parking should never be an issue. Other things to note Other things to note
Check in is at 3 pm and Check out is at Midday.

At the cabin itself theres no Wifi currently due to the location. There is a mobile mast on the site now though so Mobile signal has been greatly improved and is good enough to stream Sky Netflix etc or work remotely and do video calls.

Due to restrictions from Snowdonia National Park we are obliged to close for the month of November.

We require ALL guests to have a history of positive feedback from previous hosts so please note if you are new to Airbnb or have little/no reviews we are unlikely to accept your booking. As we are not on site we like to have extra confidence in the bookings - please dont take this personally!

Title: Jungle Living Tree House Canopy-Howler Monkey
Description:
The Tadpole Hut offers the perfect cosy autumn escape.

Relax under the stars (you can see them from your pillow!) as you enjoy a break from the routine in a truly beautiful part of South Somerset.

This luxury bolthole is the perfect jumping off point for exploring the area‚Äôs natural beauty and quirky wonders though you may prefer to snuggle up in front of the log burner!

Brand new in 2021 The Tadpole is well insulated with sheep wool and to ensure you are warm whatever the weather! The space The space
The Tadpole was hand built in 2021 by local craftsmen at Blackdown Shepherd Huts in nearby Ilminster to the highest standards. It is fitted with an electric shower small fridge twin induction hob water boiler tap wood burning stove electric radiator and a drop-down double bed. The contents are of an equally high standard and include such thoughtful touches as a mobile phone charging pad smart speaker and a range of board games. WiFi is fast and reliable and the views across the valley are stunning especially at sunrise when the mist sometimes gathers. The garden is fabulous with outside seating and a wildlife pond complete with frogs and newts! Guest access Guest access
The Tadpole sits on the edge of the small pretty village of Kingston with its stone cottages and farmhouses gastro pub and community shop. Parking is available off road a few metres from the Hut.

Title: The Dreamweaver at Treehouse Mountain!
Description:
Welcome to the beautiful Blackdown Hills we are conveniently located between Taunton Wellington and Honiton in a quiet Area of Outstanding Natural beauty and set in 8 acres.

Our aim to try and share our little piece of green countryside with our guests and create a place to relax in comfort away from your everyday cares and stress.


This is the sister unit to the Oak Escape and both can be booked together to create space for parties of up to 8. The space The space
Our small studio/House has been built to latest standards ensuring warmth and comfort during your stay. We have kept the pod as simple as possible making it ideal for couples and young families. The place has been fitted out with all the comforts of home with brands we all know and trust. The hot tub is here for you to enjoy as you wish bathrobes and luxury White Company towels will keep you warm afterwards.

40 ins Tv with DVD and Roberts music system will help entertain on those cold dark winter nights when the views have been covered for the day.

The shower room is stocked with everything you will need during your stay with a Mira shower to reinvigorate while your towel is warmed on the electric towel rail.

The kitchen is compact but fully functioning with ovenfridge freezer and 2 ring hob top. The oven can also be used as a microwave. If coffee is your indulgence the Nespresso machine is there and fully stocked for you to sample the different flavours on offer.

For the energetic guests we have 2 adult bikes located at the pod please bring your own helmets!

With our changeable weather you can decide to eat inside or out with the tables and chairs we have provided. The Weber BBQ is also in situation on the deck when required ( we do put away during the winter but available on request.)

Wireless charging is available along with a docking port for the iPhone with USB plugs available at the bedsides. Other things to note Other things to note
We have tried to put everything we would want in a holiday stay into the house however if something is not available please ask and we will do our best to provide.

Title: White Mountains Heated Treehouse PLUS Campsites!
Description:
Located in an unspoiled corner of North Devon and nestled in undisturbed ancient woodland with outstanding valley views sits Wampford Woodland Retreat. Our luxury cabin comes beautifully crafted and styled inside-out with many features including a private hot tub. This is the perfect idyllic retreat!
Wampford Woodland Retreat offers a peaceful and quiet setting yet is only 30 minutes from the coastline. Our cozy cabin is the perfect getaway to enjoy a wood cabin holiday here in Devon. The space The space
Wampford Woodland Retreat offers a unique luxury way to get away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Amazing views await you at your wooden cabin and if you wish to wander and explore feel free to do so with over 50 acres of ancient woodland along the river Mole to enjoy!
Your private hot tub awaits you on your large front balcony and behind the cabin you will find an impressive hammock perfect for stargazing in and sipping your favourite beverage with your favourite person bliss! Other things to note Other things to note
Sensible shoes reccomended for the walk from the car park to the cabin.

Title: Phelps Pharm, I Was Almost A Treehouse
Description:
Relax in this beautiful quirky cabin which was completed in 2021.

Exposed beams arched doors and a wood burner. The master bedroom has an en-suite and behind a bookshelf is a hidden bunk room.

Guests can enjoy 3 acres of private grounds with a stream bubbling through it and a lake with jetty and rowing boat.

Hot tub available upon request and at extra cost.

Dogs welcome.

Bampton is a lovely foodie village just five minutes walk away.

Attractions nearby.

Checkin/out Monday or FridayThe space
Applejacks is a charming cosy gem which is accessed through private gates off a country lane and down a drive to the former stone sheep barn which is full of wood and rustic features. It is laid out as follows:

Inside:
-Porch/boot room with hand made sheep mosaic on the floor and store cupboard with washing machine.

-The main living area has high ceilings exposed oak features and a wood burner/baking stove with two comfy chairs and colourful bean bags at one end. There is a writing table that is perfect for anyone needing to work on a laptop. At the other end is a rustic dining table dresser and brand new kitchen (microwave dishwasher). There is a Dulcimer should guests wish to learn a medieval string instrument.

-The master bedroom is entered through an arched door. There is an en-suite bathroom with walk in shower. You can hear the trickle of the stream as you fall asleep.

-Behind the bookshelf leading off the lounge is a small secret bunk bed room with colourful wallpaper perfect for kids or extra guests.

-There is a cloakroom/toilet off the lounge.

Outside:
-French doors lead out onto a large partially covered hardwood deck with comfortable sofas on one side and an oak dining table on the other. View of the stream and surrounding nature and complete privacy. The barn is surrounded in formal lawns and there are also three acres of private grounds for guests to exclusively explore and enjoy. Why not sit around a fire and cook marshmallows?

Next to the stream is a two person oak swing seat and pond it is a perfect spot for enjoying the sight and sounds of the stream or to watch the kids play in the water.

Across a stone bridge is a small orchard and grasslands. At the other end of the field guests can discover a lake with a path running around it. There is a jetty and rowing boat for guests to use at their own risk.

Guests can enjoy outdoor fires and there is also a clay oven perfect for pizzas meat and jacket potatoes.

There is another picnic table in the field.


Additionally:

-Hot tub upon request and at extra charge

-Dogs are welcome but not in bedrooms or on furniture.

-Good wifi

-Logs are provided

-Outdoor shower

-Short breaks (check in/out Fridays and Mondays)

-No TV

-Towels and bed linen provided

-Parking for two cars

-All ground floor apart from one step from porch into the barn

-Washing machine

-Highchair and cot bed

-Hairdryer

-Linen/towels provided

-Payment by bank transfer please. Guest access Guest access
Private parking for two cars next to the property. Other things to note Other things to note
The lake and stream are not fenced off so children must be accompanied at all times. There is a rowing boat for guest to use but it is done so completely at the guests risk and should not be used by anyone under 18.

Please note that sometimes sheep are in the field so dogs should be kept under control at these times. Thank you.

Title: White Mountains Treehouse
Description:
Setup with everything you may need including bedding and towels. With a double bedroom bathroom and sofa bed this is perfect for a romantic hide away bolt hole or a place for family adventure. Fully equipped kitchen including fridge/freezer slow cooker microwave cosy log-burner and a stocked wood store. Dining inside or out on the decking; tables and chairs are provided and a private bbq and firepit on the seated patio area for those late summer nights stargazing with a nice glass of wine. The space The space
Cabin Morgan is set back from a quiet lane on a smallholding between the peaceful villages of Pont Robert and Meifod. Tranquil and idyllic with stunning views of the rolling hills of Wales it has 10 acres of private farmland to stroll around. Locally designed with solar power filtered water from a bore hole and local welsh sheep providing wool insulation; this wooden cabin provides a more environmentally thoughtful way to stay.
Dogs are welcome at a fee of ¬£5 on arrival and BYDB (bring your own dog bed). One well behaved dog is extremely welcome but please contact us should you have more.
We have tried to make the cabin feel like a home from home. A welcome pack with the basics (tea coffee milk bread and bacon etc.) will be waiting for you on your arrival to start you on your holiday. Please let us know of any special requests e.g Soya Milk or gluten free bread.

Title: NORTH DECK CABIN 3 - Sea View, Air/Con, Private
Description: Set amidst beautiful Shropshire countryside and sat overlooking an amazing lake. The stunning Market Towns of Shrewsbury and Church Stretton are only a ten minute drive while Ludlow can be reached in around 20 minutes. Beautiful Surroundings set on a tranquil lake near to the Shropshire Hills with plenty of walks including The Times number one walk for the 2018 New Year being from Picklescott which is just 2 miles up the lane search The Times 20 Great walks for the new year on the internet The space The space\nWith beautiful surroundings and set on a tranquil lake our log cabin has 1 large bedroom with a separate bathroom and an open plan Kitchen/Dining/Lounge area. Plenty of space outside with its private parking and wrap around veranda to enjoy the views of the lakes from! It has been beautifully decorated and furnished by a local interior designer to a high standard.There is cake tea coffee milk and sugar waiting for you on your arrival . Guest access Guest access\nYou can walk around the lakes but please do not use the owners private garden area.

Title: Unique tree house on Lake Malchiner See
Description:
Our cabins are set in 12 acres of private land that we use for our heavy horses.
We have three cabins and they all have their own hot tubs .
Our site is a quiet site so no parties or loud noises. A place to relax and unwind. The space The space
We have three cabins and they are located down a drive surrounded by heavy horses and countryside. Great walks from the cabins Other things to note Other things to note
We allow only one well behaved dog in our cabin but due to having live stock and electric fences we ask that dogs are kept on a lead and alway clear up after your dog x
Never leave your dog unattended in the cabin at any time.

Title: Innatural Land
Description:
Willow log cabin is a perfect escape in this tranquil setting in rural Suffolk here at Kingfishers Cretingham. This lodge offers open plan living with a hot tub in the secluded private garden where guests can enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

This spacious one bedroom log cabin is perfectly situated within our stunning 120 acres of Country Park. It is ideal for up to two guests. The en-suite has a roll top bath with separate shower basin and WC. The space The space
Guests can enjoy the peace and tranquility offered here at Kingfishers yet have plenty to do both on their doorstep and within a short drive or cycle.

From your doorstep you can enjoy a 9 hole parkland golf course restaurant cafe kayak and boat hire and nature trail. Kingfishers really does offer the very best of the Suffolk Countryside not a vehicle noise or street lamp in sight yet only 30 minutes from the amazing coastal towns of Aldeburgh and Southwold 20 minutes from Ipswich Stowmarket and Woodbridge and only 8 minutes to the popular town of Framlingham.

Title: Finca Valeria treehouses Jungle
Description: A peaceful secluded light bright and warm cabin surrounded by fields with horses countryside views a mile and a half outside of picturesque Slapton Slapton Lea Nature reserve and the beach. The cabin has a sofa table and chairs TV small kitchen area and a cosy bedroom at the back with a double bed and bunks. It is on the edge of our playing field area and has its own fenced garden space. The bathroom; shower toilet and basin are in the building next door (@20 yards). The space The space\nThe cabin is situated in our large garden and field on the side of the valley. You can be lulled to sleep with the sounds of the nature and bask in the afternoon sun that keeps the cabin naturally super cosy. The cabin is simple but beautifully peaceful tranquil and the setting is idyllic. \u202c \u202aIn the cabin you will find a comfy double size bed bunk beds a sofa a small kitchen area with an area for making drinks simple suppers and breakfasts and hooks to hang clothes. There is a kettle toaster a small fridge freezer mini hob mini sink with cold water tap cutlery crockery and glasses coffee tea and breakfast jars of cereal. There is also a combination microwave which can be used like an oven. \u202c \u202aAll bedding is supplied along with towels and soap and there is an electric heater to keep you warm and cosy. During the cooler months you may wish to bring warm socks and/or slippers too. There is a small TV in the cabin but perhaps you would rather immerse yourself in nature...\u202c

Title: Women's Spring Cottage in the House
Description:
This delightful holiday pod is a great choice for a small family with many pretty villages nearby and within easy reach of the coast. Its located on the grounds of the local favourite pub: The George & Dragon.

Features:
HOT TUB IS HERE!
- Access to large open grounds with free range hens on site
- Fully-stocked kitchen with four burner gas hob microwave fridge and freezer
- Brand new furnishings and decorations
- Modest shower cubicle toilet and heated towel rail

Title: Stylish barn with pool near Horsham, West Sussex
Description:
The Lodge is newly built and located in the Royal Forest of Dean in our own grounds separate from the main house. It has a spacious lounge / kitchen area. There is a large bedroom with en-suite and super king bed or option of 2 singles. Benefits include a large patio for guests with views across the countryside. Ideal for those who want a relaxing break. There is access to the Forest from the garden gate. Social distancing comes naturally in the woods. Parking is within security gates. The space The space
The Lodge is ideally suited to explore the Forest of Dean with miles of off-road walks and cycle tracks. There are plenty of local places to eat and tourist attractions nearby such as Taurus Crafts Puzzle Wood Clear-well Caves and Steam Railways. Gloucester Quays and Chepstow are about 20 miles drive or by train from Lydney Station. Guest access Guest access
Guests have their own designated patio and garden area and parking space. The Host‚Äôs garden is out of sight within their acre of grounds and their dogs are kept separate from the guest‚Äôs area. Other things to note Other things to note
The Lodge also offers respite breaks to carers. We value their commitment and dedication. The Hosts have not received any money from central government for this project. Instead they rely on the generosity of individuals such as yourself who are paying guests. When you stay a percentage of money paid subsidises future carers staying at the Lodge experiencing a well deserved peaceful retreat.

Title: Cosy Barn with a Vineyard View
Description:
**PRICE IS INCLUSIVE OF 15% AIRBNB FEE AND CLEANING FEES**

Nestled between the thriving literary town of Hay-on-Wye and the stunning Black Mountains of Brecon Beacons National Park this property with its fairytale garden and babbling brook is the best of both worlds. Spend quality time with family and friends in both town and country. With beautiful walks and outdoor activities aplenty as well as bookshops galleries and restaurants just minutes away there really is something for everyone. The space The space
Tucked away in a charming village and surrounded by woodland Walnut Tree Cottage is a traditional Welsh stone cottage dating from 1881 with a modern extension housing a large master suite and a bright airy kitchen.

French doors lead to a fairytale garden bursting with flowers herbs and fruit in the summer. Guests can listen to the babbling brook (which leads to an 8ft waterfall) explore the peaceful woodland and make a pizza in the outdoor oven all year around. Expect to see kingfishers trout and even otters!

The cosy living room - featuring a woodburner - flows intothe reception room and kitchen allowing guests to spend time together or apart. The charming downstairs bedroom sleeps three in single beds under the eaves with space for a baby in a travel cotprovided upon request. A utility room contains a washer/dryer iron and ironing board a family-sized fridge and toys for the little ones. Upstairs all three bedrooms feature king-size beds and the large master bedroom benefits from an en-suite bathroom. All beds are made up with 300 thread count hotel quality linen. 

The cottage has been lovingly decorated to a high specification in a calming palette. The property whilst not large is big on style with furniture and fittings from all over the world.

We have tried to think of everything a guest might need from shampoo soap conditioner and body lotion to laundry supplies phone chargers and stationery so you can spend more time relaxing and less time worrying about the small stuff.

A carefully curated selection of books are provided for the book lovers drawn to Hay as well as a range of board games for rainy days.

We have amenities catering for families with children including travel cot with bedding high chair childrens crockery microwave bottle steriliser stair gates bed guards baby body wash and toys.

There is Wifi throughout the property and a SmartTv including Netflix for rainy days. 

This property accommodates 7 people comfortably but may be booked to a maximum of 9 people (subject to additional cost). Guest access Guest access
You will have access to the whole cottage. One wardrobe in the master suite and a number of cupboards in the utility room contain our personal belongings and supplies and are locked.

There is space for two medium sized cars to park in the drive - however there is a public right of way alongside the drive and must remain unobstructed. Other things to note Other things to note
Whilst we provide a number of amenities for children this property has stairs sharp corners and expensive furnishings - it is not baby or child-proofed and children must be supervised at all times. There is a brook that runs alongside the property and whilst there is not a sudden drop it is unfenced. The brook ends in an 8ft waterfall and though gated a determined child would likely be able to get around it. It is therefore a condition of booking that we ask all guests to accept full responsibility for supervising their children at all times.

Title: Countryside location with hot tub and sauna
Description:
The Wendy House: a traditional 1960s cedar wood chalet that was renovated in 2017. Beautifully furnished in a luxurious yet Wendy House style. Magical for children. Stuffed full of lovely vintage things. It is situated in a very sunny corner of a quiet family run site 10 minutes stroll to the beach. Near great pubs perfect after a beach walk. Warm and cosy. No WiFi have a detox: talk walk play games re-charge rest...
I really do try and make it special for you come and stay :) The space The space
COVID UPDATE
To keep you your family and myself as safe as possible during this unprecedented time The Wendy House will have to look a little different inside. Following government guidelines anything that cannot be properly cleaned will be removed from the property. Sadly this will mean toys/games/leaflets etc. A different type of welcome pack will also be left. But please be reassured that when you enter The Wendy House it will be a safe environment for you.

The Wendy House is a traditional 1960s chalet stuffed full of vintage and beautiful things alongside some wonderful vintage photography of Heacham as a seaside resort in the 50s/60s. The Wendy House is a very peaceful space that allows you to unplug from your busy world - we have no wifi... allowing you to detox from technology recharge your batteries and be mindful of whats out there again...


I personally look after The Wendy House from the messages you receive right down to the cleaning and the laundry I like it this way so I can ensure that when you arrive it is all looking its beautiful best. It is very suitable for families friends couples and a luxurious base for one...

The Wendy House and The Summerhouse can be booked together for bigger group gatherings...

I have taken my time renovating this little place which includes a beautiful natural slate floor to the kitchen and shower room wood effect tiled shower shutters to some of the windows quality pocket sprung king size bed with beautiful bed linen - some pillowcases are gorgeous vintage ones. I have put black out blinds to both bedrooms to aid your sleep and for little ones to sleep...giving you some quiet time!

The shower room has a wood effect shower slate floor shutters to the windows a sink and toilet it also has a large heated towel rail to keep you cosy.
The kitchen is equipped with everything you need to make some lovely dinners..with carefully chosen crockery and tableware. I supply a welcome pack of a continental style breakfast to last you a couple of days...

Electric fully programmable radiators will keep you warm when it gets chilly. The chalet receives sunshine all day so you can bask in it whilst reading that book you have always wanted to read! We have a super comfy corner sofa to stretch out on.

The veranda has outdoor lighting and very comfortable natural wicker furniture.

The chalet is located in the far corner of the site to the side of the chalet there is a great place for children to make dens...I have included things for a mud kitchen to help them with their adventures. There are a selection of traditional games and family board games.

My idea for this little place is to help create a traditional seaside family holiday a quiet sharing space for friends a romantic retreat for two or a luxurious break for one all where lovely memories are made...

I think it ticks all the boxes.

Come and play house at The Wendy House!

The Wendy House turns into The Winter Wendy House in October. I dress it with velvet cushions fur throws wintry bits and lots of candlelight (safe battery operated variety!) making it a very special place to get in the mood for this time of year. Norfolk is particularly beautiful in Autumn and Winter - the roads beaches and pubs are very much quieter. The cabin is super cosy with thermostatically controlled electric radiators and the electric stove. Come and get all snugged up! Guest access Guest access
The chalet is all for you... Other things to note Other things to note
The Wendy House is on a site with other chalets to get to it there is approximately 100 steps from the parking area to the front door.

No dogs are allowed on the site - not my rules :(

A basic welcome pack will be provided

No smoking in the chalet please...

If you wish to use my highchair please book this PRIOR to your arrival. Sadly due to Covid it is essential to bring your own travel cot

I supply towels (not beach towels) tea towels cleaning products cloths hand wash.

I will make up the beds that will be used and a spare pack of linen on top of any beds that are not used.

Title: ‚ÄúThe Stable - self contained modern conversion‚Äù
Description:
Detached 3 bedroom Luxury Holiday Lodge with decking and Hot Tub. Situated on Misty Bay on the water ski lake. The Lodge is in fantastic condition. With double glazing and central heating you are assured a comfortable stay.
Our Lodge has a modern open plan interior with fully equipped kitchen with under counter fridge and under counter freezer. microwave washer dishwasher. master bedroom has a king size bed and TV en suite. the second bedroom with twin beds and Third with bunk beds. The space The space
This is an ideal location to explore the varied attractions of this part of Lincolnshire from leisure to heritage attractions. From water sports to shopping there is something for everyone.
Tattershall Lakes Holiday Park you will find jet ski and water ski lakes fishing lakes a adventure playground gym swimming pool 2 restaurants and bars. 2019 arrival of a splash pool and Beach with Sky Bar. All set within 360 acres of park and woodland. Guest entertainment passes can be obtained if you want them at Guest Services once you arrive Guest access Guest access
You have full use of club house swimming pool. And you can book jet skis and water assault course which is great fun Other things to note Other things to note
All towels are not supplied
Club passes are available from office at a minimum cost

Title: Trinity: luxury lodge in a stunning, lake location
Description:
Set in the peaceful hamlet of Ward Green in the heart of the Suffolk countryside Long Thatch Lodge is a charming retreat for two people looking for the perfect place to enjoy a relaxing break.

The Lodge is a great base to explore Suffolk‚Äôs historic towns houses gardens heritage coast nature reserves and countryside.

It offers a cosy and tranquil stay with its own private garden with secluded outdoor seating areas to watch the abundant local wildlife. The space The space
Guest Reassurance
The lodge is totally separate from our cottage with its own driveway entrance and garden. Self check-in/out is available enabling you to be totally independent.
We follow Airbnb‚Äôs enhanced cleaning protocol which was developed with expert guidance. Here are a few highlights:
- sanitise high-touch surfaces down to the doorknobs
- use cleaners and disinfectants approved by global health agencies and wear protective gear to help prevent cross-contamination
- clean each room using extensive cleaning checklists
- provide extra cleaning supplies so you can clean as you stay
Should you need any assistance or further information there is a comprehensive Info Guide inside the lodge as well as contact numbers should you need us!


Downstairs
Front stable door opens onto hallway with pamment brick flooring and steep paddle staircase.
Open plan living/dining area and a well equipped modern kitchen (including electric oven hob fridge microwave Lavazza coffee machine toaster and kettle).
Stylish corner sofa with a large flat screen TV DVD player bluetooth speaker & DAB radio. Dining table with two chairs.
Bi-fold doors open onto a sunny decking area with outdoor light seating along with picnic table/benches overlooking the small orchard and fields beyond. In the living/dining area there is also a wood burning stove making those chillier months much cosier.

Upstairs
Comfortable oak-based double bed with deep Tempur mattress which aids independent sleeping. There is space to hang clothes and a chest of drawers as well as a wall-mounted flat screen TV. There is also a retro style desk electric fan for those warm nights.
The recently redesigned bathroom has a full walk in shower hand basin with mixer tap and WC.
All 100% Egyptian cotton bed linen towels are provided.
Heating throughout the lodge is electric (manually adjustable) with constant hot water. Other things to note Other things to note
Electric heating and hot water is included
Unlimited superfast WiFi available
Wood for log burner provided
Self check in/out using lockbox if required
A small welcome gift is provided as well as filtered water fresh milk tea coffee sugar.
Also provided for use during your visit are: books dvds games puzzles and jigsaws.

Title: The Retreat Sauna + Hot Tub Boutique Rooms
Description:
Ash log cabin is a spacious two bedroom lodge perfectly situated within our stunning 120 acres of Country Park at Kingfishers Cretingham. It is ideal for up to four guests and benefits from having a secluded garden with private hot tub.

Guests can enjoy the peace and tranquility offered here at Kingfishers yet have plenty to do both on their doorstep and within a short drive or cycle.

1 well behaved pet accepted The space The space
Ash log cabin features and open plan living area for all guests to socialise together a master bedroom with en-suite shower room a twin bedroom and a family bathroom.

From your doorstep you can enjoy a 9 hole parkland golf course restaurant cafe kayak and boat hire and nature trail. Kingfishers really does offer the very best of the Suffolk Countryside not a vehicle noise or street lamp in sight yet only 20 minutes from the amazing coastal towns of Aldeburgh and Southwold 20 minutes from Ipswich Stowmarket and Woodbridge and only 8 minutes to the popular town of Framlingham Guest access Guest access
Parking is outside of the log cabin and there is a key safe next to the door.

Title: Forest Den
Description:
Mistys Place is a well maintained two bedroom lodge with enclosed decking complete with outdoor seating it is secure for dogs and children.Set on Bridlington Links golf course in peaceful surroundings. Just a short walk from Sewerby House gardens and zoo. Included in your package are four adult passes into Sewerby Hall and grounds. East Riding of Yorkshire approximately 28 miles north of Hull & 34 miles east of York. The space The space
Our well presented two bedroom 1.5 bathroom cabin is set in the peaceful woodland setting of Bridlington Links golf and leisure estate next door to the historic Sewerby Hall just outside the historic harbour town of Bridlington.
Mistys Place is a single storey open plan lodge a real home from home.It has a well stocked kitchen even Jamie Oliver would be impressed prepare your food looking out towards the woods you may even see a deer wandering past! Double doors lead out onto the enclosed decking where you can sit on the outdoor furniture and enjoy the peace and quiet while enjoying the ample wildlife.
A short stroll takes you to the Bridlington Links golf club / 18 hole golf and leisure Estate prices available in cabin.
A side gate in Heritage park takes you into Sewerby hall gardens and zoo remember to use your passes to access all areas included in your package. There is a quaint dog and child friendly cafe.
Then either walk along the cliff tops or along the beach into Bridlington or board the land train for a scenic trip into the town of Bridlington.
Other places of interest Danes Dyke short drive to Cayton Bay Filey Scarborough and 32 miles from Whitby.
The whole cabin is available to guests the lounge has a smart tv complete with Netflix /Amazon and free view/DVD player small selection of films books games available. The master bedroom also has smart tv with Netflix/Amazon. Wi fi available.

Title: Water's Edge
Description:
A Tiny House off-grid Shepherds Hut with panoramic views of the spectacular Brecon Beacons. Accessed by its own gated lane and set in a private paddock Oliveduck Hut is the perfect retreat for couples or singles who prefer their own company. An ideal ‚Äòbase camp‚Äô as you explore the National Park and surrounding area. Light a fire and get lazy chill out in the hot-tub star-gaze at the incredible night skies or just take in the majestic Pen y Fan as you plan (or recover from) your ascent. The space The space
Inside:
A uniquely designed carefully crafted and wonderfully cosy Shepherd‚Äôs Hut / Tiny House clad in cedar with oak-framed double-glazing. The Hut is set in its own paddock about 200 metres from your nearest neighbour (your hosts Tim and Sarah). The floor-to-ceiling picture window looks out to Pen y Fan while a side-door takes you to a decked terrace that opens onto rolling pastures and an equally stunning view. The Hut really feels like a miniature home-from-home and is finished to a very high specification: wood burning stove oak floor very comfortable double-bed gas oven and hob fridge (with small ice box) sink TV Bluetooth speaker table and chairs and WiFi. Dressing gowns slippers and eco-washing products are all included.


Outside:
The paddock‚Äôs parking area and walkways are gravelled. The decking terrace has a table and chairs and a Weber gas BBQ (with grill and hot plate/plancha). The unheated WC/shower room is only 10 metres from the Hut and has a composting toilet and hot shower. Outside on its rear wall is a large sink with hot and cold running water. There‚Äôs a picnic bench on the grass a bench beneath the tree near the stream and deck chairs. And not forgetting a two-person wood-fired hot-tub that we‚Äôll fill with water ahead of your arrival.

The paddock is located in a grazing field with a turning area established trees and hedgerows and a stream. Guests are welcome to use this field during their stay.

Off-grid:
The Hut‚Äôs electrics are powered by solar energy and a 12v power supply. There are two USB charge points and a car-type 12v socket. Unfortunately there‚Äôs no capacity for 240v devices like hair dryers and straighteners but we‚Äôre happy to charge your laptops for you. The 4G WiFi occasionally dips to 3G. The hob oven shower and BBQ all run on bottled gas.

Heating for the Hut and hot tub comes from wood-fired stoves and you‚Äôll have more than enough kindling and seasoned wood to last. A fire pit is available to hire.

There‚Äôs hot and cold running water in the shower and outside sink. Please use only the eco-friendly shampoo conditioner soap and washing-up liquid provided. Running water is available in the Huts sink. This runs off an electric pump supplied from canisters kept under the sink. It‚Äôs not heated but you can fill canisters with hot water from the outside sink if you need to.

Other:
You can lock bicycles or motorcycles to the base of the decking area. We can supply a strong chain lock and cover. Please contact us in advance if you need dry secure storage.

Title: Standlake Glamping - No2 The Owl Shepherd Hut
Description:
The log cabin has been created to give our guests a private peaceful cosy stay with a rustic feeling of getting away from it all. There are stunning views of Dartmoor from your decking where you can enjoy a glass of wine on the sofa surrounded by fur rugs & pillows.

The combination of Beaches and Moorland are beautiful areas to explore with something for everyone!

Alternatively listen to the crackle of the log burner whilst peacefully watching your favourite movies. The space The space
You are situated in a sheltered sunny valley where you can look down on the birds of prey flying around and the lambs chasing each other. It is so very peaceful and relaxing sat on the decking soaking up the view.

It is great to get away from it all but in case of rainy days there is also a wall mounted TV which has no areal only TV via the internet so you can enjoy net flicks/amazon prime etc. Occasionally we can have a poor signal due to being so rural but most of the time it works fine! There is WIFI in the Log Cabin.

The log cabin is a 20minute walk outside the village and quite rural. Take care driving on the lanes as they are quite narrow and challenging at times. Late summer into Autumn is when the farmers cut the hedges which can be frustrating as this reduces the beautiful view. But this is not for long and the peace and tranquillity is still surrounding you.

Dogs are very welcome; it is the perfect place for wonderful walks across Dartmoor National Park. The garden should be secure and private for them unless they are small enough to climb through the gate! Please let me know if you are bringing one on your booking. There is a small charge of ¬£10 per stay if you have one or two dogs (if you have more than two dogs I would be grateful if you would contact me first).

There is an outdoor bath for two in a private garden so you can look up at the stars.
This is my favourite place but it is not for everyone! This is part of your log cabin and included in the price.

There is a hot tub next door which is available occasionally if my cottage is not booked.
Please feel free to ask and if it is available it is ¬£25 for a two hour session. I will only be able to confirm its availability when you have arrived.
My guest tell me they are loving the bath and would rather it to the hot tub! Other things to note Other things to note
Well behaved Dogs are very welcome. There is a hose and a dog gate to help you keep them clean and dry. If you could bring your own dog beds and keep them off your bed and the sofa I would be most grateful.

The double sofa bed is small which is why I have allowed for only one guest but it can fit two. If you want a fourth person to stay it is an extra ¬£10 a night.

If you do use the sofa bed I am afraid you cannot use the log burning stove as the bed gets too close - you do not need it for heating as there is a radiator anyway - but it looks and smells lovely if there is just two of you.

There is an outside field kitchen under cover which consists of an small oven two hot plates and a chicken rotisserie (which is amazing!). I am very grateful if you could leave this clean on departure to avoid a cleaning fee. There is a small combination microwave/cooker/grill inside the log cabin too.

The bathroom is heated by the sun and has a wonderfully hot shower in an open rustic wet room - it is surprisingly pleasurable! The Eco Loo is a type of waterless toilet that separates urine from solid waste. Urine can is diverted through a flexible pipe to an external soak away area. This is cleaned and made fresh for all my guests and is environmentally friendly.

You have your own two person external bath which is hidden away in your private garden with fairy lights and candles - a wonderful experience you simply must try!

There is a fire pit that you can sit around in your garden you will need to bring your own logs for this. Great for roasting marshmallows and can be used to bbq food but you will need to bring your own charcoal and there is no temperature control so can be challenging...

Occasionally I rent out my cottage next door too.

Title: Best Log Cabin
Description:
Glamping is a new venture for us here at Gallops Farm Holiday Cottages. We guarantee youll experience the same high standard in our glamping accommodation as our guests staying in our cottages.

Peace and tranquillity await you in Chanctonbury View our lovingly built Shepherds Hut. Sleeping two guests this cosy abode has beautiful far-reaching views across to Chanctonbury Ring.

Youll love the luxury of your own hot tub tucked right beside the Shepherds Hut. The space The space
There is an open plan living/kitchen area where you can sit and admire the view. The en-suite bathroom has a relaxing rain shower. The kitchen is well equipped with hob microwave fridge kettle and toaster. The living area has a 32inch smart TV. Guest access Guest access
Gallops Farm Holiday Cottages is based at Gallops Farma family working farm. We are situated at the top of Findon Village (Stable Lane). You have the benefit of being able to walk directly off the farm onto the South Downs or down into the village within 20 minutes you will reach a choice of pubs and restaurants in the village. Other things to note Other things to note
We have been welcoming guests to Gallops Farm Holiday Cottages since 2013. Glamping is a new venture for us and I take pride in ensuring every guest has the best experience during their stay.

Title: Little Cowdray Glamping - The Log Cabin
Description:
Hidden away privately behind electric gates a truly delightful private parkland style setting of landscape mature gardens with views over open countryside. The Retreat is a perfect place to unwind the one bedroom cabin boasts a Kitchenette with Cooking Facilities and utensils a King Size Bed and Shower room Terrace over looking natural pool and fields private parking for 2 cars or large vans
Milk tea & coffee included along with Cereals & Crumpets.
Toiletries provided The space The space
Completely private for adults only and well hidden in a beautiful mature garden with shaped lawns and pathways and a fine variety of superb specimen trees which include Silver Birch Spruce Horse Chestnut and an Oak tree over 400 years old. The village with local Pub within walking distance 3 Local churches and beautiful walks ideally situated close to Henley-in-Arden & Stratford upon Avon. Close to NEC and Birmingham International Train Stations Guest access Guest access
Guests will use a safe box to check in you are able to Park privately and securely behind electric gates you then then have the use of the entire cabin to yourself and are completely isolated. Other things to note Other things to note
Please note the Retreat is solely for adults only no children or pets.

Title: Gorgeous cosy winter getaway in rural Kent
Description: The cosy cabin is situated on the edge of the New Forest. Perfect for bike riding walking and horse riding. There are many country pubs nearby Bournemouth beach is a 20 minute drive. Mudeford beach is a 15 minute drive where crabbing is popular! Nearby is the New Forest wildlife park and just down the road is Liberty‚Äôs Owl Raptor and reptile centre. Burley is only a 10 minute drive away too where there‚Äôs lots to see and do! The space The space\nThis space is a handcrafted log cabin made by us it is rustic and authentic. Downstairs is the living area with a lounge wood burner and kitchen area. The bathroom is situated off the lounge. Upstairs is the cosy bedroom. Outside there is a lovely veranda where you can relax in the evening in one of the rocking chairs. In the back garden there are two decking areas. One has a wood fired hot tub on with slouch chairs and a little table. The other decking has outdoor games beanbags blankets and two bikes for guests to use as they please with helmets also provided. On the grass area there is a bbq and a small fire pit. Other things to note Other things to note\nThe log cabin is for people who enjoy natural environments with nature surrounding you. From owls landing on the roof at night to the red deer running through the back field. This property is located in the National park and is for outdoor people. There will be spiders moths butterflies and bees. Anything to do with nature you are sure to get a glimpse of what life is like living in the countryside.

Nestled near the village of Wolvey in the Warwickshire countryside.
Outstanding views across the fishing lakes.
Quiet and secluded yet close to nearby amenities.
Free Parking directly outside the Lodge.
3 double bedrooms each with ensuite bathrooms
kitchen and dining area and outside decking area with PRIVATE hot tub (Please note- additional charge of ¬£30 per stay apply due to cleaning regulations. )

Title: Milestone House
Description:
Self-entrepreneur specializing in furnished tourist rentals I offer you luxurious accommodations so that you have a wonderful stay. Looking forward to seeing you again during your stay ! The space The space
Chalet La Romance is located in a private residence called La Chute des Eaux 10 minutes from Reims. In a quiet natural and close to amenities you can fully enjoy your stay.

The cottage is composed of :
A living room area with a sofa bed accompanied by a beautiful kitchen equipped interior.
Bedroom : 1 double bed with en-suite bathroom.

The accommodation includes an outdoor INTEX PURE SPA SC-20 jacuzzi with massaging jets and Bubble Jets air jets along with a garden furniture overlooking the pond accessible for fishing.

The chalet is equipped with free WIFI towels linens and toiletries. You will have access to the ponds of the estate. Cleaning fees are directly included in the total displayed price. A damage deposit of 500‚Ç¨ is required at the entrance of the premises against receipt with signature.Guest access
Enjoy access to the entire home including the garden and pond.Other things to note
Sanitary / Vaccinal pass is not required.

Breakfast option: 15‚Ç¨ per night.

Title: The Pigsty
Description:
A unique and romantic hideaway Quarrymans Cottage is dinner on the roof terrace watching the sunset over Lyme Bay & Charmouth stargazing from the luxury freestanding bath epic views from the double shower reading under the old oak tree BBQs & firepits leisurely walks to The Anchor at Seatown via Golden Cap or the coastal path the sound of birdsong the glimpse of a deer curling up in front of the wood burner in winter. It is a tranquil & heavenly escape from the bustle of daily life. The space The space
Quarryman‚Äôs Cottage is a beautiful and newly renovated one bedroom cottage that was built in the mid 1800‚Äôs (it had never previously had mains electric or running water).

Sitting over 600 feet above sea level The Quarrymans Cottage has the most stunning far reaching views of Lyme Bay Lyme Regis and Charmouth. As an upside down house it makes the most of those views. The open plan living and kitchen area on the top floor opens via French doors onto a large roof terrace in one direction and a paved terrace in the other. The bedroom and large luxury ensuite bathroom are downstairs.

It has been thoughtfully designed to create a light and airy property with large window‚Äôs in all rooms and French doors also opening out from the bedroom. It is south west facing guaranteeing you sun all day and the most wonderful sunsets all year round.

The cottage is furnished with an eclectic mix of old and new. Beautiful vintage wood furniture bought from local antique markets. Ercol straight back dining chairs sit beside an antique pine table an old headmasters book cupboard has been loving restored to create a pantry cupboard and an old Teak ships door found on Sanna beach in the Scottish Highlands over 35 years ago adorns the wall. Reclaimed pine joists create the floor in the bedroom and upstairs the original pine boards lovingly restored by the owners. An Oak and powder coated steel spiral staircase from Italy takes you between floors.

The roof terrace is furnished with a heavy solid wood table and benches plus a BBQ. There are 2 bulkhead lights which at night illuminate the surrounding tree‚Äôs creating the feeling that you are sitting within them.

The kitchen is fully kitted out to a high specification with a dishwasher washing machine gas hob electric oven and a gorgeous Belfast sink hidden behind an oak worktop allowing for extra worktop space. It has everything you need to create fabulous home cooked meals if you opt to eat in.

The living area has a 2 seater sofa side table dining table and chairs a beautiful Charnwood wood-burner a large window seat a smart TV with built in DVD player and a bluetooth speaker for listening to music.

The bedroom has a kingsize solid wood bed hotel quality Egyptian cotton sheets and towels two vintage Elm chairs for bedside tables a large antique trunk chest of drawers and a window seat with cushions and blankets.

The large ensuite bathroom has been fitted to a very high standard. A stunning ‚Äòdouble‚Äô shower with far reaching views of Lyme Bay and Charmouth a freestanding bath sits across the corner of the room under both windows allowing for a spot of stargazing the freestanding sink sits upon a piece of reclaimed sycamore and the lighting hints at a nautical theme with stylish bulkheads one of which which can also be dimmed allowing for ‚Äòmood lighting‚Äô whilst taking a bath.

The garden comprises of various different area‚Äôs. The paved terrace is surrounded by a variety of tree‚Äôs and is a great sun trap. The woodland area under two large Oaks tree‚Äôs is perfect for lazy afternoons in the shade reading. The lawned area gets the sun for the whole of the day is a great spot for sun bathing and of course there is the afore mentioned roof terrace. There are two apple trees which provide a constant supply of fruit in the Autumn.

There is currently parking for one car on the lower access level.

Heating during the winter is via the woodburner as well as Haverland Wave electric radiators (with thermostat and timers). Winter bookings come with a basket of wood.

Well behaved dogs are very welcome. Guest access Guest access
Parking for the cottage is on a tarmac area with space for 2 cars and a turning area (shared with guests from the studio). The parking bay for the cottage is in front of the Cedar fence. Other things to note Other things to note
West Bullen is situated 600 feet above sea level and on a hillside. Access via Verriotts Lane is tight in places. Access via Gibbs Lane is fine. The track leading up to the property is a little rough in places and driving slowly is recommended. The driveway into West Bullen and to the parking area is short and steep.

Title: NEW Luxury Remote Kabin + Outdoor Bath!
Description: My place is close to RHAYADER and THE ELAN VALLEY also adjoining THE GILFACH NATURE RESERVE. You‚Äôll love my place because of the coziness the peacefulness of been able to have the freedom to walk and explore our hills of mid wales straight from your door..and only 45 mins to visit the seaside of Aberystwth.. My place is good for couples solo adventurers families (with kids) big groups and furry friends (pets). The space The space\nPlease note due to covid 19..We have now put in place deep cleaning with a fogging machine in between guests in all our holiday properties this takes extra time so our check out times are now at 10 am and check in is now at 4pm ..Also due to covid 19 we will no longer be putting in bathing and hottub towels just hand and tea towels. ...PLEASE LET ME KNOW IF YOU REQUIRE THE HOT TUB in advance of booking your (URL HIDDEN) due to the high demand on the hot tubs i would need to make sure there is one available for you... so i must know prior to you booking ..and you can pay when you are with us ¬£50 for your entire stay with us The Hide Away Ranch is a unique and very fortunate place it is situated in 400 acres of magnificent views overlooking the wye valley it has been stated its like been on top of the world it rises up to 1400 ft on the tops with amazing views walks and rides ideal for star gazing in the evenings and watching the sun setting over the rolling hills while the wildlife is active all around you. You can ramble around the hills at your leisure finding all the sources of the lovely little steams which trickle down through our countryside. where many moons ago the pilgrims would walk to the source of these lovely crystal streams to collect the so said holy water in the pilgrims ampullae. We have been very lucky in finding one ..Then to take the water back to heel sick people from their ailments. We are also neighbouring our local nature reserve which has got nature trials and all the information about our native wildlife in our area they also do childrens activities if you log on to the Gilfach Nature Reserve. You are welcome to bring your own mountain bikes motor bikes off road vehicles where you can go and enjoy the stunning views at your own leisure or if you just want to chilland sit out on the veranda with your glass of wine!! to watch the magnificent birds and wildlife go about their very busy lives. you are now also able to hire a hot tub if you so desired at an extra cost from a little company in our local market town they come out the day before you arrive set it all up for you to jump in on your arrival ..Please note.... the hideaway ranch is situated in the beautiful countryside there is no wi fi and you may find your phone signals are limited in areas but the best of it is that you only need to go 10 mins down the road and you are back into (URL HIDDEN) you have the best of both worlds..\nIf you find that the dates you require for your break have already gone The Hideaway Ranch does have two further sister propertiesHide Away House Rhayader which has installed .. A Red Cedar Wood Far Infared Saunas well as its own log burner and hottub.. it sleeps up to 8 people.. and also The Hide Away Sunrise Sunset yurt which is also with Airbnb and is situated in the same 400 acre Estate..with its own log burner and hottub***. Sometimes in the winter months due to some of our extreme weather conditions ..the water sometimes cuts into our road through no fault of our own its just surface water coming off our fields.. we do maintain our road but when the heavens opening we have to wait for them to close ... xx

Title: Romantic Oak Cabin Berkhamsted
Description:
A stunning luxury hand crafted cabin with your own private wood fired hot tub and wood burning oven located in the beautiful North Cotswold Countryside. A haven to escape to. During the Summer months Jeds Shed is situated in a secret site location on the edge of Mickleton or Broad Campden -on 21st September it will then move to its Winter location with our 4 other cabins on the main site in Mickleton

IF BOOKED CHECK OUR OTHER CABINS - Mirts Mansion DJs Digs Poppys Pad Daisys Den The space The space
The houses have a cosy double bedroom with bifold doors opening onto a small wooden floating deck- a great chill out area for those balmy Summer days. The micro kitchen houses a small fridge with ice box double gas hob and hot and cold water to the sink. On the covered deck you will find your own double wood fired hot tub (emptied and cleaned between all guests) and a wood burner with oven and grill to cook up a scrumptious supper. A flush toilet is accessed from the deck and a unique outside hot water bucket style shower provides washing facilities for the Summer months. The cabins are designed to be off grid with solar powered 12v electric for the fridge lighting and charging your electric devices. In the Winter the cabins will be sited on our campsite where a double shower block is available together with an electric socket to run a heater.Other things to note
We only do change overs on a Monday Wednesday and Friday - we have a minimum 2 night stay. Sunday night is charged at a nominal fee as we understand a number of people only wish to stay 2 nights however if you book Sunday night this does mean you dont need to be up and gone for a 10.00 am check out and can enjoy the facilities for as long as you like on the Sunday.

Title: Luxurious, picture-perfect, stunning treehouse
Description:
The Old Tailors built in 1906 was called Smith and Hobbs set right in the heart of the quintessential Cotswold village of Woodmancote. An area of outstanding nattural beauty. The space The space
The original timber framed and corrugated iron building totalling 75 m2 has been recently sympathetically restored- th einterior reveals a beautifully designed living space contrasting vintage industrial with contemporary modern design producing a truly boutique experience.

The entire building is yours for your stay. You come in through a small porch where you can hang coats into the main space which is double height with large A framed ceiling. Thsi accommodates open plan living with fully equipped kitchen and dining area- everything you need to throw a dinner party- and a cosy nook at the far end with a large sofa and flat screen digital TV - a perfect place to drink coffee and read the papers.

In the kitchen area there is a fridge electric oven and hob dishwasher and Nespresso coffee machine. Farrow and Ball dark blue colour contrasts with the original short blasted wooden tongue and groove cladding that is a feature throughout. As is the vintage and industrial design and fittings with accents of copper.

The original wooden floor has been painted an off white.

The bedroom has a king size bed Egyptian cotton beddings the softest duvet and electric blanket. Mustard yellow linen blinds and seagrass flooring. A cozy room yet with ample space and quirky lighting.

The bathroom equipped with a fantastic copper shower. There is a heated towel railloo and an original vintage basin.

Wifi is fitted throughout the entire space.
